21:35.t: Everyone has to taste death. And We test you all through bad and good (situations) with a trial. And to Us you are to be returned.

21:36.t: And when disbelievers see you, they do nothing but make mockery of you (saying) "Is this the one who talks of your gods?" - while they themselves are the denier of even mentioning the Rahman (All-Merciful).

21:37.t: Man is made of haste. I shall show you My signs, so do not seek haste from Me.

21:38.t: And they say, "When will this promise be (fulfilled), if you are true?"

21:39.t: Only if the disbelievers were to know the time when they will not (be able to) keep off the fire from their faces or from their backs, nor will they be helped.

21:40.t: Rather, it will come upon them suddenly and will baffle them. So they will not be able to turn it back, nor will they be given respite.

21:41.t: And messengers have been mocked at before you. So those who laughed at them were besieged by what they have been mocking at.

21:42.t: Say, "Who will guard you, during night and day, against the Rahman (All-Merciful)?" Rather, to the remembrance of their Lord they are averse.

21:43.t: Or do they have gods who protect them besides Us? They are not able to help even themselves, nor are they allowed by Us to have company.

21:44.t: But We have given benefits to these and their fathers so much so that life prolonged against them. So do they not see that We are coming to the land reducing it from its sides? Then, are they the ones to prevail?

21:45.t: Say, "I simply warn you by revelation, and the deaf do not listen to the call, when they are warned."

21:46.t: And if they are touched by a whiff of the punishment of your Lord, they will certainly say, "Woe to us! We were wrongdoers indeed."

21:47.t: And We shall place scales to do justice on the Day of Judgment. So no one shall be wronged in any way. And even if it (any act, good or evil) is to the measure of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And We are enough to take account.

21:48.t: And We gave Musa and Harun criterion and a light and an advice for the God-fearing,

21:49.t: those who have awe of their Lord, though unseen, and are apprehensive of the Hour.

21:50.t: And this is a blessed advice We have sent down. Is it then you are rejecting it?

21:51.t: And earlier We had given Ibrahim his guidance, and We knew him well,

21:52.t: when he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues you are devoted to?"

21:53.t: They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them,"

21:54.t: He said, "Surely you and your fathers have been in open error."

21:55.t: They said, "Did you come to us with truth or are you of those who make fun?"

21:56.t: He said, No, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who has created them, and I am one of those who bear witness to it.

21:57.t: And I swear by Allah that I will do something to your idols after you are gone, turning your backs."

21:58.t: Then, he turned them into pieces, save the big one of them, so that they may come back to him.

21:59.t: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? He is one of the wrongdoers, indeed".

21:60.t: Some of them said, "We have heard a youth speaking of them. He is called Ibrahim."

21:61.t: They said, 'Then, bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may see".

21:62.t: They said, "Is it you 0 Ibrahim who has done this to our gods?"

21:63.t: He said, "Rather, this is done by this chief of theirs. So, ask them if they were to speak."

21:64.t: So they turned to themselves and said, "In fact, you are the wrongdoers

21:65.t: Then, they reversed their position upside down (saying) "You already knew that they do not speak."

21:66.t: He said, 'Do you then worship, beside Allah, what does neither benefit you in the least nor harm you?

21:67.t: Fie upon you and upon what you worship other than Allah. Do you then not understand?"

21:68.t: They said, " (0 people) burn him and help your gods, if you are to take action."

21:69.t: We said, "0 fire, be cold and safe for Ibrahim."

21:70.t: And they intended to harm him, but We made them the worst losers.

21:71.t: And We rescued him and Lilt towards the land we blessed for all the worlds.

21:72.t: And We blessed him with Islhaq and Ya` qas gift, and each one of them We made righteous.

21:73.t: And We made them the imams who guide (people) under Our command, and We inspired them to do good deeds and to establish , salah and pay zahah. And Us alone they worshipped.

21:74.t: As for Lilt, We gave him wisdom and knowledge and We delivered him from the town that used to do dirty deeds. Indeed, they were the people of evil, the sinners.

21:75.t: And We admitted him to Our mercy. Indeed, He was of the righteous.

21:76.t: And (remember) when he called (for help) earlier, so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the terrible agony,

21:77.t: and helped him against the people who belied Our verses. Indeed, they were the people of evil, therefore, We drowned them all.

21:78.t: And (remember) Dawud and Sulayman, when they were adjudicating about the tillage, when the goats of the people wandered therein grazing, and We were witness to their judgment.

21:79.t: So, We enabled Sulayman to understand it. And to each one of them We gave wisdom and knowledge. And with Dawud We subjugated the mountains that proclaimed the purity of Allah, and the birds as well. And We were the One who did (it).

21:80.t: And We taught him making of armour as dress for you, to protect you from what may harm you (in combat). So are you grateful?

21:81.t: And for Sulayman, (We subjugated) the violent wind that blew under his command to the land in which We placed Our blessings. And We were the One who knew everything.

21:82.t: And from the devils, (We subjugated for him) those who dived in water for him and did jobs other than that. And We were the One who kept watch over them.

21:83.t: And (remember) Ayyub, when he called his Lord saying, "Here I am, afflicted by pain and You are the most merciful of all the merciful."

21:84.t: So, We answered his prayer and removed whatever pain he had, and gave him (back) his family and the like thereof along with them, as a mercy from Our own Self and as a lesson for the worshippers.

21:85.t: And (remember) Ismail and Idris and Dhul-Kifl. Each one of them was of those who observed patience.

21:86.t: And We admitted them to Our mercy. Surely, they were of the righteous.

21:87.t: And (remember) Dhunnun (the man of the fish, namely Yunus), when he walked away in anger and thought that We will never put him to trouble. Then, he called (Us) in depths of darkness saying, "There is no god but You. Pure are You. Indeed I was among the wrongdoers".

21:88.t: So We responded to him and rescued him from the distress. And this is how We rescue the believers.

21:89.t: And (remember) Zakariyya when he called his Lord, "0 my Lord do not leave me alone and You are the best of inheritors."

21:90.t: So, We responded to him and gave him Yahya and made his wife good for him. They used to race towards the good deeds and call Us with hope and fear; and they were humble to Us.

21:91.t: And (remember) her who protected her private part. So, We blew in her (a life) through Our Spirit, and made her and her son a sign for all the worlds. [ 91]

21:92.t: Surely, this is the fraternity of your Faith, a single Faith, and I am your Lor'; so worship Me.

21:93.t: And they split up their ways from one another. All of them have to return to Us.

21:94.t: So, the one who does righteous deeds, while he is a believer, his effort will not be rejected and We are to put it on record.

21:95.t: It is banned for (the people of) a town We destroyed that they come back

21:96.t: until when the Ya'juj and Ma'juj (Gog and Magog) are released, while they run down from every height,

21:97.t: and the True Promise draws near, then suddenly the eyes of the disbelievers shall remain upraised (in terror and they will say,) "Woe to us! We were neglectful to this; rather we were transgressors indeed."

21:98.t: Surely, you and whatever you worship other than Allah are the fuel of Jahannam. There you will have to arrive.

21:99.t: Had they been gods, they would not have arrived at it. And all of them will remain there forever.

21:100.t: There are screams for them therein and they will not hear.

21:101.t: Surely, those for whom the good (news) from Us has come earlier shall be kept far away from it.

21:102.t: They will not hear the slightest of its sound, and they will remain for ever in what their selves desire.

21:103.t: They shall not be grieved by the Biggest Panic, and the angels shall receive them (saying), "This is your day that you had been promised"

21:104.t: the Day when We roll up the sky like a scroll rolls up the writings. As We originated the first creation, We shall bring it back again - a promise (undertaken to be binding) on Us. We are sure to do it.

21:105.t: And We have written in Zabur (Psalms) after the Dhikr (the Torah) that the land will be inherited by My righteous slaves.

21:106.t: Surely, in this (the Qur'an) there is a message conveyed to a people who worship (Allah).

21:107.t: And We have not sent you but as mercy for all the worlds.

21:108.t: Say, "What is revealed to me is simply that your God is One God. So do you submit?"

21:109.t: But, if they turn away, then say (to them), 'I have warned you all alike, and I do not know whether what you have been warned of is near or far.

21:110.t: Surely, He knows what is spoken openly and He knows what you conceal.

21:111.t: And I do not know; perhaps it is a trial for you and an enjoyment for a while."

21:112.t: He (Our Messenger) said, "My Lord, judge with truth. And Our Lord is the Rahman (All-Merciful), the One whose help is sought against what you describe.

22:1.t: O men, fear your Lord. Surely the earthquake of the (destined) Hour is something terrible.

22:2.t: The day you will see it, every suckling female will forget that which she suckled, and every pregnant one shall abort her foetus, and you will see people as if they are drunk, while they are not drunk, but the punishment of Allah is (so) severe.

22:3.t: And among the people there is one who debates about Allah without knowledge and follows every rebellious Satan,

22:4.t: about whom it is destined that if someone takes him as friend, he will misguide him and lead him to the punishment of the Fire.

22:5.t: O men, if you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then (recall that) We created you from dust, then from a drop of semen, then from a clot, then from a piece of flesh - shaped or unshaped - so that We manifest (Our power) to you. And We retain in the wombs whatever We will to a specified term. Then We bring you out as babies, then (We nourish you) so that you reach your maturity. And among you there is one who dies, and among you there is one who is carried to the worst part of the age, so that he knows nothing even after having knowledge. And you see the land dry. Then when We send down water on it, it stirs and swells and puts forth every kind of good looking growth.

22:6.t: That is because Allah is the truth and that He gives life to the dead and that He is powerful to do everything,

22:7.t: and that the Hour (of Doom) has to come in which there is no doubt and that Allah will raise again all those in the graves.

22:8.t: And among men there is one who debates about Allah with no knowledge, no guidance and no book to enlighten,

22:9.t: turning his side away to lead (people) astray from the way of Allah.For him there is disgrace in this world, and We will have him taste the punishment of fire on the Day of Judgment (and will say to him)

22:10.t: "All this is due to what your hands sent ahead, and that Allah is not unjust to His servants."

22:11.t: And among men there is one who worships Allah (standing) on the verge: so if some good thing happens to him, he is satisfied with it, and if a trial befalls upon him, he turns his face back. He loses both this world and the Hereafter. That is the loss which is so obvious.

22:12.t: He prays to someone, instead of Allah, who can neither harm him nor benefit him. That is the error which takes him too far (from the right path).

22:13.t: He, rather, prays to someone whose harm is more likely than his benefit. Wretched is such a patron and wretched is such a companion.

22:14.t: Surely, Allah will admit those who believe and do good deeds into gardens beneath which rivers flow. Surely Allah does what He intends.

22:15.t: If someone thinks that Allah will never help him (the Holy Prophet ) in this world and in the Hereafter, he should stretch a rope to the sky, then cut (Allah's communication) off (from the prophet) and see whether his effort can really remove what irritates (him).

22:16.t: And this is how We have sent it (the Qur'an) down as clear signs, and (the fact is) that Allah takes whom He wills to the right path.

22:17.t: As for those who believe and the Jews and the Sabians and the Christians and the Magians and those who ascribe partners to Allah, Allah will judge between them on the Day of Judgment. Surely Allah is witness to everything.

22:18.t: Have you not seen that to Allah prostrate all those in the skies and all those on the earth, and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the animals and many from mankind? And there are many on whom punishment has become due. And the one whom Allah puts to disgrace, there is none to give him respect. Surely Allah does what He wills.

22:19.t: These are two opponents who have disputed about their Lord. Now, for those who disbelieve, garments from fire shall be tailored, and boiling water shall be poured from over their heads

22:20.t: whereby everything in their bellies, as well as the skins, will be melted.

22:21.t: And for them there are hooked rods of iron.

22:22.t: Whenever, in their anguish, they will intend to come out of it (the fire), they will be turned back to it and (it will be said to them,) "Taste the punishment of burning".

22:23.t: Surely Allah will admit those who believe and do good deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and with pearls. And their dress therein will be (of) silk.

22:24.t: And guided they were to the good word (of faith) and guided they were to the path of the Praised One.

22:25.t: Surely (We will punish) those who disbelieve and prevent (people) from the way of Allah and from Al-Masjid Al-Haram (the Sacred Mosque) which We have made for all men, where residents and visitors are all equal. And whoever intends therein to commit deviation with injustice, We will make him taste a painful punishment.

22:26.t: And (remember) when We pointed out for Ibrahim the place of the House (of Allah) saying, 'Do not associate anything with Me as My partner and purify My House for those who make tawaf (circumambulation around it), and those who perform Qiyam (standing up in worship) and those who perform Ruku' (bowing down) and Sujud (prostration),

22:27.t: and announce among people about (the obligation of) Hajj, so that they should come to you on foot and on every camel turned lean, travelling through every distant hilly pathway,

22:28.t: so that they witness benefits for them and recite Allah's name, in specified days, over the provision He gave them from the cattle - 'So, eat thereof and feed the distressed, the poor.'

22:29.t: Then, they must remove their dirt and fulfill their vows and make tawaf of the Ancient House."

22:30.t: That is (what one should remember), and whoever observes the reverence of things sanctified by Allah, it is good for him with his Lord. And permitted to you are the cattle, except those mentioned to you through recitation (of the verses). So refrain from the filth of the idols and refrain from a word of falsehood,

22:31.t: being upright for (the obedience on Allah, not ascribing any partner to Him. And whoever ascribes a partner to Allah, it is as if he falls down from the sky and the birds snatch him, or the wind drives him away to a far off place.

22:32.t: That is (what one should remember), and if one observes the sanctity of the symbols of Allah, then such things emanate from the piety of the hearts.

22:33.t: And for you there are benefits in them (the cattle) upto a specified time. Then their place of sacrifice is by the Ancient House.

22:34.t: And for every Ummah We prescribed the act of sacrifice, so that they recite Allah's name over the provision He gave them from the cattle. So, your God is One God. Therefore, to Him alone you must submit. And give good news to those who turn to Him with humbleness -

22:35.t: those whose hearts are filled with awe when Allah is remembered, and who observe patience against whatever befalls them, and who are steadfast in Sal, and who spend (in the way of Allah) out of what We have given to them.

22:36.t: And the big animals of sacrifice (like camels) are made by Us among the symbols of Allah for you in which there is much good for your benefit. So recite the name of Allah over them as they are lined up (for sacrifice). Then, once their flanks fall down (after slaughter), eat of them and feed the one who is content and the one who wishes to receive. Thus We have made them (the animals) subjugated to you, so that you may be grateful.

22:37.t: It is neither their flesh nor their blood that reaches Allah, but what reaches Him is the taqwa on your part. Thus He has made them (the animals) subjugated to you, so that you proclaim the glory of Allah for the guidance He gave you. And give good news to those who are good in deeds.

22:38.t: Surely, Allah defends those who believe. Allah does not love any treacherous, ungrateful.

22:39.t: Permission (to fight) is given to those who are fought against, because they have been wronged, and Allah is powerful enough to give them victory.

22:40.t: (They are) the ones who were expelled from their homes without any just reason, except that they say "Our Lord is Allah." And had Allah not repelled some people by means of some others, the monasteries, the churches, the synagogues and the mosques where the name of Allah is recited abundantly would have been demolished. And Allah will definitely help those who help Him. Surely Allah is Powerful, Mighty.

22:41.t: (They are) those who, when We give them power in the land, establish 1Salah, pay Zakah, bid the Fair and forbid the Unfair. And with Allah lies the fate of all matters.

22:42.t: And if they belie you, so did belie the people of Nulh and ` Ad and Thamud,

22:43.t: and the people of Ibrhhim and the people of Lilt,

22:44.t: and the people of Madyan as well. And Musa was (also) belied. So, I gave some respite to the disbelievers, then seized them. So how was My censure?

22:45.t: How many a town there were which We destroyed, when they were wrongdoers. So, there they are, fallen down on their roofs, and (how many a) deserted well and well-built castle!

22:46.t: Have they not, then, travelled on earth so that they should have had hearts to understand with or ears to listen with? The fact is that it is not the eyes that turn blind, but what turns blind is the hearts contained in the chests.

22:47.t: And they ask you to bring the punishment sooner. And Allah will never go back on His promise. In fact, one day with your Lord is like one thousand years of what you count.

22:48.t: And how many a town there were to whom I allowed respite, while they were wrongdoers, then I seized them. And to Me is the final return.

22:49.t: Say, "0 people, I am no more than a plain warner for you.

22:50.t: So those who come to believe and do good deeds, for them there is forgiveness and dignified provision.

22:51.t: And those who strive against Our signs trying to defeat (the prophet or the believers), they are the people of the Fire.

22:52.t: And We did not send any messenger before you nor a prophet, but (he faced a situation that) when he recited (the revelation), the Satan cast (doubts) about what he recited. So, Allah nullifies what the Satan casts, then Allah makes His verses firm, and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise

22:53.t: (all this is allowed to be done) so that He may make what Satan casts a trial for those in whose hearts there is a disease and whose hearts are hard; and surely the wrongdoers are in the utmost antagonism -

22:54.t: and so that those who have been given knowledge may know that it (i.e. the revelation recited by the prophet) is the truth from your Lord, and they may believe in it and their hearts may become humble towards it. And Allah is the One who takes the believers to the straight path.

22:55.t: And those who disbelieve will remain in doubt about it (the Qur'an) forever, until the Hour (of Judgment) comes upon them suddenly, or there comes to them the punishment of a barren day.

22:56.t: The kingdom, on that day, is for Allah. He will judge between them. So, those who believed and did good deeds shall be in gardens of bliss.

22:57.t: As for those who disbelieved and belied Our signs, they are the ones for whom there is a humiliating punishment.

22:58.t: And those who left their homeland in the way of Allah, then were slain or died, Allah will certainly give them a good provision, and surely, Allah is the best of all givers.

22:59.t: He will definitely admit them to an entrance they will be pleased with, and Allah is surely All-Knowing, Forbearing.

22:60.t: That (is so). And whoever afflicts (someone) with a punishment equal to what he was afflicted with (by the latter), and still he (the former) is (again) subjected to injustice, Allah will certainly help him. Indeed, Allah is Most-Pardoning, Most-Forgiving.

22:61.t: That is because Allah makes night enter into the day and makes day enter into the night and that Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

22:62.t: That is because Allah is the truth and that whatever they invoke beside Him is false and that Allah is the High, the Great.

22:63.t: Did you not see that Allah has sent down water from the sky, whereby the land becomes green? Surely, Allah is All-Kind, All-Aware.

22:64.t: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, and surely Allah is the All-Independent, Ever-Praised.

22:65.t: Did you not see that Allah has subjugated to you whatever there is on the earth, and the ships that sail at sea with His command? And He holds the heavens from falling on the earth, except with His permission. Surely Allah is Very-Kind to the people, Very-Merciful.

22:66.t: And He is the One who gave life to you, then He brings death to you, then He will give you life (again). Surely, man is very ungrateful.

22:67.t: And For every ummah (religious community) We have appointed a way of worship they are to observe. Therefore, they should never quarrel with you in the matter. And do call them to your Lord. Surely, you are on straight Guidance.

22:68.t: And if they dispute with you, then say, "Allah knows best what you do."

22:69.t: Allah will judge between you, on the Day of Judgment, about what you used to differ in.

22:70.t: Do you not know that Allah knows all that is in the sky and the earth? Surely, that is contained in a Book. Indeed it is so easy for Allah.

22:71.t: And they worship, besides Allah, the objects for which He did never send down an authority (or proof) and for which they have no knowledge. And for the wrongdoers there is no helper.

22:72.t: And when Our verses are recited to them in all their clarity, you (can) recognize disgust on the faces of the disbelievers. They seem to attack those who recite to them Our verses. Say, "Shall I, then, tell you about something more disgusting than that? The Fire! Allah has promised it to those who disbelieve. And it is an evil end."

22:73.t: O people, here is a parable set forth to you, so listen to it carefully: All those whom you invoke besides Allah can never create (even) a fly, even though they all join hands together for that. And if a fly snatches something away from them, they cannot release it there from. (Equally) feeble are the invoker and the invoked.

22:74.t: They did not recognize Allah in His true esteem. Indeed Allah is Powerful, Mighty.

22:75.t: Allah chooses messengers from angels and from men. Surely, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

22:76.t: He knows what is in front of them and what is behind them, and to Allah all matters are to be returned.

22:77.t: O those who believe, bow down in ruku` and bow down in sajdah and worship your Lord and do good, so that you achieve success.

22:78.t: And struggle for (seeking the pleasure of) Allah, a struggle that is owed to Him. He has chosen you and did not impose any hardship on you in the religion - the faith of your father Ibrahim. He (Allah) named you as Muslims both before and in this (Qur'an), so that the Messenger becomes a witness to you and you become witnesses to (other) people. So establish salah and pay zakah, and hold fast to Allah. He is your patron. So, He is the excellent One to be a patron and He is the excellent One to help.

23:1.t: Success is really attained by the believers

23:2.t: who are concentrative in their Salah (prayers)

23:3.t: and who keep themselves away from vain things

23:4.t: , and who are performers of Zakah,

23:5.t: and who guard their private parts

23:6.t: except from their wives or from those (slave-girls) owned by their right hands, because they are not liable to blame.

23:7.t: However, those who seek (sexual pleasure) beyond that are the transgressors

23:8.t: - and (success is attained) by those who honestly look after their trusts and covenant,

23:9.t: and who consistently observe their prayers.

23:11.t: who will inherit Firdaus (the Paradise). They will be there forever.

23:12.t: And We have created man from an extract of clay.

23:13.t: Then We made him a sperm-drop in a firm resting place.

23:14.t: Then We made the sperm-drop into a clot, then We turned the clot into a foetus-lump, then We made the foetus-lump into bones, then We clothed the bones with flesh; thereafter We developed it into another creature. So, glorious is Allah, the Best of the creators.

23:15.t: Then, after all this, you are to die.

23:16.t: Then you are to be raised again on the Day of Judgment.

23:17.t: And We created upon you seven paths (heavens) and We were never neglectful of the creation.

23:18.t: And We sent down water from the sky in due measure, then We lodged it in the earth, and of course, We are able to take it away.

23:19.t: Then We produced with it gardens of date-palms and vines for your benefit. For you there are many fruits in them, and of them you eat

23:20.t: - and (We produced) a tree (of olive) that comes out from the (mount) T it of Sinai, which grows having oil and a dressing for those who eat.

23:21.t: And indeed there is a sure lesson in the cattle for you. We give you a drink from that which lies in their bellies, and for you there are many benefits in them, and of them you eat,

23:22.t: and on them and on the boats you are transported.

23:23.t: And surely, We sent Nuh to his nation. So he said, "O my people, worship Allah. You have no god whatsoever other than Him. So, do you not fear Allah?"

23:24.t: So, said the disbelieving chiefs from among his nation, "This (man) is nothing but a human being like you. He wishes to impose his superiority over you. Had Allah willed, He would have sent down angels. We have not heard of such a thing among our forefathers.

23:25.t: He is none but a man possessed by madness, so wait for (what happens to) him, for some time"

23:26.t: He said, 'My Lord, help me, for they have belied me."

23:27.t: So, We sent Our revelation to him, saying, 'Make the ship under Our eyes and Our revelation. So, when Our command comes and the oven gushes forth, take on its board a pair of two from each (species) along with your family, except those of them against whom the word has already passed. And do not speak to Me (in favour) of those who did wrong. They are sure to be drowned.

23:28.t: So, when you and those with you, are well seated in the ship, say, ` Praise is for Allah who saved us from the wrongdoing people.'

23:29.t: And say, ` My Lord, make me land a blessed landing. And You are the best of those who bring (someone) to land"'.

23:30.t: Surely, there are signs in it and We do always test (people).

23:31.t: Then after them We created another generation,

23:32.t: and sent among them a messenger from themselves (to convey the message): "Worship Allah; you have no god whatsoever than Him. So do you not fear Allah?"

23:33.t: So said those chiefs of his nation who disbelieved and belied facing the Hereafter and whom We made affluent in the worldly life, 'This (man) is nothing but a human being. He eats from what you eat from, and drinks from what you drink.

23:34.t: And if you obey a human like you, you will be absolute losers.

23:35.t: Does he promise you that, when you die and are turned into dust and bones, you are to be brought forth?

23:36.t: Far too improbable is what you are being promised.

23:37.t: There is nothing but our worldly life. We die and we live and we are not to be raised again.

23:38.t: He is nothing but a man who has forged a lie against Allah and we are not going to believe in him."

23:39.t: He said, "My Lord, help me, for they have belied me."

23:40.t: He (Allah) said, "In a little while they have to become remorseful."

23:41.t: So the Cu seized them according to the true (promise), and We turned them in to scum. So, woe to the wrong doing people.

23:42.t: Then, after them, We created another generation.

23:43.t: No community can go ahead of its appointed time, nor can they stay behind.

23:44.t: Thereafter, We sent Our messengers successively. Whenever a community was approached by its messenger they belied him. Then We made some of them follow others (in destruction) and turned them into tales (of history). So, woe to a people who do not believe.

23:45.t: Thereafter, We sent Musa and his brother Harun, with Our signs and a clear proof

23:46.t: towards Fir'aun (the Pharaoh) and his advisors. But they showed arrogance and they were haughty people.

23:47.t: So they said, "shall we believe in two humans who are like ourselves and whose people are serving us as slaves?"

23:48.t: Thus they belied both of them and were among the destroyed.

23:49.t: And, of course, We gave Musa the Book, so that they may take the right path.

23:50.t: And We made the son of Maryam (Mary) and his mother a sign and gave them shelter on a height, a place of rest and running springs.

23:51.t: Of whatever you do, I am fully aware.

23:52.t: And surely, this is your creed, a single creed, and I am your Lord. So fear Me.

23:53.t: But they split up ways from one another (dividing themselves) into factions, each faction happy with what lies before it.

23:54.t: So leave them in their negligence for some time.

23:55.t: Do they think that by consistently providing them with wealth and children,

23:56.t: We are accelerating the (real) good things to them? The fact, however, is that they do not understand (the reality).

23:57.t: (Contrarily) those who are anxious out of awe of their Lord,

23:58.t: and those who believe in the verses of their Lord

23:59.t: and those who do not associate any partner to their Lord,

23:60.t: And those who give whatever they give with their hearts full of fear that to their Lord they are to return

23:61.t: - those people are accelerating towards the (real) good things, and they are the foremost to attain them.

23:62.t: ] We do not place a burden on anyone except to his capability. And with Us is a book which speaks with truth, and they shall not be wronged.

23:63.t: But their hearts are in ignorance about this, and they have deeds, other than that, which they are continuously doing.

23:64.t: Until when We will seize their affluent ones with punishment, they will suddenly start crying.

23:65.t: 'Do not cry today. You will not be helped by Us.

23:66.t: My verses used to be recited to you, but you used to turn back on your heels

23:67.t: in arrogance, making it a subject of tales at night, talking nonsense (about it)."

23:68.t: Then, is it that they did not ponder over the Word (of Allah) or there has come to them something that did not come to their forefathers?

23:69.t: Or did they not recognize their messenger and therefore they denied him?

23:70.t: Or do they say, ` He is possessed by madness?' Instead, the fact is that he has come to them with truth, but it is the truth that most of them dislike.

23:71.t: And had the truth followed their desires, all the heavens and the earth and all those therein would have fallen in total disorder. However, We have brought to them their advice, but it is their advice that they are averse to.

23:72.t: Or is it that you (0 Muhammad) demand a remuneration from them? But the remuneration from your Lord is best, and He is the best of all givers.

23:73.t: And surely you are inviting them to a straight path,

23:74.t: and those who do not believe in the Hereafter are surely the deviators from the Path.

23:75.t: And if We have mercy on them and remove whatever distress they have, they would still persist obstinately in their rebellion, wandering blindly.

23:76.t: And We have already seized them with punishment, but they did not turn humble to their Lord, nor do they supplicate in humility,

23:77.t: ] until when We will open against them the door of a severe punishment, they will be taken aback in despair.

23:78.t: And He is the One who created for you the ears and the eyes and the hearts. Little you are grateful.

23:79.t: And He is the One who created you on the earth and it is He unto whom you will be gathered together.

23:80.t: And He is the One who gives life and brings death and it is He to whom belongs the alternation of night and day. So, do you not understand?

23:81.t: 80] But they said like what the earlier people had said.

23:82.t: They said, "Is it that, when we will die and become dust and bones--is it that we will be raised again?

23:83.t: This is what we and our fathers had been promised with before. It is nothing but the tales of the ancients."

23:84.t: ] Say, "Whose is the earth and all those therein if you have knowledge?"

23:85.t: They will say, "Allah's." Would you still pay no heed?

23:86.t: Say, "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Great Throne?"

23:87.t: They will say, " (All this belongs) to Allah". Say, "Would you still not fear Allah?"

23:88.t: Say, "Who is the One in whose hand lies the kingdom of everything and who gives protection and no protection can be given against him, if you have knowledge?"

23:89.t: ] They will say, " (All this belongs) to Allah." Say, "Then from where are you being bewitched?"

23:90.t: The fact is that We have brought to them The Truth, and they are absolute liars.

23:91.t: Allah did not take to a son, nor was there any god with Him. Had there been so, every god would have taken away what he created and each one of them would have been aggressive against the other. Pure is Allah from what they describe.

23:92.t: He is the Knower of the hidden and the manifest. So, He is far higher than their ascribing of partners to Him.

23:93.t: (0 prophet) say (in prayer), "0 my Lord, if You are to show me (in my life) that (punishment) which they- (the infidels) are threatened with,

23:94.t: ] then, my Lord, do not place me among the wrongdoing people."

23:95.t: And of course, We do have the power to show you what We threatened them with.

23:96.t: Repel evil with that which is best. We are well aware of what they describe.

23:97.t: And say, "O my Lord, I seek your refuge from the strokes of the shaitans,

23:98.t: and I seek Your refuge from that they come to me."

23:99.t: ](The infidels go on doing their misdeeds) until when death comes to one of them, he will say, "My Lord send me back,

23:100.t: so that I may act righteously in that which I have left behind." Never! It is just a word he has to utter. And in front of them there is a barrier till the day when they will be resurrected.

23:101.t: Thereafter, when the Sur (the trumpet) is blown, there are no ties of kinship between them, nor will they question one another.

23:102.t: ] So, the one whose scales (of good deeds) turn out to be heavy, then such people are the successful ones,

23:103.t: and the one whose scales turn out to be light, then such people are the ones who harmed their own selves; in Jahannam (Hell) they are to remain forever.

23:104.t: Fire will scorch their faces and they will be disfigured therein.

23:105.t: ](It will be said to such people), "Were My verses not used to be recited to you and you used to belie them?"

23:106.t: They will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness prevailed over us, and we were a people wandering astray.

23:107.t: 0 our Lord, get us out from here; if we do this again, then of course, we will be transgressors."

23:108.t: He (Allah) will say, "Stay in it, humiliated, and do not speak to Me"

23:109.t: There was indeed a group of My servants who used to say, "Our Lord, we adhere to the (true) faith, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and you are the best of all the merciful."

23:110.t: But you made fun of them, so much so that they caused you to forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.

23:111.t: I have given them today, for their observing patience, the recompense that they are the only ones who are victorious.'

23:112.t: He (Allah) will say, "How long did you stay on the earth by number of years?"

23:113.t: They will say, "We stayed for a day or for a part of a day." So, ask the ones who count.

23:114.t: He will say, "You did not stay but for a little. Would that you have understood (this at that time) !

23:115.t: So did you think that We created you for nothing and that you will not be brought back to Us?"

23:116.t: So, High above all is Allah, the King, the True. There is no god but He, the Lord of the Noble Throne.

23:117.t: And whoever invokes another god with Allah, while he has no proof for it, his reckoning lies with his Lord. Surely, the infidels will not achieve success.

23:118.t: And say (0 prophet) ` My Lord, forgive and have mercy and you are the best of all the merciful.'

24:1.t: This is a Surah We have sent down and prescribed and sent down in it clear signs, so that you may receive the advice.

24:2.t: The fornicating woman and the fornicating man, flog each one of them with one hundred stripes. And no pity for them should withhold you from (complying with) Allah's religion, if you really believe in Allah and the Last Day. And a group of believers must witness their punishment.

24:3.t: A man who is fornicator does not (like to) may but a woman who is a fornicator or a polytheist. And a woman who is a fornicator does not (like to) may but a man who is a fornicator or a polytheist. And this (i.e. preferring to marry such spouses) has been prohibited for the believers.

24:4.t: And those who accuse the chaste women (of fornication), but they do not produce four witnesses, flog them with eighty stripes and do not accept their any evidence any more, and they are the sinners,

24:5.t: except those who repent afterwards and mend their ways; then, Allah is All-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

24:6.t: And those who accuse their wives (of adultery) and they have no witnesses except their own selves, then the evidence of one of them would be to swear four oaths by Allah that he is from among the truthful,

24:7.t: and the fifth (oath) that Allah's curse be on him if he is from among the liars.

24:8.t: And it will remove the punishment from the woman if she swears four oaths by Allah that he (the accuser husband) is certainly from among the liars,

24:9.t: and the fifth (oath) that Allah's wrath be on her if he is among the truthful.

24:10.t: And had it not been for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy and (had it not been) that Allah is Most-Relenting, All-Wise (you would have been ruined).

24:11.t: Those who have come up with the false imputation are a gang among you. Do not think it is bad for you; rather, it is good for you. Everyone of them is liable for what he earned of the sin. And the one who undertook the major part of it, for him there is a mighty punishment.

24:12.t: ] Why - when you (0 believers) heard of it - did the believing men and the believing women not think well on their own selves and (why did they not) say, ` This is a manifest lie'.

24:13.t: Why did they (the accusers) not bring four witnesses to prove this? So, as they did not bring the witnesses, they are the liars in the sight of Allah.

24:14.t: And had it not been for the grace of Allah upon you, and His mercy in this world and in the Hereafter, a great punishment would have reached you for what you got indulged in -

24:15.t: ] when you were welcoming it with your tongues and were saying with your mouths something of which you had no knowledge, and were taking it as a trivial matter, while in the sight of Allah it was grave.

24:16.t: And why, when you heard of it, did you not say, ` It is not for us to speak about this. Pure are You (0 Allah). This is a terrible calumny,'

24:17.t: Allah admonishes you never to repeat something like this, if you are believers.

24:18.t: And Allah makes the signs clear to you. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

24:19.t: Surely, those who like that shamelessness spreads among the believers, for them there is painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And Allah knows and you do not know.

24:20.t: And had it not been for the grace of Allah upon you, and His mercy and that Allah is Very-Kind, Very-Merciful (you would have been destroyed).

24:21.t: those who believe, do not follow the footsteps of Satan. And whoever follows the footsteps of Satan, (should know that) he orders (one to commit) shameless acts and evil deeds. And had it not been for the grace of Allah upon you, and His mercy, not a single person from you would have ever attained purity. But Allah purifies whomsoever He wills. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

24:22.t: And the men of grace and wealth among you should not swear against giving (their charitable gifts) to the kinsmen and the poor and to those who have migrated in the way of Allah. And they should forgive and forego. Do you not like that Allah forgives you? And Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

24:23.t: Surely, those who level a false charge against the chaste, naive and believing women are cursed in this world and the Hereafter, and for them there is a mighty punishment

24:24.t: on the Day their tongues, their hands and their legs will testify against them of what they used to do.

24:25.t: ] On that day Allah will give them their due recompense in full and they will know that Allah is the Truth Who makes all things manifest.

24:26.t: Vile women are for vile men, and vile men are for vile women. And good women are for good men and good men are for good women. Those are free from what they (the accusers) say. For them there is forgiveness and a graceful provision.

24:27.t: O those who believe, do not enter any houses, other than your own houses unless you seek permission and greet their inmates with Sam. That is good for you, so that you may observe advice.

24:28.t: Then, if you do not find anyone there, do not enter therein until permission is given to you. And if it is said to you, ` Go back', just go back; it is more decent for you. And Allah is All-Knowing of what you do.

24:29.t: ] There is no sin on you if you enter uninhabited houses in which you have rightful benefit. And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.

24:30.t: Say to the believing men that they must lower their gazes and guard their private parts; it is more decent for them. Surely Allah is All-Aware of what they do.

24:31.t: And say to the believing women that they must lower their gazes and guard their private parts, and must not expose their adornment, except that which appears thereof, and must wrap their bosoms with their shawls, and must not expose their adornment except to their husbands or their fathers or the fathers of their husbands, or to their sons or the sons of their husbands, or to their brothers or the sons of their brothers or the sons of their sisters, or to their women, or to those owned by their right hands, or male attendants having no (sexual) urge, or to the children who are not yet conscious of the shames of women. And let them not stamp their feet in a way that the adornment they conceal is known. And repent to Allah O believers, all of you, so that you may achieve success.

24:32.t: And arrange the marriage of the spouse-less among you, and the capable from among your bond-men and bond-girls. If they are poor, Allah will enrich them out of His grace. And Allah is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing.

24:33.t: And those who cannot afford marriage should keep chaste until Allah enriches them out of His grace…And those of your slaves who seek the contract of Kitabah (emancipation by paying money), contract Kitabah with them, if you know of some good in them. And give them out of the wealth of Allah that He has given to you. And do not compel your maids to prostitution - if they wish to observe chastity - in order that you may seek the temporary benefit of the worldly life. And if one compels them, then after their being compelled, Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

24:34.t: And indeed We have sent down to you enlighten ng verses and an exemplary description of those who passed away before you and a good counsel for the God-fearing.

24:35.t: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The example of His light is that of a niche in which there is a lamp; the lamp is in a glass - the glass looks like a brilliant star - it is lit by (the oil of) a blessed tree, the olive, which is neither eastern, nor western. Its oil is about to emit light even if fire has not touched it - (it is) light upon light. Allah guides to His light whomsoever He wills. And Allah describes examples for the people, and Allah knows everything well.

24:36.t: ](The guided people worship Allah) in the houses that Allah has permitted to be raised and where His name is recounted and His purity is pronounced, in the morning and in the evening,

24:37.t: by men whom no trade or sale makes neglectful of the remembrance of Allah, nor from establishing Salah and paying Zak; they are fearful of a day in which the hearts and the eyes will be over-turned.

24:38.t: The fate (of such people) is that Allah will reward them for the best deeds they did and will give them more out of His grace. And Allah gives whom He wills without counting.

24:39.t: As for those who disbelieve, their deeds are like a mirage in a desert plane which a thirsty person deems to be water, until when he comes to it, he finds it nothing, and finds (the decree of) Allah with him, so He pays him his account in full. And Allah is swift at reckoning.

24:40.t: Or (their deeds) are like layers of darkness in a vast deep sea overwhelmed by a wave, above which there is another wave, above which there are clouds - layers of darkness, one above the other. When one puts forth his hand, he can hardly see it. And the one to whom Allah does not give light can have no light at all.

24:41.t: Did you not realize that purity of Allah is proclaimed by all those in the heavens and the earth, and by the birds with their wings spread out? Everyone knows one's own (way of) praying (to Allah) and one's own (way of) proclaiming Allah's purity. And Allah knows well what they do.

24:42.t: And to Allah belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and towards Allah is the final return.

24:43.t: Do you not realize that Allah drives the clouds, then joins them together, then turns them into a heap? Then you see the rain coming out from their midst. And He sends down from the sky mountains (of clouds) having hail in them, then He afflicts with it whomsoever He wills and turns it away from whomsoever He wills. The flash of its lightning seems to snatch away the eyes.

24:44.t: Allah alternates the night and the day. Surely, in that there is a lesson for those who have eyes to see.

24:45.t: And Allah has created every moving creature from water. So, some of them move on their bellies; and some of them move on two legs and some of them move on four. Allah creates what He wills. Surely, Allah is powerful over everything.

24:46.t: We have surely sent down enlightening verses. And Allah guides whom He wills to the straight path.

24:47.t: And they say, ` We have believed in Allah and in the messenger and have taken to obedience', then a group from them goes back after all this. And those are no believers.

24:48.t: And when they are summoned to Allah and His messenger that he (the messenger) may judge between them, in no time a group of them turns averse.

24:49.t: ] And if the right is theirs, they would come to him as (if they are) submissive ones.

24:50.t: ] Is there a malady in their hearts or do they have doubt or do they fear that Allah and His messenger will do injustice to them? Rather they themselves are the unjust.

24:51.t: The only reply of the (true) believers, when they are summoned to Allah and His messenger that he (the messenger) may judge between them, is that they say, ` We listen and obey.' And such people are the successful.

24:52.t: And whoever obeys Allah and His messenger and has awe of Him and observes Taqwa of Him, then such people are the victorious.

24:53.t: And they (the hypocrites) swear by Allah on eloquent oaths that if you (0 prophet) order them, they will certainly leave (their homes for Jihad). Say, ` do not swear, (the reality of your) obedience is known. Indeed Allah is fully aware of what you do.'

24:54.t: Say, ` Obey Allah and obey the messenger. But if you turn away, then on him (the messenger) lies (the responsibility on what he is burdened with and on you lies (the responsibility on what you are burdened with. And if you obey him, you will get the right path. And the messenger is responsible for nothing more than to convey the message clearly.'

24:55.t: Allah has promised those of you who believe and do good deeds that He will certainly make them (His) vicegerents in the land, like He made those before them, and will certainly establish for them their religion that He has chosen for them and will certainly give them peace in exchange, after their state of fear; (provided that) they worship Me, ascribing no partner to Me. And whoever turns infidel after that, then such people are the transgressors.

24:56.t: And establish Salah and pay Zakah and obey the messenger so that you may be favored with mercy.

24:57.t: ] Never think that the disbelievers are (able) to frustrate (Allah's plan) on the earth. And their abode is the Fire. And indeed it is an evil terminus.

24:58.t: O those who believe, the slaves owned by you and those of you who have not reached puberty must seek your permission (to see you) at three times: before the prayer of Fajr, when you take off your clothes at noon and after the prayer of ` Isha'. These are three times of privacy for you. There is no harm, neither to you nor to them after these (three times). They are your frequent visitors as some of you are (frequent visitors) of the others. This is how Allah explains the verses to you. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

24:59.t: And when the children from among you reach puberty, they must seek permission as the permission is sought by those before them. This is how Allah explains His verses to you. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

24:60.t: And those old women who have no hope for marriage, there is no sin on them if they take off their (extra) clothes while they do not display their adornment. And that they refrain (even from this) is better for them. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

24:61.t: There is no blame on a blind person, nor is there any blame on any lame one, nor is there any blame on a patient, nor on yourselves in that you eat (something) from your own homes or from the homes of your fathers or the homes of your mothers or the homes of your brothers or the homes of your sisters or the homes of your paternal aunts or the homes of your maternal uncles or the homes of your maternal aunts or from the places the keys of which you have under your control or from (the home of) your friend. There is no sin on you if you eat together or separately. So when you enter homes, greet your own selves with Salam, a greeting prescribed by Allah which is blessed, pleasant. This is how Allah explains the verses to you so that you may understand.

24:62.t: The believers are only those who believe in Allah and His messenger and who, when they are with him for a collective matter, do not leave unless they seek his permission. Surely, those who seek your permission are the ones who believe in Allah and His messenger. So, if they seek permission from you for some business of theirs, give permission to whom you wish from among them, and pray to Allah for their forgiveness. Surely, Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

24:63.t: Do not take the call of the messenger among you as a call of one of you to another. Allah definitely knows those of you who sneak out, covering one another. So, those who violate his (messenger's) order must beware, lest they are visited by a trial or they are visited by a painful punishment.

24:64.t: Remember! To Allah belongs all that is there in the heavens and the earth. He knows the condition you are in; and the Day on which they will be returned to Him, He will tell them what they did. And Allah is fully aware of everything.

25:1.t: Glorious is the One who has revealed the Criterion to His servant, so that he may be a warner to the worlds,

25:2.t: the One to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and who did neither have a son, nor is there any partner to him in the kingdom, and who has created everything and designed it in a perfect measure.

25:3.t: And they have coined gods, other than Him, who do not create any thing, rather they themselves are created, and they possess no power to cause harm or benefit even to themselves, nor do they have any power over death or life or resurrection.

25:4.t: And said those who disbelieve, “ This is nothing but a lie he (the messenger) has fabricated and some other people have helped him in it." Thus they came up with transgression and falsehood.

25:5.t: And they said, " (These are) the tales of the ancients he (the messenger) has caused to be written, and they are read out to him at morn and eve."

25:6.t: ] Say, "It is sent down by the One who knows the secret in the heavens and the earth. Indeed He is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

25:7.t: And they said, "What sort of messenger is this who eats food and walks in the markets? Why is it that an angel has not been sent down to him who would have been a warner alongwith him,

25:8.t: or that a treasure is not thrown down to him, or that he has no garden to eat from it?" And the transgressors said, "You are following none but a bewitched man."

25:9.t: See how they coined similes for you, so they have gone astray and cannot find a way.

25:10.t: Glorious is the One who, if He so wills, would give you better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow, and would give you palaces.

25:11.t: But they have disbelieved the Hour (the Day of Judgment) and We have prepared, for those who disbelieve the Hour, a flaming fire.

25:12.t: ] When it will see them from a distant place, they will hear (the sounds of) its raging and breathing,

25:13.t: ] and when they will be thrown into a narrow place therein, while they will be chained together, they will call for death.

25:14.t: ] Do not call for one death today, but call for many a death.

25:15.t: Say, "Is that better or the eternal paradise the God-fearing are promised?' It will be a reward for them and a final abode.

25:16.t: For them there will be whatever they wish, while they will be living for ever. This is a promise undertaken by your Lord, (the fulfillment of) which will be prayed for.

25:17.t: And (remember) the Day when He will gather them and what they used to worship beside Allah and will say (to the latter ones), 'Did you mislead these My servants or did they themselves lost the way?"

25:18.t: They will say, "Pure are you. It was not for us to take to other guardians than You. Instead, You gave them and their fathers (worldly) benefits till they forgot the advice and became a ruined people."

25:19.t: Thus they will refute you in what you say and you will not be able to repulse (the punishment) or to receive help. And whoever commits injustice from among you, We will make him taste a painful punishment.

25:20.t: And We did not send any messengers before you, but all of them used to eat food and walk in the markets. And We have made some of you a test for some others. Would you observe patience? And your Lord is Ever-seeing.

25:21.t: And said those who do not apprehend to meet Us, 'y the angels are not sent down to us or why do we not see our Lord?" Indeed they think too highly of themselves and have gone too far in rebellion.

25:22.t: The Day they will see the angels, there will be no good news for the sinners that day, and they will say , " (We need) a shelter, fully protected!"

25:23.t: And We will come to whatever deeds they did and will turn them into scattered dust.

25:24.t: The people of Paradise, on that day will be the best in (terms of their) abode and best in (terms of their) resting-place.

25:25.t: And the Day the sky will break open with a cloud 'and the angels are sent down in a majestic descent,

25:26.t: the Kingdom on that day will be for the Rahman, and for the disbelievers it will be a difficult day.

25:27.t: ] And (Be mindful on the Day the wrongdoer will bite his hands saying, 'Would that I had taken a path along with the messenger!

25:28.t: Woe to me! Would that I had not taken so-and-so for my friend!

25:29.t: Indeed he led me astray from the advice after it had come to me." And the Satan is man's betrayer.

25:30.t: And the messenger will say, "0 my Lord, my people had taken this Qur'an as a thing to be deserted."

25:31.t: And in a similar way We made for every prophet an enemy from among the sinners, but your Lord suffices as a guide and as a supporter.

25:32.t: And said those who disbelieved, "Why has the Qur'an not been revealed to him all at once?" (It has been sent down) in this way (i.e. in parts) so that We make your heart firm, and We revealed it little by little.

25:33.t: And they bring to you no hypothesis, but We bring to you the correct position and (an answer) better explained.

25:34.t: Those who will be driven on their faces to hell - they are the worst in situation and far more astray from the path.

25:35.t: And surely We gave Musa the Book and appointed his brother Harun as a minister with him.

25:36.t: So we said, "Go, both of you, to the people who have rejected Our signs" Then We annihilated them totally.

25:37.t: As for the people of Nub, when they rejected the messengers, We drowned them and made them an example for mankind. And We have prepared a painful punishment for the transgressors.

25:38.t: And (We annihilated also the peoples on ` Ad and Thamud and the people of Rass and many generations in between them.

25:39.t: And to each (of them) We cited examples, and each of them We brought to utter ruin.

25:40.t: And indeed they (the pagans of Makkah) have passed by the town that was afflicted by an evil rain sent down to it. So, have they not been seeing it? Rather, they do not believe in Resurrection.

25:41.t: And when they see you, they take you as nothing but a laughing stock, (saying) "Is this the man whom Allah has sent as a messenger?

25:42.t: He would have almost led us astray from our gods, had we not been so firm towards them." And they will know when they will see the punishment, who is farther astray in his way.

25:43.t: Tell me about the one who has taken his desire as his god, would you then, become a guardian for him?

25:44.t: Or do you think that most of them listen or understand? They are nothing but like cattle. Rather, they are even farther astray in their way.

25:45.t: Have you not turned your vision to your Lord, how He prolonged the shadow? And if He so willed, He would have made it stand still. Then We made the sun an indicator for it.

25:46.t: Then We pulled it toward Us in a gradual manner.

25:47.t: And He is the One who has made the night an apparel for you, and the sleep a means of rest and has made the day a means of revival.

25:48.t: And He is the One who has sent the winds conveying good news before His mercy. And we have sent down purifying water from the heavens,

25:49.t: so that We revive a dead land therewith and give drink to the many cattle and humans We have created.

25:50.t: And We have distributed it (the water) among them, so that they may take lesson, then most of the people opted for nothing but ungratefulness.

25:51.t: And if We so willed, We would have sent a warner in every town.

25:52.t: So do not obey the infidels and strive against them with it (the Qur'an) a great striving.

25:53.t: And He is the One who joined the two seas - this is sweat, very sweat, and this is bitter, very bitter - and made between them a buffer and a barrier, prohibited (to cross).

25:54.t: And He is the One who created man from water, then made of him kinship of blood and kinship of in-laws. And your Lord is All-Powerful.

25:55.t: And they worship, instead of Allah, what can neither give them any benefit nor can cause them any harm. And the disbeliever is always a supporter (of Satan) against his Lord.

25:56.t: And We did not send you but as a bearer of good news and as a warner.

25:57.t: Say, 'I do not demand from you any fee except that whoever so wills should adopt a way to his Lord.

25:58.t: And place your trust in the Ever-Living who cannot die, and proclaim His purity alongwith His praise. And enough is He to be aware of the sins of His slaves,

25:59.t: the One who created the heavens and the earth and whatever lies between them in six days, then He positioned Himself on the Throne - the Rahman, so ask about Him someone who knows.

25:60.t: And when it is said to them, 'Prostrate to the Rahman (the Most Merciful)," they say "What is Rahman? Shall we prostrate to that to which you direct us?" And it increases nothing in them except aversion.

25:61.t: Glorious is the One who made stellar formations in the sky and placed therein a lamp (sun) and a bright moon.

25:62.t: And He is the One who made the day and the night following each other, for the one who wishes to be mindful or wishes to show gratitude.

25:63.t: And the slaves of the Rahman are those who walk on the earth humbly and when the ignorant people speak to them, they reply peacefully,

25:64.t: and those who pass the night prostrating and standing before their Lord,

25:65.t: and those who say, "Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Jahannam; indeed, its punishment is a persisting affliction.

25:66.t: Indeed, evil it is as an abode and a place to dwell in

25:67.t: - and those who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor miserly, and it (i.e. their spending) is moderate in between (the two extremes)

25:68.t: - and those who do not invoke any other god along with Allah, and do not kill a person whom Allah has given sanctity, except rightfully, nor do they fornicate; and whoever does it, shall face the recompense of his sin,

25:69.t: ] the punishment will be doubled for him and he will remain there disdained, forever,

25:70.t: except the one who repents and believes and does good deeds, then Allah will change the bad deeds of such people into good ones, and Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

25:71.t: And whoever repents and does righteous deeds turns to Allah truly

25:72.t: - and those who do not witness falsehood, and when they pass by the absurd things, Pass by with dignity

25:73.t: ] and those who, when they are reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall at them as deaf and blind ones

25:74.t: - and those who say, "Our Lord, Give us, from our spouses and our children, coolness of eyes and make us heads of the God-fearing.

25:75.t: Such people will be rewarded with the high place - because they observed patience - and will be received therein with prayers of their eternal life and peace,

25:76.t: living in it (the Paradise) forever. It is best as an abode and as a place to dwell in.

25:77.t: Say (0 Prophet), "My Lord will never care about you, if you will not invoke Him. Now since you belied (the truth), the punishment will be inseparable from you.

26:2.t: These are the verses of the manifest Book.

26:3.t: Seemingly you are going to let yourself collapse in grief because they do not believe.

26:4.t: If We so will, We can send down to them a sign from the sky before which their necks will stay bent in submission.

26:5.t: And there comes to them no new message from the Rahman, but they become averse to it.

26:6.t: Thus they rejected (the Truth); so soon will come to them the real descriptions of what they used to ridicule.

26:7.t: Have they not looked at the earth, how many of the noble pairs (of vegetation) We have caused to grow therein?

26:8.t: Surely, in this there is a sign, and most of them are not to believe

26:9.t: And surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.

26:10.t: And (remember) when your Lord called Musa saying, "Go to the transgressing people,

26:11.t: the people of Fir` aun (the Pharaoh). Do they not fear Allah?"

26:12.t: He (Musa) said, "My Lord, I fear they will belie me.

26:13.t: And my heart gets straitened and my tongue is not fluent; so send for Harun.

26:14.t: And they have (made) a charge of offence against me and I fear they will kill me;"

26:15.t: He (Allah) said, Never! So go, both of you, with Our signs. We are with you, listening.

26:16.t: So, the two of you reach the Fir` aun and say, 'We both are messengers of the Lord of all the worlds,

26:17.t: (sent with the message) that you must send the children of Isra it with us"

26:18.t: He (the Pharaoh) said, 'Did we not nourish you among us as a child? And you remained among us for years,

26:19.t: and you did that deed of yours which you did while you were among the ungrateful.

26:20.t: He said, "I did that at that time when I was one of the unaware people.

26:21.t: Then I fled from you when I feared you. Thereafter my Lord granted wisdom to me and made me among the messengers.

26:22.t: And this is the favor with which you are obliging me - that you have enslaved the children of Isra il."

26:23.t: The Pharaoh said, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"

26:24.t: He (Musa) said, "Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever there is between them, if you are to believe"

26:25.t: He (the Pharaoh) said to those around him, "Are you not hearing?"

26:26.t: He (Musa) said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your early forefathers"

26:27.t: He (the Pharaoh) said, "Your messenger who is sent to you is a mad man indeed."

26:28.t: He (Musa) said, "Lord of the East and the West and whatever there is between them, if you are to understand"

26:29.t: He (the Pharaoh) said, "If you take to a God other than me, I will certainly put you among those imprisoned."

26:30.t: He (Musa) said "Will you (do this) even if I bring to you something evident?"

26:31.t: He said, "Then bring it, if you are one of the truthful."

26:32.t: So, he threw down his staff, and in no time it was a serpent, clearly visible,

26:33.t: and he drew out his hand, and right then it was a white light to the onlookers.

26:34.t: He (the Pharaoh) said to the chiefs around him "This man is certainly an expert sorcerer".

26:35.t: He wants to expel you from your land with his sorcery. So what do you suggest?"

26:36.t: They said, "Leave him and his brother alone for a while and send to the cities men to collect,

26:37.t: so that they bring to you every highly expert sorcerer."

26:38.t: So the sorcerers were assembled for the appointed time of a known day,

26:39.t: and it was said to the people, "Would you assemble,

26:40.t: so that we may follow the sorcerers if they are victorious?"

26:41.t: So, when the sorcerers came, they said to the Pharaoh, "Will there really be a reward for us, if we are the victorious?"

26:42.t: He said, "Yes, and of course, you will then be among the closer ones."

26:43.t: ] Musa said to them, 'Throw you down what you are to throw."

26:44.t: So they threw down their ropes and their staffs and said, 'By the majesty of the Pharaoh we are going to Prevail definitely."

26:45.t: Then Musa threw down his staff, and in no time it started swallowing the falsehood they invented.

26:46.t: So the sorcerers were made (by the truth they saw) to fall down in prostration.

26:47.t: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,

26:48.t: the Lord of Musa and Harun."

26:49.t: He (the Pharaoh) said, "you believed in him before I permit you. Surely, he (Musa) is the chief of you all who has taught you sorcery. So you will soon know (your fate). I will cut off your hands and feet from different sides and will crucify you all together.

26:50.t: They said, 'There is no harm. We are to return to our Lord.

26:51.t: We really hope that our Lord will forgive us our faults, as we are the first of the believers."

26:52.t: And We revealed to Musa saying, "Make My slaves travel at night. You will be pursued."

26:53.t: So the Pharaoh sent into the cities (his) men to muster (people)

26:55.t: ] and indeed they are enraging us,

26:56.t: ] and we are a host, well-armed."

26:57.t: So We expelled them from gardens and springs

26:58.t: and from treasures and a noble abode.

26:59.t: Thus it was. And We made the children of Isra'il inherit all these.

26:60.t: So they (the people of the Pharaoh) pursued them (the people of 1VVlusa) at the time of sunrise.

26:61.t: And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Musa said, "Surely we are overtaken."

26:62.t: He said, "Never! Indeed with me is my Lord. He will guide me."

26:63.t: So We revealed to Musa saying, "Strike the sea with your staff." So it was severed apart, and each part became like a big mountain.

26:64.t: Then We brought others close to that place.

26:65.t: And We saved Musa and all those with him.

26:67.t: Surely, in this there is a sign, and most of them are not to believe.

26:68.t: And your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.

26:69.t: And recite before them the narrative of Ibrahim,

26:70.t: when he said to his father and to his people, "What do you worship?"

26:71.t: They said, "We worship idols, and stay devoted to them."

26:72.t: He said, "Do they listen to you when you call

26:73.t: (them) or do-they bring benefit to you or harm

26:74.t: ?" They said, No, but we have found our fathers doing like this."

26:75.t: He said, "Have you then ever considered what you have been worshipping,

26:77.t: they all are an enemy to me, except the Lord of the worlds,

26:78.t: Who created me, then guides me,

26:79.t: and Who feeds me and gives me drink,

26:80.t: and when I become sick, He heals me,

26:81.t: and who will make me die, then will give me life,

26:82.t: and who, I hope, will forgive my fault on the Day of Retribution.

26:83.t: 0 my Lord, give me wisdom and join me with the righteous,

26:84.t: and destine for me a truthful description among the next generations.

26:85.t: And make me among those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss,

26:86.t: and forgive my father. Indeed he was among those who went astray.

26:87.t: And do not put me to disgrace on the Day when all will be raised to life,

26:88.t: the Day when neither wealth will be of any use (to any one) nor sons,

26:89.t: except to one who will come to Allah with a sound heart,

26:90.t: and the Paradise will be brought near to the God-fearing

26:91.t: and the Hell will be fully uncovered for the perverse,

26:92.t: and it will be said to them, 'Where is that which you used to worship

26:93.t: beside Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?'

26:94.t: So they (their false gods) will be thrown on their faces into it - they and the erring people

26:95.t: and the entire army of Iblis, all together.

26:96.t: They will say when they will be quarreling with each other,

26:97.t: °By Allah, we were in open error

26:98.t: when we used to equate you with the Lord of the worlds,

26:99.t: ] and none misguided us except the sinners.

26:100.t: Now we have neither any intercessors

26:102.t: Would that we have a chance to return whereby we become among the believers'!"

26:103.t: Surely, in this there is a sign,

26:104.t: and most of them are not to believe. And your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.

26:105.t: And the people of Lut belied the messengers

26:106.t: when their brother Nuh said to them, 'Do you not fear Allah?

26:107.t: I am an honest messenger for you.

26:108.t: So, fear Allah and obey me.

26:109.t: And I do not claim from you any reward for it. My reward is with none but with the Lord of the worlds;

26:110.t: so, fear Allah and obey me."

26:111.t: They said, "Shall we believe in you while you are followed by the lowest people?"

26:112.t: He said, "I do not know about what they do;

26:113.t: their account is with none but with my Lord, if you have sense.

26:114.t: And I am not to drive the believers away;

26:115.t: I am not but a plain warner."

26:116.t: They said, "Should you not stop, 0 Nuh, you will surely be among those stoned."

26:117.t: He said, "My Lord, my people have belied me.

26:118.t: So judge between me and them with an open verdict and save me and all the believers who are with me."

26:119.t: 'So We saved him and those with him in the Ark that was fully occupied.

26:120.t: Then We drowned, after that, all the remaining.

26:121.t: Surely in this there is a sign, and most of them are not to believe.

26:122.t: And surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.

26:123.t: The (people of) ` Ad belied the messengers

26:124.t: when their brother Hud said to them, "Do you not fear Allah?

26:125.t: I am an honest messenger for you,

26:126.t: so fear Allah and obey me.

26:127.t: And I do not claim from you any reward for it. My reward is with none but with the Lord of the worlds.

26:128.t: Do you erect on every height a sign, having no sound purpose,

26:129.t: and take the objects of architecture as if you are going to live forever,

26:130.t: and when you seize (someone) you seize as tyrants?

26:131.t: So fear Allah and obey me.

26:132.t: And fear the One who has supported you with what you know.

26:133.t: lie has supported you with cattle and sons,

26:135.t: In fact I fear for you the punishment of a great day."

26:136.t: They said, "It is all equal for us, whether you give us advice or you are not among those who give advice.

26:137.t: This is nothing but the practice of the ancient,

26:138.t: and we are not going to be punished."

26:139.t: Thus they belied him, so We destroyed them. Surely, in this there is a sign, and most of them are not to believe.

26:140.t: And surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.

26:141.t: The (people of) Thamud belied the messengers

26:142.t: when their brother Salih said to them, 'Do you not fear Allah?

26:143.t: I am an honest messenger for you.

26:144.t: So, fear Allah and obey me.

26:145.t: And I do not claim from you any reward for it. My reward is with none but with the Lord of the worlds.

26:146.t: Will you be left secure in whatever is here,

26:148.t: and in farms and date-palms, the spates of which are interwoven?

26:149.t: 1481 And you hew out houses from the hills with pride.

26:150.t: So fear Allah and obey me,

26:151.t: and do not obey the order of the transgressors

26:152.t: make mischief on the land and who do not set things right".

26:153.t: They said, "You are merely one of those bewitched.

26:154.t: You are nothing but a human like us. So, bring a sign if you are one of the truthful."

26:155.t: He said, "This is a she-camel - She has a share of water, and you have a share of water on a specified day.

26:156.t: So do not touch her with evil (intent), lest you should be seized by a painful punishment."

26:157.t: But they killed her, then they became remorseful and the punishment seized them.

26:158.t: Surely in this there is a sign, and most of them are not to believe.

26:159.t: And surely, your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.

26:160.t: The people of Lut (علیہ السلام) belied the messengers

26:161.t: when their brother Lut (علیہ السلام) said to them, "Do you not fear Allah?

26:162.t: I am an honest messenger for you.

26:163.t: So fear Allah and obey me.

26:164.t: And I do not claim from you any reward for it. My reward is with none but with the Lord of the worlds.

26:165.t: Do you go to the males (for having sex) out of the whole universe,

26:166.t: and leave what your Lord has created for you, that is, your wives? in fact, you are a people who cross (all) limits."

26:167.t: They said, "If you do not stop 0 Lut, you shall be included among the outcast."

26:168.t: He said "Certainly, I am hateful to your act.

26:169.t: 0 my Lord, save me and my family from what they do."

26:170.t: So We saved him and his family, all of them

26:171.t: except an old woman among those who remained behind.

26:173.t: and subjected them to a terrible rain. So evil was the rain of those who were warned.

26:174.t: Surely, in this there is a sign, but most of them are not to believe.

26:175.t: And surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.

26:176.t: The people of Aykah belied the messengers

26:177.t: when Shu'aib said to them, 'Do you not fear Allah?

26:178.t: I am an honest messenger for you.

26:179.t: So fear Allah and obey me.

26:180.t: And I do not claim from you any reward for it; my reward is with none but with the Lord of the worlds.

26:181.t: Give full measure and do not be among those who bring loss to others.

26:182.t: And weigh with an even balance.

26:183.t: And do not make people short of their things and do not spread disorder in the land as mischief makers.

26:184.t: And be fearful of the One who created you and the former generations."

26:185.t: They said, "You are but one of the bewitched men.

26:186.t: And you are no more than a human like us, and in fact we consider you to be one of the liars.

26:187.t: So cause a piece from the sky to fall down upon us, if you are one of the truthful."

26:188.t: He said, 'My Lord knows best what you do."

26:189.t: Thus they belied him, so they were seized by the torment of the Day of Canopy. Indeed it was the punishment of a terrible day.

26:190.t: Surely in this there is a sign, but most of them are not to believe.

26:191.t: Add surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.

26:192.t: And this (Qur'an) is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.

26:193.t: It is brought by the Trusted Spirit down

26:194.t: to your heart, so that you become one of the warners

26:196.t: And of course, it is (mentioned) in the scriptures of the former people.

26:197.t: Is it not a proof for them that the knowledgeable of the children of Isra'il recognize him (the prophet)?

26:198.t: And (even) if We had revealed it to a non-Arab,

26:199.t: and he would have recited it to them, they were not to believe in it.

26:200.t: Thus We have made it enter into the hearts of the sinners.

26:201.t: They will not believe in it until they will see the painful punishment

26:202.t: and it will come to them suddenly while they will not be anticipating (it),
