33:53.t: O those who believe, do not enter the houses of the Prophet, unless you are permitted for a meal, not (so early as) to wait for its preparation. But when you are invited, go inside. Then, once you have had the meal, then disperse, and (do) not (sit for long) being keen for a chat. This (conduct of yours) hurts the Prophet, but he feels shy of (telling) you (about it). And Allah is not shy of the truth. And when you ask anything from them (the blessed wives of the Prophet), ask them from behind a curtain. That is better for the purity of your hearts and their hearts. And it is not allowed for you that you hurt Allah's Messenger, nor that you ever marry his wives after him. Indeed, it would be an enormity in the sight of Allah.

33:54.t: If you disclose any thing, or conceal it, Allah is All-Knowing about everything.

33:55.t: There is no sin for them (the wives of the Prophet) in (appearing without hijab before) their fathers, or their brothers, or the sons of their brothers, or the sons of their sisters, or their own (Muslim) women, or their slave-girls. And (0 wives of the Prophet,) fear Allah. Surely, Allah is witness to everything.

33:56.t: Surely, Allah and His angels send blessings to the Prophet. 0 those who believe, do pray Allah to bless him, and send your Salam (prayer for his being in peace) to him in abundance.

33:57.t: Surely, those who annoy Allah and His Messenger are cursed by Allah in this world and the Hereafter, and He has prepared for them a humiliating punishment.

33:58.t: And those who hurt believing men and believing women without their having done anything (wrong), they shall bear the burden of slander and a manifest sin.

33:59.t: O prophet, tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers that they should draw down their shawls over them. That will make it more likely that they are recognized, hence not teased. And Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

33:60.t: If the hypocrites and those having malady in their hearts and the ones who spread rumors in Madinah do not stop (their evil deeds), We will certainly stir you up against them, then they shall no longer live in it as your neighbors, but for a little while,

33:61.t: (and that too in a state of being) accursed. Wherever they are found, they shall be seized, and shall be killed thoroughly.

33:62.t: a consistent practice of Allah in the matter of those who have gone before. And you will never find a change in Allah's consistent practice.

33:63.t: People ask you about the Hour (i.e. the Day of Judgment). Say," Its knowledge is only with Allah." And what can let you know? It may be that the Hour is near.

33:64.t: Surely, Allah has cursed the infidels, and has prepared for them a flaming fire,

33:65.t: wherein they will live forever, finding no one to protect or to help.

33:66.t: The Day their faces will be rolled in the fire, they will say, “ Oh, would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger!".

33:67.t: And they will say, “ Our Lord, we obeyed our chiefs and our elders, and they made us go astray from the path.

33:68.t: Our Lord, give them twice the punishment, and send a curse on them, an enormous curse.

33:69.t: O those who believe, do not be like those who caused pain to Musa, then Allah cleared him of what they said. And he was honorable in the sight of Allah.

33:70.t: 0 those who believe, fear Allah, and speak what is straight forward.

33:71.t: Allah will correct your deeds for your benefit, and forgive for you your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger achieves a great success.

33:72.t: We did offer the Trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to bear its burden and were afraid of it, and man picked it up. Surely, he was unjust (to himself), unaware (of the end),

33:73.t: with the result that Allah will punish the hypocrites, men and women, and the Mushriks, men and women, and will accept the repentance of the believing men and women. Surely Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

34:1.t: Praise be to Allah, to whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth. And for Him is the praise in the Hereafter. And He is the Wise, the All-Aware.

34:2.t: He knows all that goes into the earth and all that comes out therefrom, and all that comes down from the sky and all that ascends thereto. And He is the Very-Merciful, the Most-Forgiving.

34:3.t: And said those who disbelieve, "The Hour (i.e. the Day of Judgment) will not come to us." Say, 'Why not? By my Lord, the knower of the Unseen, it will come to you. Nothing in the heavens and in the earth, even to the measure of a particle, can escape Him, nor is there anything smaller than that or bigger, that is not recorded in a manifest book.

34:4.t: (The Hour will come,) so that He rewards those who believed and did righteous deeds. For such people, there is forgiveness (from Allah) and a noble provision.

34:5.t: And those who strived against Our signs to defeat (the messenger), for such people there is a painful punishment of the divine wrath.

34:6.t: And those blessed with knowledge see that what is sent to you from your Lord is the truth and it guides (people) to the path of the All-Mighty, the All-Praised.

34:7.t: And the disbelievers said," Shall we point out to you a man who informs you that, when you are totally torn into pieces, you will certainly be (raised) in a new creation?

34:8.t: Has he forged a lie against Allah, or is there a madness in him?" No, but those who do not believe in the Hereafter are in torment and far astray from the right path.

34:9.t: Have they not, then, looked to the sky and the earth that lies before them and behind them? If We so will, We would make the earth swallow them up, or cause pieces of the sky fall upon them. Surely, in this there is a sign for a slave of Allah who turns to Him.

34:10.t: And surely We bestowed grace from Us on Dawud." 0 mountains, pronounce with him Allah's purity repeatedly -- and you too 0 birds!" And We made the iron soft for him

34:11.t: (saying to him,) " Make coats of armour, and maintain balance in combining (their) rings, and do, all of you, righteous deeds. Surely I am watchful of what you do."

34:12.t: And for Sulayman (We subjugated) the wind; its journey in the morning was (equal to the journey of) one month, and its journey in the afternoon was (equal to the journey) of another month. And We caused a stream of copper to flow for him. And there were some Jinns who worked before him by the leave of his Lord. And whoever of them would deviate from Our command, We would make him taste the punishment of the blazing fire.

34:13.t: They used to make for him whatever he wished of castles, images, basins as (large as) tanks and big cook-wares fixed (in their places). " Do good, 0 family of Dawud, in thankfulness. And few from My slaves are thankful."

34:14.t: So, when We decided (that) death (should come) upon him, nothing gave them any indication of his death, except a creature of the earth that had eaten up his scepter. So, when he fell down, the Jinns came to know that if they had the knowledge of the Unseen, they would not have stayed (so long) in the humiliating punishment.

34:15.t: There was indeed a sign for (the community of) Saba' in their home-land: two gardens, on the right and on the left." Eat of the provision from your Lord, and be grateful to Him-- (You have) a good city, and a Most-Forgiving Lord."

34:16.t: Then they turned away. So We released over them the flood of the dam, and replaced their two gardens with two gardens having fruits of bitter taste, and tamarisk and some of the lot-trees.

34:17.t: Thus We punished them because of their ungratefulness. And We do not give (such a) punishment but to the ungrateful.

34:18.t: And We had made towns to be seen between them and between the towns in which We had placed Our blessings, and had measured the journey between them: " Travel along them at nights and days peacefully."

34:19.t: Then they said, "Our Lord, make (the phases of) our journeys more distant." And they wronged themselves, therefore We turned them into stories and tore them into pieces. Surely in this, there are signs for everyone who is ever-patient, fully grateful.

34:20.t: And Iblis has found his assessment true about them. So they followed him, except a group of the believers.

34:21.t: And he did not have any power over them, but for the reason that We should know the one who believes in the Hereafter as distinct from the one who is in doubt about it. And your Lord is Watchful over everything. And he did not have any power over them, but for the reason that We should know the one who believes in the Hereafter as distinct from the one who is in doubt about it. And your Lord is Watchful over everything.

34:22.t: Say." Call upon those whom you claim (to be your gods) beside Allah. They do not possess (anything) even to the measure of a particle, neither in the heavens nor in the earth. They have no contribution at all in either of the two, and He (Allah) has no helper from among them.

34:23.t: And intercession before Him is of no benefit, but for the one whom He has permitted. (And those who will ask for intercession will remain fearful) Until when fear is removed from their hearts, they will say (to each other), " What did your Lord say?" They say, "the Truth". And He is the High, the Great.

34:24.t: Say, 'o gives you sustenance from the heavens and the earth?" Say, " Allah. And We or you are either on the right path or in open error."

34:25.t: Say, "You will not be asked about the sins we committed, and we will not be asked about what you do.

34:26.t: Say, “ Our Lord will assemble us together, then will judge between us with truth. And He is the best Judge, the All-Knowing.

34:27.t: Say, "Show me the ones whom you have associated with Him as partners. Never! He is but Allah, the Mighty, the Wise."

34:28.t: And We did not send you (0 prophet,) but to the entire mankind, as a bearer of good news and as a warner, but most people do not know. [ 28]

34:29.t: And they say, “ When will this promise (of the Day of Judgment) be fulfilled, if you are truthful?"

34:30.t: Say," You have the promise of a day from which you can neither be late for a while, nor can you be ahead of it.

34:31.t: And those who disbelieve say," We will never believe in this Qur'an, nor in that which was before it." But if you could see when the wrongdoers will be made to stand before their Lord, repulsing words (of blame) to one another! Those who were held as weak will say to the overbearing," Had you not been there, we would have been believers."

34:32.t: Those who were overbearing will say to those weak; Was it we who stopped you from (accepting) guidance after it came to you? Rather, you were guilty.

34:33.t: And those weak will say to those overbearing, "But (it was your) intriguing day and night (that stopped us from accepting guidance), when you were directing us to disbelieve in Allah and to set up rivals to Him." And all of them will conceal (their) penitence when they will see the punishment.1 And We will place iron-collars around the necks of those who disbelieved. They will not be recompensed except for what they used to do. (1. They will conceal their penitence from each other, so that they may not face embarrassment before others.)

34:34.t: And We did not send a warner to a township, but said those who lived a luxurious life therein," We reject what you have been sent with."

34:35.t: And they said, “ We are superior in riches and children, and we are not going to be punished".

34:36.t: Say, "In fact, my Lord extends provision to whom He wills, and straitens (it for whom He wills), but most of the people do not know".

34:37.t: And neither your riches nor your children are the things that bring you near Us closely; however, the one who believes and acts righteously (is close to Us). Therefore, such people will have the double reward for what they did, and they will be at peace in the upper chambers (of Paradise).

34:38.t: As for those who strive against our signs trying to frustrate (them), they will be arraigned into the torment.

34:39.t: Say, "Surely, my Lord extends provision for whomsoever He wills out of His servants, and straitens (it) for him. And whatever thing you spend, He replaces it. And He is the best of the sustainers.

34:40.t: And (remember) the Day when He will gather them all together, then will say to the angels," Is it you that these people used to worship?"

34:41.t: They will say, "Pure are You! You are our mentor, not these. Rather, they used to worship the Jinns. Most of these believed in them."

34:42.t: So, you have no power today to benefit or harm one another, and We will say to the wrongdoers, “ Taste the punishment of Fire that you used to belie."

34:43.t: And when Our evident verses are recited to them, they say," He is nothing but a man who wishes to divert you from what your fathers used to worship." And they say," This is nothing but a forged lie." And the disbelievers say about the Truth, when it came to them, “ This is nothing but an explicit magic."

34:44.t: And We did not give them any books that they might study, nor did We send to them any warner before you.

34:45.t: And those before them had rejected (the messengers), while these (infidels of Makkah) have not reached even one tenth of what We gave to those (before them). So, they rejected my Messengers. Then (imagine) how was My censure!

34:46.t: Say," I advise you for one thing only: that you stand up before Allah, in pairs and in singles, then reflect; (you will easily appreciate that) there is no madness in your fellow (the Holy Prophet ﷺ). He is none but a warner to you in the face of a stern torment.

34:47.t: Say, "If I had ever claimed any reward from you, then it is yours. My reward is with none but Allah. And He is witness over everything."

34:48.t: Say," My Lord sends forth the Truth. He is the Best-Knower of the Unseen."

34:49.t: Say, " Truth has come, and falsehood (has vanished so as it) has no power to produce or reproduce (anything)."

34:50.t: Say, "If I go astray, I shall go astray only to my own detriment. And if I follow the right path, it is because of what my Lord reveals to me. Surely He is All-Hearer, Ever-Near.

34:51.t: And if you could only see when they will be terrified! Then there will be no escape, and they will be seized from a place near at hand.

34:52.t: And they will say, "We believe in Him." And how can they achieve it (the faith) from a place (so) far off,

34:53.t: while they had rejected it before, and used to make conjectures from a place (so) far off?

34:54.t: And a barrier will be placed between them and that which they desire, as it will be done with the people of their kind who were before (them). They were in a perplexing doubt.

35:1.t: All praise belongs to Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, who makes the angels messengers having wings, in twos, threes and fours. He adds to the creation what He wills. Indeed, Allah is powerful to do everything.

35:2.t: Whatever blessing Allah opens for the people, there is none to hold it back, and whatever He holds back, there is none to release it thereafter. And He is the Mighty, the Wise.

35:3.t: 0 mankind, remember Allah's blessing upon you. Is there any creator other than Allah who gives you provision from the sky and the earth? There is no god, but He. So, to where are you being turned around (by your desires)?

35:4.t: And if they reject you,( it is not something new, because) many messengers have been rejected before you. And to Allah all matters are to be returned.

35:5.t: 0 mankind, Allah's promise is definitely true, therefore, the worldly life must not deceive you, nor should you be deceived about Allah by the big deceiver (Satan).

35:6.t: Surely Satan is an enemy for you. So, take him as an enemy. He invites his group only to cause them to be among the people of blazing fire.

35:7.t: Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment; and those who believe and do righteous deeds will have forgiveness and a great reward.

35:8.t: Is it, then, that the one whose evil deed has been made attractive to him so much that he deems it to be good (will be held equal to him who differentiates between right and wrong) ? The fact, therefore, is that Allah lets go astray whomsoever He wills, and leads to the right path whomsoever He wills. So, let not your soul collapse in grief for them. Surely Allah fully knows what they are doing.

35:9.t: And Allah is the One who sends the winds, then they raise up the clouds, then We drive them to a dead land and revive the land through them after its death. In similar way shall be the resurrection.

35:10.t: Whoever desires honor, then all honor lies with Allah alone. Towards Him ascends the pure word, and the righteous deed uplifts it. As for those who plot evils, for them there is a severe punishment, and their plot itself will perish.

35:11.t: And Allah has created you from dust, then from a drop of semen, then He made you couples. And no female conceives nor gives birth without His knowledge. And no aged person is made to advance in age, nor a part is curtailed from his age, but all this is (recorded) in a book. Surely all this is easy for Allah.

35:12.t: And two seas are not alike; this one is sweet, saturating, pleasant to drink, and that one is saltish, bitter. And from each, you eat fresh meat, and derive ornaments that you wear. And you see the boats therein cleaving through water, so that you may search for His grace, and that you may be grateful.

35:13.t: He makes the night enter into the day and makes the day enter into the night, and He has subjugated the sun and the moon; each one of them is running towards an appointed time. That is Allah, your Lord. To Him belongs the kingdom. And those whom you invoke beside Him do not own even the membrane on a date-stone.

35:14.t: If you call them, they do not hear your call, and even if they were to hear, they would not respond to you. And on the Day of Judgment they will deny your having held them as Allah's partners. and none can inform you like Him who is Aware.

35:15.t: O men, you are the ones who need Allah, and Allah is the Need-Free, the Ever-Praised.

35:16.t: If He so wills, He can do away with you and bring a new creation.

35:17.t: And for Allah, that is not something difficult.

35:18.t: And no bearer will bear the burden of any other person. And if a person carrying a heavy load calls (someone) to (share) his load, nothing from it shall be carried (by the latter), even though he be a near of kin. You can warn only those who fear their Lord unseen and establish salah. And whoever gets purified gets purified for his own benefit. And to Allah is the final return.

35:19.t: And the blind and the sighted are not equal,

35:21.t: nor shade and heat of the sun.

35:22.t: And the living and the dead are not alike. Allah makes hear whomsoever He wills. And you cannot make hear those who are in the graves.

35:24.t: Surely We have sent you with truth as a bearer of good news and as a warner, and there was no community without a warner having passed among them.

35:25.t: And if they reject you, (it is not something new, because) those before them have (also) rejected (messengers). Their messengers came to them with clear proofs and with scriptures and with the enlightening book.

35:26.t: Then I seized those who disbelieved. So, how was My censure!

35:27.t: Did you not see that Allah has sent down water from the sky? Then We brought forth with it fruits having different colors. And among the mountains there are tracks, white and red-- of different colors, and (others) utterly black.

35:28.t: And among humans and beasts and cattle, there are those having different colors as well. Only those of His slaves fear Allah who are knowledgeable. Surely Allah is Mighty, Forgiving.

35:29.t: Surely those who recite Allah's Book and have established salah and have spent, from what We have provided them, secretly and openly, they hope for a trade that will never crash,

35:30.t: so that He pays them their rewards in full, and gives them more out of His grace. Surely He is Most-Forgiving, Very- Appreciative.

35:31.t: And the Book We have revealed to you is the Truth, confirming what was (revealed) before it. Surely Allah, in respect of His slaves, is All-Aware, All-Seeing.

35:32.t: Then We conveyed the Book as an heritage to those of Our slaves whom We chose. Then, some of them are those who wrong their own selves, and some of them are mediocre, and some of them are those who outpace (others) in righteous deeds with Allah's permission. That is the great bounty,

35:33.t: gardens of eternity they enter. They will be ornamented with bracelets of gold and with pearls, and their dress therein will be (of) silk.

35:34.t: And they will say, "Praise be to Allah who has removed all sorrow from us. Surely our Lord is Most-Forgiving, Very-Appreciative,

35:35.t: who, out of His grace, has made us land at a home of eternal living where neither we are touched by weariness, nor are we touched by boredom."

35:36.t: And those who disbelieve, for them shall be the fire of Jahannam; neither they will be sentenced to death, so that they die, nor will its torment be lightened for them. It is in this way that We punish every infidel.

35:37.t: And they will be crying therein, “ Our Lord, take us out from here, and we will act righteously, not in the way we have been doing before. " (Allah will say to them,) " Did We not give you an age in your life in which lesson could have been learnt by the one who wished to take lesson? And (furthermore) the warner had (also) come to you. So, have a taste, because the wrongdoers will have no supporter.

35:38.t: Surely Allah is the Knower of the unseen in the heavens and the earth. Indeed He fully knows what lies in the hearts.

35:39.t: He is the One who has made you successors (of the past generations) in the earth. So the one who becomes infidel, his infidelity will go against himself. And their infidelity adds nothing to the infidels but anger with their Lord, and their infidelity adds nothing to the infidels but loss.

35:40.t: Say, "Tell me about your (presumed) co-gods whom you invoke beside Allah. Show me that part of the earth that they have created, or do they have a share in the (creation) of the heavens? “ Or have We given them a book so that they are upon a clear proof from it? No, but the wrongdoers promise one another nothing but delusion.

35:41.t: Undoubtedly, Allah holds back the heavens and the earth from leaving their existing state, and if they were to leave, there is none who can hold them back, except Him. Surely He is Forbearing, Most-Forgiving.

35:42.t: And they had sworn forceful oaths that if a warner would come to them, they would be more receptive to guidance than any other community. But when a warner came to them, it added nothing to them but aversion,

35:43.t: because of their showing arrogance in the land and plotting of evil. And the evil plot envelops none but its own people (who make it). So, they are looking for nothing but the (divine) practice with the earlier people. So you will never find in Allah's practice any change, and you will never find in Allah's practice any diversion.

35:44.t: Did they not travel in the land and see how was the end of those before them? And they were stronger than these in power. And Allah is not such that something in the heavens or the earth can frustrate Him. Surely He is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.

35:45.t: And if Allah were to take mankind to task for what they did, He would have not left a living creature on its back, but He delays them upto an appointed time. So when their time will come, then Allah is the One who will see His slaves.

36:2.t: By the Qur'an, that is full of wisdom,

36:3.t: You are truly one of the messengers,

36:5.t: (this Qur'an being) a revelation from the All-Mighty, the Very-Merciful,

36:6.t: so that you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned, and hence, they are unaware.

36:7.t: The word has indeed come true about most of them, so they will not believe.

36:8.t: Surely We have placed iron collars on their necks, so they are reaching upto their chins, and their heads are forced to remain upraised.

36:9.t: And We have placed a barrier in front of them and a barrier behind them, and (thus) they are encircled by Us; so they do not see.

36:10.t: And it is all equal for them whether you warn them or do not warn them, they will not believe.

36:11.t: You can (usefully) warn only the one who follows the advice and fears the Ralhman (the All-Merciful) unseen. So give him the good news of forgiveness and of a noble reward.

36:12.t: Surely We will give new life to the dead, and We are recording whatever (deeds) they send ahead and whatever effects they leave behind. And everything is fully computed by Us in a manifest source-book.

36:13.t: And cite to them the example of the People of the Town, when the messengers came to it,

36:14.t: when We sent to them two (apostles), and they rejected them both, so We supported them with a third one. So they said, 'We are sent to you. "

36:15.t: They (The people of the Town) said, " You are no more than human beings like us, and the Rahman has not sent down anything. You are but telling a lie."

36:16.t: They (the messengers) said," Our Lord knows that we are undoubtedly sent to you.

36:17.t: And our obligation is no more than to convey the message clearly."

36:18.t: They (the People of the Town) said," We take you as a bad omen for us. If you do not desist, we will certainly stone you, and you will be subjected to a painful punishment from us.

36:19.t: They said, "Your bad omen is with yourselves. (Do you take it as bad omen) if you are given a good counsel? Rather, you are a people who cross all limits."

36:20.t: And there came a man rushing from the farthest part of the city. He said, " 0 my people, follow the messengers.

36:21.t: Follow those who do not claim any reward from you, and they are on the right path.

36:22.t: And what excuse do I have if I do not worship the One who has created me and to whom you will be returned?

36:23.t: Shall I adopt those gods besides Him that if the Rahman intends to do harm to me, their intercession cannot help me in the least, nor can they come to my rescue?

36:24.t: In that case, I will be in open error indeed.

36:25.t: Undoubtedly I have believed in your Lord; so listen to me."

36:26.t: (Thereafter when his people killed him,) it, was said to him, " Enter the Paradise". He said," Would that my people knew

36:27.t: how my Lord has forgiven me and placed me among the honored ones!"

36:28.t: And We did not send down to his people any army from the heavens after him, nor were We (in need) to send down.

36:29.t: It was no more than a single Cry, and in no time they were extinguished.

36:30.t: Alas for the slaves (of Allah) ! No messenger came to them, but they have been mocking at him.

36:31.t: Did they not see how many generations We have destroyed before them who will not come back to them?

36:32.t: And all of them are but to be assembled together (and) to be arraigned before Us.

36:33.t: And a sign for them is the dead land. We gave it life and brought forth grain from it; so from it they eat.

36:34.t: And We have placed gardens of date-palms and grapes and caused springs to gush forth therein,

36:35.t: so that they may eat fruits thereof, while it was not made by their hands. Would they not then offer gratitude?

36:36.t: Pure (from every fault) is the One who has created all the pairs of whatever the earth grows, and of the humans themselves, and of that which they do not know.

36:37.t: And a sign for them is the night. We strip the (cover on day from it, and they are suddenly in darkness.

36:38.t: And the sun is quickly proceeding towards its resting place. That is the designing of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.

36:39.t: And for the moon, We have appointed measured phases, until it turned (pale, curved and fine) like an old branch of date-palm.

36:40.t: Neither it is for the sun to overtake the moon, nor can the night outpace the day. And each one is floating in an orbit.

36:41.t: And a sign for them is that We boarded their children at the loaded ship,

36:42.t: and created for them things similar to it on which they ride.

36:43.t: And if We so will, We can drown them; then no one will respond to their cry, nor will they be rescued,

36:44.t: unless there be mercy from Us, and (unless) We let them enjoy for a while.

36:45.t: And (they pay no heed) when it is said to them, “ Save yourselves from that (punishment) which is before you (in this world) and that which will come after you (die), so that you may receive mercy".

36:46.t: And there comes to them no sign from the signs of your Lord, but they turn averse to it.

36:47.t: And when it is said to them, "Spend (to the needy) from the provision Allah has given to you", the disbelievers say to the believers, "Shall we feed those whom Allah could have fed, if Allah so willed? You are but in the open error."

36:48.t: And they say, 'en will this promise come true, if you are truthful? "

36:49.t: They are looking for nothing but for a single Cry that will seize them when they will be quarreling.

36:50.t: So they will not be able to make a bequest, nor will they return to their household.

36:51.t: And the Horn will be blown, and suddenly they will be rushing from their graves towards their Lord.

36:52.t: They will say, “ Woe to us! Who has raised us from our sleeping place? “ This is what the Rahman had promised, and the messengers had told the truth.

36:53.t: It will be no more than a single Cry, and in no time they will all be arraigned before Us.

36:54.t: Then, nobody will be subjected to injustice in the least, and you will not be recompensed but for what you used to do.

36:55.t: The people of the Paradise are engaged today in (their) activities, happily enjoying (them).

36:56.t: They and their spouses are in pleasant shades, reclining on couches.

36:57.t: For them there are fruits, and for them there is whatever they ask for.

36:58.t: "Salam" (Peace upon you) is the word ( they receive ) from Merciful Lord.

36:59.t: "And get apart (from the believers) today 0 the guilty ones.

36:60.t: Did I not direct you, 0 children of 'Adam, that you must not worship the Shaitan, (because) he is an open enemy for you,

36:61.t: and that you must worship Me, (because) this is the straight path?

36:62.t: And he had misguided lot many people from among you. So, did you not have sense?

36:63.t: (Now) this is the Jahannam of which you were consistently warned.

36:64.t: Enter it today, because you have been persistently denying (the truth)."

36:65.t: Today We will set a seal on their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their legs will bear witness about what they used to do.

36:66.t: And had We willed, We would have wiped out their eyes, and they would have been racing towards the way, but how would they see?

36:67.t: And had we willed, We would have disfigured them at their places, and they would have not been able to move , nor would they return.

36:68.t: And whomsoever We give long life, we reverse him in creation. So, do they not have sense?

36:69.t: And We did not teach him (the Holy Prophet) poetry, and it is not proper for him. It is nothing (of that sort) but (it is) an advice and a readable book that explains (the truth),

36:70.t: so that it warns him who is alive ( to listen to the truth ), and so that the word may prove true against the disbelievers.

36:71.t: Did they not see that We have created for them cattle, among things made (directly) by Our hands, then they are their owners?

36:72.t: And We have brought them under their control, so as some of them are their means of transport, and some of them they eat.

36:73.t: And for them there are (other) benefits in them and things to drink. So, would they not be grateful?

36:74.t: And they have adopted other gods than Allah, so that they may be helped (by them).

36:75.t: They cannot help them, rather they (the disbelievers themselves) are (like) an army brought forth for (protecting) them (the so-called co-gods)

36:76.t: So, their remarks must not grieve you. Surely We know what they conceal and what they disclose.

36:77.t: And did man not see that We have created him from a drop of semen? Then suddenly he stood as an open adversary (to Us).

36:78.t: And he has set up an argument about Us and forgot his creation. He said, 'o will give life to the bones when they are decayed?"

36:79.t: Say, "These will be revived by the same One who had created them for the first time, and who is fully aware about every creation,

36:80.t: the One who created for you fire from the green tree, and in no time you kindle from it."

36:81.t: Is it that the One who has created the heavens and the earth has no power to create ones like them? Why not? And He is the Supreme Creator, the All-Knowing.

36:82.t: His practice, when He intends to do something, is no more than He says, "Be", and it comes to be.

36:83.t: So, pure (from every fault) is the One in whose hand is the dominion of all things. And towards Him you are to be returned .

37:1.t: (I swear) by those who stand in rows,

37:2.t: then by those who prevent firmly

37:3.t: then by those who recite the dhihr,

37:4.t: surely your God is but One,

37:5.t: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, and Lord of the points of the sunrise.

37:6.t: Verily, We have decorated the nearest sky with an adornment, the stars,

37:7.t: and (have made them) a security against every rebellious shaitan (shaitan).

37:8.t: They cannot listen to the Upper Realm and are hit from every side

37:9.t: to be driven off, and for them there is a lasting punishment,

37:10.t: however, if one snatches a little bit, he is pursued by a bright flame.

37:11.t: Now ask them, "Are they stronger in the formation of their bodies, or those (other beings) We have created?" Certainly, We did create them from sticky clay.

37:12.t: But you wonder (at their denial), and they mock (at the idea of an Hereafter).

37:13.t: And when any advice is given to them, they pay no heed to it.

37:14.t: And when they see a sign, they make fun of it,

37:15.t: and say, "This is nothing but an open magic.

37:16.t: Is it when we have died and become dust and bones, that we shall be raised again,

37:17.t: and even our fathers of a foretime?"

37:18.t: Say, "Yes - and you shall be disgraced (too) !"

37:19.t: So, it will be only a single (castigating) Call, and all of a sudden they will begin to see.

37:20.t: And they will be saying, 'Woe to us; this is the Day of Retribution."

37:21.t: (It will be said to them,) This is the Day of Judgment that you used to deny.

37:22.t: Muster all those who were unjust, and their fellows, and whatever they used to worship

37:23.t: other than Allah, and show them the way to Jahannam,

37:24.t: and make them stop (for a while) - they are to be questioned:

37:25.t: " at has happened to you that you do not help each other?"

37:26.t: On the contrary, all of them today are totally submissive .

37:27.t: And some of them (the followers of their chiefs) will turn to others (the chiefs), asking questions from one another.

37:28.t: They (the followers) will say, "You were the ones who used to come to (mislead) us forcefully."

37:29.t: They (the chiefs) will say, "On the contrary, you yourselves were no believers.

37:30.t: And we had no authority over you at all, but you yourselves were a transgressing people.

37:31.t: So, the word of our Lord has come true against us. Indeed, we have to taste (the punishment).

37:32.t: We did misguide you, (because) we were ourselves erroneous".

37:33.t: So, this day, they will be sharers in the punishment.

37:34.t: This is how we deal with the criminals.

37:35.t: They were those to whom when it was said: 'there is no god but Allah', they waxed proud,

37:36.t: and used to say, "Are we really to leave our gods because of an insane poet?"

37:37.t: No, he has come with the truth and has confirmed all the messengers (of Allah).

37:38.t: Surely you have to taste the painful punishment-

37:39.t: And you will be recompensed for nothing but for what you used to do -

37:40.t: unlike the chosen servants of Allah.

37:41.t: Those are the people for whom there is a known provision,

37:42.t: the fruits; and they will be honored

37:45.t: They will be served with a cup from a flowing drink,

37:46.t: white, delicious for those who drink.

37:47.t: There will be no headache therein, nor will they be intoxicated with it,

37:48.t: and by their side there will be females restricting their gazes (to their husbands), having pretty big eyes,

37:49.t: as if they were eggs hidden (under feathers protected from pollution).

37:50.t: Then they will turn to each other asking questions mutually,

37:51.t: A speaker from them will say, “ I had a companion

37:52.t: who used to say (to me), 'Are you one of those who believe?

37:53.t: Is it when we have died and become dust and bones? Is it true that we are going to be recompensed for our deeds ]?"'

37:54.t: He (the speaker) will say (to other people in Paradise) 'Would you like to have a look (to Jahannam to find out what happened to that companion of mine)?"

37:55.t: So he looked - and he saw him in the middle of Jahannam.

37:56.t: He said, "By Allah, you were going almost to ruin me.

37:57.t: But for the favour of my Lord, I would have been among those produced for punishment."

37:58.t: (Then the speaker will address the other people of Paradise in delight and wonder, saying, "Are we not then to die anymore

37:59.t: beyond our first death, nor are we going to be punished?

37:60.t: This is, indeed, the great success.

37:61.t: For this kind (of achievement), all workers must work.

37:62.t: Is that better as hospitality or the tree of Zaqqum?

37:63.t: We have made it a test for the unjust.

37:64.t: It is a tree that comes out in the bottom of Jahannam.

37:65.t: Its fruits are like the heads of satans.

37:66.t: So, they have to eat from it and have to fill their bellies with it.

37:67.t: Then they will have, on top of it, a mixture made of boiling water.

37:68.t: Then, their return is but to the Fire.

37:69.t: They found their fathers on the wrong path.

37:70.t: So, they used to run in their footsteps.

37:71.t: And most of the earlier ones (too) had gone astray before them.

37:72.t: And We did send warners among them.

37:73.t: So look, how was the end of those warned -

37:74.t: except the chosen servants of Allah.

37:75.t: And Nuh did call Us (for help after he was disappointed from his people), so We were the best to respond.

37:76.t: And We delivered him and his family from the great agony,

37:77.t: and made his progeny the sole survivors.

37:78.t: And We left for him ( a word of praise) among the later people, (that is):

37:79.t: Salam be on Nuh among (the people of) all the worlds.

37:80.t: Certainly, this is how We reward those who are good in deeds.

37:81.t: He was one of Our believing servants.

37:83.t: And certainly from his adherents was Ibrahim.

37:84.t: (Remember) when he came to his Lord with a pure heart,

37:85.t: when he said to his father and his people, "What is that which you worship?

37:86.t: Do you wish ( to have) fallacious gods other than Allah?

37:87.t: Then, what is your opinion about the Lord of the worlds?"

37:88.t: Then, he cast a look at the stars,

37:90.t: So they departed from him, turning their backs.

37:91.t: And he made his way to their gods and said to them, 'Why would you not eat?

37:92.t: What is wrong with you that you do not speak?"

37:93.t: Then he attacked them striking with his right hand.

37:94.t: Then, they (the idolaters) came to him rushing.

37:95.t: He said, "Do you worship what is carved by yourselves,

37:96.t: while Allah has created you and what you make?"

37:97.t: They said, "Build for him a structure, and throw him into the blazing fire."

37:98.t: So, they intended to bring harm to him, but We made them the lowest (by frustrating their plan).

37:99.t: And he said, "I am going to my Lord. He will show me the way.

37:100.t: 0 my Lord, bless me with a righteous son."

37:101.t: So, We gave him the good news of a forbearing boy.

37:102.t: Thereafter, when he reached an age in which he could work with him, he said, "0 my little son, I have seen in a dream that I am slaughtering you, so consider, what do you think? "He said, "0 my dear father, do what you have been ordered to do. You will find me, insha'Allah, (if Allah wills) one of those who endure patiently."

37:103.t: So, (it was a great episode) when both of them submitted themselves (to Allah's will), and he laid him on his forehead

37:104.t: and then We called out to him, "0 Ibrahim,

37:105.t: you did make the dream come true." This is how We reward those who are good in deeds.

37:106.t: This was indeed a trial that clearly demonstrated (their obedience).

37:107.t: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice.

37:108.t: and We left for him (a word of praise) among the later people,

37:110.t: This is how We reward those who are good in deeds.

37:111.t: Surely, he is among Our believing servants.

37:112.t: And We gave him the good news of Ishaq, a prophet from among the righteous.

37:113.t: And We did bless him, and Ishaq - and among the progeny of both of them, some are good and some are utterly unjust to their own selves.

37:114.t: And We did bestow favors upon Musa and Harun,

37:115.t: and We delivered them and their people from the great agony,

37:116.t: and We helped them, so they became victors,

37:117.t: and We gave them the clear book,

37:118.t: and guided them to the straight path.

37:119.t: And We left for them (a word of praise) among the later people ,

37:120.t: (that is,) Salam on Musa and Harun!

37:121.t: This is how We reward those who are good in deeds.

37:122.t: Surely, both of them are among Our believing servants.

37:123.t: And surely, Ilyas ( Eliah ) is one of the messengers.

37:124.t: (Remember) when he said to his people: "Do you not fear Allah?

37:125.t: Do you invoke Ba'l, and ignore the Best of the creators,

37:126.t: that is, Allah who is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?"

37:127.t: Then they rejected him. Therefore, they will be arraigned -

37:128.t: except the chosen servants of Allah.

37:129.t: And We left for him (a word of praise) among the later people,

37:131.t: This is how We reward those who are good in deeds.

37:132.t: Surely, he is from among Our believing servants.

37:133.t: And surely, Lut is one of the messengers.

37:134.t: (Remember) when We saved him and his family, all of them,

37:135.t: except an old woman among those remaining behind.

37:137.t: and you do pass over them at daybreak

37:138.t: and by nightfall. Would you still not understand?

37:139.t: And surely, Yunus ( Jonah ) is from among the messengers.

37:140.t: ( Remember ) when he ran away towards the boat already loaded.

37:141.t: Then he participated in drawing lots (to offload one of the passengers ) and was the one who was defeated.

37:142.t: Then the fish swallowed him while he was reproaching his own self.

37:143.t: Had he not been of those who proclaim Allah's purity,

37:144.t: he would have definitely lived in its belly till the day when the dead will be raised.

37:145.t: Then We cast him ashore in the open while he was ill.

37:146.t: and We caused a tree of ourds to grow over him.

37:147.t: And We had sent him (as messenger) to one hundred thousand, or more.

37:148.t: So, they believed, then, We let them enjoy for a time.

37:149.t: So ask them, "Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?"

37:150.t: Or, did We create the angels as females while they were witnessing?

37:151.t: Beware! They are the ones who, by way of a lie of theirs, (have the audacity to) say,

37:152.t: "Allah has children" - and they are absolute liars.

37:153.t: Is it that Allah has chosen daughters (for Himself) instead of sons?

37:154.t: at is the matter with you? How (arbitrarily) do you judge?

37:155.t: Then, is it that you do not think about it?

37:156.t: Or, is it that there is some open authority with you?

37:157.t: Then bring your book, if you are truthful.

37:158.t: And they have made up between Him and the Jinns some kinship, while the Jinns already know that they are bound to appear (before Him).

37:159.t: Pure is Allah from what they describe -

37:160.t: except the chosen servants of Allah.

37:161.t: So, you and those whom you worship -

37:162.t: none of you can make one turn away from Him -

37:163.t: except the one who is to burn in Jahannam.

37:164.t: And (the angels say,) "There is no one among us who does not have a known station,

37:165.t: and We, surely We, are those who stand in rows

37:166.t: and We, surely We, are those who proclaim Allah's purity."

37:168.t: "Had there been a scripture like that of the former ones with us,

37:169.t: certainly we would have been the chosen servants of Allah."

37:170.t: Then they disbelieved in it. So, very soon, they will come to know.

37:171.t: And Our Word has already gone ahead in favor of Our servants - the messengers -

37:172.t: they are the ones who will have Allah's support,

37:173.t: and verily it will be Our army (of chosen servants) that prevails.

37:174.t: So, withdraw your attention from them for a time.

37:175.t: But, see them for they shall soon see.

37:176.t: Are they asking for Our punishment to come sooner?

37:177.t: So, when it descends in their courtyard, then, evil will be the dawn of those warned.

37:178.t: So, withdraw your attention from them for a time.

37:179.t: And watch them, for they shall soon see.

37:180.t: Pure is your Lord, the Lord of all might and honor, from what they describe

37:181.t: and salam be on the messengers

37:182.t: and praised is Allah, Lord of all the worlds.

38:1.t: Sad. By the Qur'an, (the book) of advice, (this is true,)

38:2.t: but those who disbelieve are (involved) in false pride and opposition.

38:3.t: How many a generation We have destroyed before them, so they cried out (for mercy), while no time was left for having refuge.

38:4.t: And they wonder that a warner has come to them from among themselves. And the disbelievers say, "This is a magician, a sheer liar.

38:5.t: Has he (not) turned all the gods into a single God? Certainly, it is a very strange thing."

38:6.t: And the leaders among them went forth saying (to their followers)," Walk away (from the Prophet) and stay firm on (adhering to) your gods. This (call of the Prophet) is surely something designed (for his personal benefit).

38:7.t: We never heard of it in the former faith (of ours).This is nothing but a false invention.

38:8.t: Is it (believable) that the message of advice has been sent down to him (alone) from among all of us?" The fact is that they are in doubt about My message; rather, they have not yet tasted My punishment.

38:9.t: Do they have the treasures of the mercy of your Lord, the Mighty, the Bountiful?

38:10.t: Or do they have the ownership of the heavens and the earth and what lies between them? Then let them ascend (to the sky) by ropes.

38:11.t: at is there (in Makkah) is just a host of the (opposing) groups that has to be defeated.

38:12.t: Even before them, the people of Nuh and 'Ad and Fir'aun (Pharaoh), the man of stakes,

38:13.t: and Thamud and the people of Lat and the people of Aykah have rejected (the messengers). They were the (strong) groups.

38:14.t: All of them did nothing but declare the messengers as liars; hence, My punishment became due.

38:15.t: And these people are waiting for nothing but for a single Cry (the sound of the Trumpet to be blown on the Doomsday) that will have no pause.

38:16.t: And they say, " 0 our Lord, give us our share (of the punishment) sooner, before the Day of Reckoning."

38:17.t: Bear patiently with what they say, and remember Our slave Dawud, the man of might. Surely he was ever-turning to Allah.

38:18.t: We had subjugated the mountains to join him (in) making tasbih (i.e. pronouncing Allah's purity) at evening and sunrise,

38:19.t: and the birds as well, mustered together. All were turning to Allah with him.

38:20.t: And We made his kingdom strong, and gave him wisdom and decisive speech.

38:21.t: And has there come to you the story of the litigants, when they entered the sanctuary by climbing over the wall?

38:22.t: When they entered upon Dawud, and he was scared of them, they said, " Be not scared. We are two litigants; one of us has wronged the other, so decide between us with truth, and do not cross the limits, and guide us to the right path.

38:23.t: This is my brother; he has ninety nine ewes, and I have a single ewe; still he said, 'Give it into my charge.' And he overpowered me in speech."

38:24.t: He (Dwud) said, "He has certainly wronged you by demanding your ewe to be added to his ewe. And many partners oppress one another, except those who believe and do righteous deeds, and very few they are." And Dawud realized that We had put him to a test, so he prayed to his Lord for forgiveness, and bowing down, he fell in prostration, and turned (to Allah).

38:25.t: So we forgave him that (lapse), and surely he has a place of nearness in Our presence, and an excellent resort.

38:26.t: 0 Dawud, We have made you a vicegerent on earth, so judge between people with truth, and do not follow the selfish desire, lest it should lead you astray from Allah's path. Surely those who go astray from Allah's path will have a severe punishment, because they had forgotten the Day of Reckoning.

38:27.t: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them in vain. That is the thinking of those who disbelieve. So, woe to the disbelievers because of the Fire (they have to face).

38:28.t: Shall We make those who believe and do righteous deeds equal to those who commit mischief on the earth? Or shall We make the God-fearing equal to the sinners?

38:29.t: This is a blessed Book We have revealed to you, so that they deliberate in its verses and, and so that the men of understanding may take to advice.

38:30.t: And We blessed Dawud with Sulayman. He was an excellent slave (of Allah). Surely, he was great in turning (to Us, in penitence and praise).

38:31.t: (Worth remembering is the incident) when the swift horses of high breeding were presented before him in the evening.

38:32.t: He said, “ I held the love of the good things (i.e. these horses) dearer than the remembrance of my Lord, until it (the sun ) went behind the veil.

38:33.t: Bring them back to me" - and he started passing his hands over the shanks and the necks.

38:34.t: And We, indeed, tested Sulayman while We threw on his throne a body after which he turned (to Us).

38:35.t: He said, "0 my Lord, forgive me, and bless me with a kingdom that will not be available to anyone after me. Surely, You are the Bountiful.

38:36.t: Then We subjugated the wind for him that blew smoothly on his command to wherever he wished,

38:37.t: and (We subjugated to him) the shaitans (among Jinns), all builders and divers,

38:38.t: and many others held in chains.

38:39.t: This is Our gift. So, do favor (to someone) or withhold (it), with no (requirement to give) account.

38:40.t: He has a place of nearness in Our presence, and an excellent end.

38:41.t: And remember Our slave, Ayyub (Job) - when he called his Lord, "The Shaitan (Satan) has inflicted weariness and pain upon me."

38:42.t: (Allah said to him,) "Strike (the ground) with your foot: Here is a cool water to bathe, and a drink!"

38:43.t: And We let him have his family and the like of them besides, as a mercy from Us, and a reminder for the people of understanding.

38:44.t: And (We said to him,) "Take (a bundle on thin twigs in your hand, and strike with it, and do not violate your oath. Surely, We found him very enduring. He was really an excellent slave. Surely, he was great in turning (to Us, in penitence and praise).

38:45.t: And remember Our servants - Ibrahim and Ishaq and Ya'qub - men of strength and men of vision.

38:46.t: We chose them for a trait of remembering the (eternal) Home (in the Hereafter).

38:47.t: And surely they are, in Our sight, among the chosen, the best of the righteous.

38:48.t: And remember Ismail and al-Yasa' and Dhul-Kifl. Each of them was among the best of the righteous.

38:49.t: This is a reminder (of what has passed). And surely the God-fearing will have the best place to return:

38:50.t: everlasting gardens, with (their) doors opened for them.

38:51.t: They will be relaxing therein, calling there for plenteous fruits and drinks;

38:52.t: and in their company there will be females restricting their glances (to their husbands, and) of matching ages.

38:53.t: This is what you are being promised for the Day of Reckoning.

38:54.t: Surely, that is provision provided by Us to which there is no end.

38:55.t: Having said this, the transgressors will surely have the most evil place to return:

38:56.t: the Jahannam, in which they will enter. So, how evil is that place to rest?

38:57.t: Let them taste this: hot water and pus,

38:58.t: and other things similar to it of various kinds.

38:59.t: (When the leaders of the infidels will see their followers entering the hell after them, they will say to each other,) "This is a multitude rushing in (the hell) with you - they are not welcome - they are to burn in the Fire."

38:60.t: They (the followers) will say (to their leaders) "No, it is you - you are not welcome - you are the ones who brought this upon us." So, how evil is the place to stay (for ever) !

38:61.t: They (the followers) will say, "Our Lord, whoever has brought this on us, do increase his punishment twofold in the Fire."

38:62.t: And they (the infidels) will say, "What is the matter with us that we do not see those men whom we used to count amongst the worst? (i.e. the Muslims whom the infidels used to treat as the worst people among them)

38:63.t: Had we taken them as a laughing-stock (unjustly), or have our eyes missed them?"

38:64.t: That is going to happen definitely, that is, the mutual quarrel of the people of the Fire.

38:65.t: Say, " I am only a warner - and there is no god but Allah, the One, the All- Dominant,

38:66.t: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, the Mighty, the Very-Forgiving."

38:69.t: I had no knowledge of the Heavenly Beings when they were debating (about the creation of 'Adam).1 (1 The reference here is to the conversation that took place between Allah Ta’ ala and His angels when He expressed His intention to create 'Adam (علیہ السلام) ، and which is being mentioned in verse 71 below.)

38:70.t: Revelation is sent to me only because I am a plain warner.

38:71.t: 2 When your Lord said to the angels, "I am going to create man from clay. (2 The sense is that I never knew about what Allah said to His angels when He intended to create 'Adam (علیہ السلام) ، nor was there any source of knowledge available to me other than the revelation from Allah. Now that I am narrating to you these events without having any other source of knowledge, it clearly proves that I am receiving revelation from Allah which has been sent to me only for the purpose that I warn you clearly about the evil fate of rejecting the truth.)

38:72.t: So, once I make him perfectly and breath My spirit into him, you fall down in prostration before him.

38:73.t: Then, the angels prostrated, all of them together -

38:74.t: except Iblis. He waxed proud, and became one of the disbelievers.

38:75.t: He (Allah) said, "0 Iblis, what did prevent you from prostrating before what I created with My hands? Did you wax proud or were you among the lofty ones?"

38:76.t: He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire, and created him from clay."

38:77.t: He said, "Then, get out from here, for you are accursed,

38:78.t: and on you shall remain My curse till the Day of Judgment."

38:79.t: He said, "0 my Lord, then give me respite till the day they are raised again."

38:80.t: He said, "Then, you have been made one of those given respite,

38:81.t: until the Day of the Appointed Time."

38:82.t: He said, "Then, I swear by Your Might, that I will definitely lead them astray, all of them -

38:83.t: except Your chosen servants among them."

38:84.t: He (Allah) said, "Then, the truth is-and it is (always) the truth that I speak---

38:85.t: that I will definitely fill the Jahannam with you and with those who will follow you from among them, all together."

38:86.t: Say, "I do not demand from you any fee for it, nor am I from among those who make up things artificially.

38:87.t: It is nothing but an advice for all the worlds.

38:88.t: And you will come to know its reality after a while."

39:1.t: This is the revelation of the Book from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.

39:2.t: Surely We have revealed the Book to you with the truth; so worship Allah in submission to Him exclusively.

39:3.t: Remember, Allah alone deserves the exclusive submission. As for those who have taken to guardians other than Him (saying), "We worship them for no other reason than that they would bring us near to Allah closely." Allah will judge between them in the matters they had been differing in. Surely, Allah does not give guidance to anyone who is liar, highly infidel.

39:4.t: Had Allah opted to have a son of His own, He would have definitely chosen anyone, as He wished, out of what He had created. (But), Pure is He. He is Allah, the Only One, the All-Dominant

39:5.t: He created the heavens and the earth in His wisdom. He wraps the night over the day and He wraps the day over the night, and He has put the Sun and the Moon under His command, each one of them moving for an appointed term. Remember, He is the Mighty, the Most-Forgiving.

39:6.t: He created you from a single person, then (once this person was created,) He made from him his match, and sent down for you eight pairs of the cattle. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, in three layers of darkness. That is your Allah, your Lord. To Him belongs the whole kingdom. There is no god but He. Then, to where are you being diverted?

39:7.t: If you disbelieve, then, Allah does not need you at all, however He does not like for His servants to be disbelievers, and if you are grateful, He will like it for you. And no one will bear the burden of someone else. Then, to your Lord is your return, so He will tell you about what you used to do. He is aware of whatever lies in the hearts.

39:8.t: And when man is afflicted by pain, he calls his Lord turning to Him passionately. Thereafter, when He blesses him with some favor from Him, he forgets that for which he was calling Him earlier, and sets up partners for Allah, so that he leads others astray from His way. Say, "Enjoy (the pleasure of) your disbelief for a while, (then) surely, you are from among the people of the Fire."

39:9.t: Can (such people be equal to) the one who worships during the hours of the night, prostrating and standing, fearing the Hereafter and having hopes in his Lord's mercy? Say, "Can those who know and those who do not know become equal?" It is only the people of understanding who are receptive of the advice.

39:10.t: Say (on My behalf) "0 My servants who believe, fear your Lord. Those who do good in this world will have a good return, and the earth of Allah is wide. Certainly those who observe patience will be given their reward in full without measure.

39:11.t: Say, "I have been ordered to worship Allah, making my submission exclusive to Him.

39:12.t: And I have been ordered to be the first of those who submit."

39:13.t: Say, "if I were to disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of a great day."

39:14.t: Say, "It is Allah whom I worship, making my submission exclusive to Him.

39:15.t: So, worship what you wish other than Him." Say, "Indeed, the losers are those who (will) lose their selves and their people on the Day of Judgment. Beware, that is really the obvious loss."

39:16.t: For them there are canopies of fire on top of them and canopies (of fire) underneath them. That is the thing against which Allah frightens His servants. 'So, 0 servants of Mine, fear Me.'

39:17.t: And those who abstain from worshipping the Taghut and turn fervently to Allah, for them there is good news. So, give the good news to My servants

39:18.t: who listen to what is said, then, follow the best of it. Those are the ones whom Allah has guided, and those are the ones who possess understanding.

39:19.t: So tell Me about the one for whom the word of punishment is destined, - is it you, then, who would save someone who is already in the Fire?

39:20.t: But, for those who fear their Lord, there are chambers with chambers on top of them built ready, with rivers running from underneath them. This is a promise of Allah. Allah does not go back on the promise.

39:21.t: Have you not seen that Allah sent down water from the sky, then made it penetrate into the earth (and gush forth) in the form of springs? Then He brings forth with it the crops of different colors, and afterwards they wither, and you see them turned yellow, then He makes them chaff. Surely in that there is a lesson for the people of understanding.

39:22.t: So I ask about a person whose heart Allah has opened up for Islam, and consequently he proceeds in a light from his Lord. (Can he be equal to the one whose heart is hardened?) So, woe to those whose hearts are too hard to remember Allah. Those are wandering in open error.

39:23.t: Allah has sent down the best discourse, a book containing subjects resembling each other, mentioned again and again, shivered from which are the skins of those who have awe of their Lord. Then, their skins and their hearts become soft enough to tend to the remembrance of Allah. This is the Guidance of Allah with which He brings to the right path whomsoever He wills. As for the one whom Allah lets go astray, for him there is no one to guide.

39:24.t: Tell Me about the one who tries to save himself from the worst punishment with his face on the Day of Doom, (whether he is equal to the one who is not liable to any punishment.) And it will be said to the wrongdoers, "Have a taste of what you used to earn."

39:25.t: Those before them had also rejected (the messengers) and consequently, the punishment came upon them in a way that they had never imagined.

39:26.t: Then Allah made them taste disgrace in the worldly life, and of course the punishment of the Hereafter is much greater. Only if they knew!

39:27.t: And We have cited for people all sorts of examples in this Qur'an, so that they may receive the message

39:28.t: through an Arabic Qur'an that has no digression (from the truth), so that they may be God-fearing.

39:29.t: Allah has given an example: There is a (slave) man owned by some partners quarrelling with each other, and (on the other hand,) there is a man solely owned by a single man. Can they be equal in comparison? Praise be to Allah! (The truth stands established). But, most of them do not know.

39:30.t: Verily, you are to die and they are to die.

39:31.t: After that, on the Day of Doom, you will surely place your disputes before your Lord.

39:32.t: So, who is more unjust than him who forges a lie against Allah and rejects the truth when it reached him? Is it not that in Jahannam (hell) there is an abode for the disbelievers?

39:33.t: As for the one who has come with the truth and believed it to be true, then such people are the ones who are God-fearing.

39:34.t: For them, with their Lord, there is what they wish. That is the reward of those who are good in deeds,

39:35.t: so that Allah wipes out from them the worst deeds they did, and gives their reward to them for the best of what they used to do.

39:36.t: Is Allah not sufficient for (the protection of) His slave? And they are frightening you of those (false gods whom they worship) other than Him. And whomsoever Allah would let go astray, for him there is no one to guide.

39:37.t: And whomsoever Allah gives guidance, for him there is no one to misguide. Is it not that Allah is Mighty, Powerful to avenge?

39:38.t: And if you ask them as to who created the heavens and the earth, they will certainly say, "Allah." Say, "Then, tell me about those whom you invoke other than Allah, if Allah intends to cause some harm to me, are they (able) to remove the harm caused by Him? Or if He intends to bless me with mercy, are they (able) to hold back His mercy (from me)?" Say, "Allah is sufficient for me. In Him trust those who (rightly) trust (in someone)."

39:39.t: Say, "0 my people, do at your place (what you are doing). I am to do (what I have been ordered to do). Very soon, you will come to know

39:40.t: as to who will be visited by a punishment that will disgrace him, and upon whom a lasting punishment will befall.

39:41.t: We have sent down to you the Book for the people with the truth. So, whoever follows the guidance, it is for his own good, and whoever goes astray, he will go astray only to his detriment - and you are not responsible for them.

39:42.t: Allah fully takes away the souls (of the people) at the time of their death, and (of) those who do not die, in their sleep. Then He withholds those on whom He had decreed death, and sends the others back upto an appointed term. Surely, in this, there are signs for a people who ponder.

39:43.t: Is it that they have adopted intercessors out of those (whom they invoke) other than Allah? Say, " (Do you take them as intercessors) even though they have no power at all, nor do they understand?"

39:45.t: And when Allah is mentioned alone, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter are filled with disgust, and when those (whom they worship) other than Him are mentioned, they become happy forthwith.

39:46.t: Say, "0 Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth, the Knower of the unseen and the seen, you will judge between Your servants in that about which they used to differ.

39:47.t: And were the wrongdoers to own all that is on earth, and even twice as much, they would surely seek to ransom themselves with it against the evil punishment on the Day of Judgment. And there will appear to them from Allah what they have never imagined.

39:48.t: And unveiled to them will be the evils of what they used to earn; and encircled they will be by what they used to ridicule.

39:49.t: And when man is visited by a trouble, he prays to Us, but when, after that, We favor him with some blessing from Us, he says, "This is given to me because of (my) knowledge." No, but this is a trial, yet most of them do not know.

39:50.t: The same was said by those before them, but what they used to earn was of no avail to them,

39:51.t: and they were overtaken by the evils of what they had earned; and the wrongdoers from these (infidels too) will be overtaken by the evils of what they have earned- and they are not (able) to escape.

39:52.t: Do they not know that it is Allah who extends provision for whomsoever He wills, and straitens (it for whomsoever He wills). Surely in that, there are signs for a people who believe.

39:53.t: Say (on My behalf), "0 servants of Mine who have acted recklessly against their own selves, do not despair of Allah's mercy. Surely, Allah will forgive all sins. Surely, He is the One who is the Most-Forgiving, the Very-Merciful.

39:54.t: Turn passionately towards your Lord, and submit to Him before the punishment comes to you, after which you will not be helped.

39:55.t: And follow the best of what has been sent down to you from your Lord before the punishment comes to you suddenly when you do not even expect,

39:56.t: lest someone should say, "Pity on me, because I fell short in respect of (observing the rights of) Allah and in fact, I was one of those who mocked",

39:57.t: or, (lest) someone should say, "If Allah were to show me the way, I would have surely been among those who fear Allah",

39:58.t: or, (lest) someone should say when he sees the punishment, "0 that I had a chance to return, so that I may become one of those who are good in deeds."

39:59.t: Why not? My verses had reached you, but you called them untrue, and waxed proud, and became of those who disbelieved.

39:60.t: And on the Day of Judgment, you will see those who had forged lies against Allah (in a state) that their faces are turned black. Is it not that in Jahannam there is an abode for the arrogant?

39:61.t: And Allah will save the God-fearing (from Jahannam), with utmost success granted to them, so as no evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.

39:62.t: Allah is Creator of everything, and He is the Guardian over everything.

39:63.t: To Him belong the keys to the heavens and the earth. As for those who have rejected the verses of Allah, it is they who are the losers.

39:64.t: Say, "Is it, then, someone other than Allah that you ask me to worship, 0 ignorant people?"

39:65.t: And it has already been revealed to you and to those before you (that): If you associate (partners with Allah), your deeds shall be rendered useless, and you shall be among the losers.

39:66.t: On the contrary, it is Allah whom you should worship; and be among the grateful.

39:67.t: And they did not hold Allah in His true esteem. And the whole earth will be in a single grip of His hand on the Day of Doom, and the heavens (will be) rolled up on his right hand. Pure is He, far too high from what they ascribe to Him.

39:68.t: And Horn (sur) will be blown, and all those in the heavens and all those in the earth will faint, except the one whom Allah wills (otherwise). Thereafter, it will be blown once again, and suddenly they will stand up, looking around.

39:69.t: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the book (of everyone's deeds) will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and matters will be decided between them with truth, and they will not be wronged.

39:70.t: And everyone will be paid in full for what he did - and He knows best as to what they do.

39:71.t: And those who disbelieved will be driven towards the Jahannam in groups, until when they reach it, its gates will be opened, and its keepers will say to them, "Did messengers from among you not come to you reciting to you the verses of your Lord, and warning you about the meeting of this day of yours?" They will say, "Yes (they did), but the word of punishment had become certain against those who disbelieved."

39:72.t: It will be said, "Enter the gates of Jahannam to live in there forever. So, how evil is the dwelling-place of the arrogant!

39:73.t: And those who used to fear their Lord will be led towards the Jannah in groups, until when they reach it, while its gates will be (already) opened (for them), and its keepers will say to them, "salamun-'alaikum (peace be on you). How good are you. So, enter it to live here forever."

39:74.t: And they will say, "alhamdulillah: Praise belongs to Allah who made His promise come true for us, and made us inherit the territory, so as we can dwell anywhere we wish in Jannah. So, excellent is the reward of those who did (good) deeds.

39:75.t: And you will see the angels ringed around the Throne proclaiming the purity of their Lord, along with His praise, and matters will stand settled between them rightfully, and it will be said: "alhamdulillahi-rabbil` alamin: Praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of the worlds."

40:2.t: This is revelation of the Book from Allah, the Mighty, the All-Knowing,

40:3.t: the One who forgives sins and accepts repentance, the One who is severe in punishment, the One who is the source of all power. There is no god but He. To Him is the ultimate return (of all).

40:4.t: No one quarrels about the verses of Allah, except those who disbelieve. So, their (prosperous) movements in the cities should not deceive you.

40:5.t: Before these, the people of Nuh and the groups after them had rejected (the messengers). And every group intended to seize their messenger, and raised disputes on the basis of falsehood, so that they might refute the truth with it, hence I seized them. So, how was My punishment?

40:6.t: And similarly, the word of your Lord has become due against those who disbelieve, that they are the people of the Fire.

40:7.t: Those who are bearing the Throne and those who are around it pronounce the purity of your Lord alongwith His praise, and believe in Him, and pray for the forgiveness of those who believe: "Our Lord, Your mercy and knowledge comprehends everything, so forgive those who repent and follow Your way, and save them from the punishment of the Fire.

40:8.t: And, our Lord, admit them to the eternal gardens of Jannah that You have promised for them, and (admit) those as well who did good from among their fathers and wives and children. You, only You, are the Mighty, the Wise,

40:9.t: and save them from evils (of punishment). And whomsoever you save from evils that day, it is surely because you bless him with mercy. And that is the great achievement indeed.

40:10.t: Those who disbelieve will be addressed (by a voice saying): " The hatred of Allah (for you), when you were invited to the true faith and you refused, used to be greater than your hatred for yourselves (today when you are hating your own selves out of remorse).

40:11.t: They will say, "Our Lord, You gave us death twice and You gave us life twice. Now we confess our sins. So, is there any way to come out of here?"

40:12.t: (The reply will be, "No.) This is because whenever Allah alone was invoked, you used to disbelieve, and if partners were associated with Him, you used to believe. Now the decision lies with Allah, the High, the Great."

40:13.t: It is He who shows you His signs and sends down provision for you from the sky; and no one takes lesson but the one who turns to Him.

40:14.t: So, worship Allah, making your submission exclusive for Him, even though the disbelievers dislike.

40:15.t: He is High in stations, the Owner of the Throne. He sends the spirit down, under His command, on whomever He wills from among His servants, so that he warns of the Day of Encounter -

40:16.t: the day they will come in open view. Nothing about them will remain hidden from Allah: To whom belongs the kingdom today? To Allah alone, the One, the All-Dominant.

40:17.t: Today, everyone will be recompensed for what one earned. There is no injustice today. Surely, Allah is swift in reckoning.

40:18.t: And warn them of the Day of approaching horror, when hearts will jump up into the throats, (and they will be) choked. There will be neither a friend, for the unjust, nor an intercessor to be listened to.

40:19.t: He knows the treachery of the eyes and whatever is concealed by the hearts.

40:20.t: And He will give His judgment with truth. And those whom they invoke beside Him cannot judge anything. Surely, it is Allah who is Hearing, Seeing.

40:21.t: Have they not traveled through the earth and seen how was the fate of those who used to be before them? They were stronger than these in power and in traces left on the earth, but Allah seized them because of their sins. And there was no one to save them from Allah.

40:22.t: That was because messengers used to come to them with clear signs, but they disbelieved. Then, Allah seized them. Surely, He is Strong, severe in punishment.

40:23.t: And We did send Musa with Our signs and a manifest proof

40:24.t: to the Pharaoh and Haman and Qaran, but they said, "He is a sorcerer, a liar."

40:25.t: And when he brought them the truth from Us, they said, "Kill the sons of those who have accepted faith with him, and spare the lives of their women." And the plot of the disbelievers is nothing but a failure.

40:26.t: And the Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Musa, and let him call his Lord. I am afraid that he will change your religion or that he will cause havoc to appear in the land."

40:27.t: And Musa said, "I have sought protection of my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant man who does not believe in the day of reckoning."

40:28.t: And said a believing man from the House of the Pharaoh who had kept his faith secret, "Would you kill a man because he says - 'Allah is my Lord' - while he has come to you with clear signs from your Lord? And if he is a liar, then, his lie will fall back on himself, and if he is truthful, some of that (punishment) of which he warns you will afflict you. Indeed, Allah does not give guidance to anyone who is transgressor, a liar.

40:29.t: 0 my people, the kingdom is yours today, while you are dominant on the land. But, who is going to help us against the punishment of Allah, if it comes upon us?" Pharaoh said, " I do not give you an opinion unless I myself believe it to be correct, and I do not direct you to anything but to the right way."

40:30.t: And said he who had believed, "I fear for you something like a day of the (disbelieving) groups (of the past) ,

40:31.t: like the fate of the people of Nuh and 'Ad and Thamud and those who were after them - and Allah does not intend to do any injustice to His servants.

40:32.t: And O my people, I fear for you a day when people will call one another,

40:33.t: a day when you will turn back on your heels, having no one to save you from Allah - but, whomever Allah lets go astray, for him there is no one to guide.

40:34.t: And Yusuf had already come to you earlier with clear signs, but you remained in suspicion about what he brought to you - until when he died, you said, 'Allah will never send a messenger after him.' That is how Allah lets him go astray who crosses limits and lives in doubt, -

40:35.t: those who quarrel in the matter of the verses of Allah without any authority having reached them. It is terribly hateful with Allah and with those who believe. That is how Allah stamps a seal on the entire heart of an arrogant tyrant."

40:36.t: And the Fir'aun (the Pharaoh) said, "0 Haman, make a tower for me, perhaps I could reach the ways-

40:37.t: the ways to the heavens, and peek towards the God of Musa. And I do think that he is a liar." And that is how his evil deeds were made attractive to Fir'aun, and (how) he was held back from the way. And the evil design of the Fir'aun was (to end) in nothing but ruin.

40:38.t: And said he who had believed, "0 my people, follow me, I will show you the path of guidance.

40:39.t: 0 my people, this life of the world is only a (momentary) benefit, while the Hereafter is, indeed, the place of permanent living.

40:40.t: The one who does something evil will not be punished but in its equal proportion, but the one who does a righteous deed, be he male or female, while he is a believer, then, such people will enter the Jannah where they will be provided with bounties beyond reckoning.

40:41.t: And 0 my people, what is wrong with me that I call you to salvation and you call me to the Fire?

40:42.t: You invite me to reject my belief in Allah and ascribe to Him partners about whom I have no knowledge, while I invite you to (Him who is) the Mighty, the Most-Forgiving.

40:43.t: It is obvious that those (gods) to whom you are inviting me are not worth calling, neither in this world nor in the world to come, and that we have to return back to Allah, and that the transgressors are indeed the people of the Fire.

40:44.t: Soon you will remember what I am saying to you. And I entrust my matter with Allah. Surely, Allah has all (His) servants in sight."
