50:26.t: who set up another god along with Allah. So cast him (O angels) in the painful punishment."

50:27.t: His (evil) companion (i.e. the Satan) will say, "0 our Lord, I did not cause him to rebel, but he was himself (involved) in straying far from the track.

50:28.t: He (Allah) will say, "Do not quarrel before Me, while I had sent to you My threat well in advance.

50:29.t: The Word is not changed with Me, and I Am not a wrongdoer to My slaves."

50:30.t: (Remind them of) the Day when We will say to Jahannam (hell), "Are you filled up?" and it will say, "Are there some more?"

50:31.t: And the Jannah (Paradise) will be brought close for the God-fearing, no longer distant.

50:32.t: (And it will be said) " This is what you were promised for everyone oft-returning to Allah, vigilant (against sins),

50:33.t: the one who fears the Rahman (The All-Merciful), without seeing Him, and comes up with a heart oriented towards Him.

50:34.t: Enter it in peace. That is the Day of Eternity."

50:35.t: For them there will be whatever they wish, and with Us there is even more.

50:36.t: And how many a generations We have destroyed before them who were stronger than these in their grip on power, and they searched out the cities: Was there any place to escape?

50:37.t: Indeed, there is a lesson in all this for him who has a heart and gives ear (to the truth) attentively.

50:38.t: And We created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six days, and no weariness even touched Us.

50:39.t: So, bear with patience what they say, and proclaim His purity along with your Lord's praise before sunrise and before sunset.

50:40.t: And in hours of night, do proclaim His purity, and at the ends of prostration.

50:41.t: And listen: The Day when the caller will call out from a near place,

50:42.t: the Day they will hear the Cry in reality-that will be the Day of Resurrection.

50:43.t: Surely We alone give life and bring death, and to Us is the final return

50:44.t: on the Day when the earth will burst apart exposing them, while they will be hurrying up (to come out). That is a mustering, so easy for Us.

50:45.t: We know well what they say, and you are not one to compel them. So give advice, through the Qur'an, to the one who fears My warning.

51:1.t: (I swear) by those (winds) that scatter dust,

51:2.t: then by those (clouds) that bear loads,

51:3.t: then by those (boats) that sail with ease,

51:4.t: then by those (angels) who distribute things,

51:5.t: whatever you are being promised is surely true,

51:6.t: and Recompensing (of deeds) is sure to happen.

51:8.t: you are (involved) in a contradictory statement.

51:9.t: Turned away from this (Qur'an) is the one who is turned away (totally from the Truth.)

51:10.t: Death upon those who make conjectures (against the true faith),

51:11.t: those who are drowned in ignorance, forgetful!

51:12.t: They ask, "When shall be the Day of Recompense?"

51:13.t: (It will be) the Day when they will be heated on the Fire,

51:14.t: (and it will be said to them,) "Taste (the punishment of) your mischief. This is what you have been asking to be brought sooner."

51:15.t: The God-fearing (on the other hand) will be in gardens and springs,

51:16.t: receiving what their Lord will have given to them. Indeed, prior to this, they were good in their deeds.

51:17.t: They used to sleep little in the night,

51:18.t: and in the hours before dawn, they used to pray for forgiveness,

51:19.t: and in their wealth, there was a right for the one who asks and the one who is deprived.

51:20.t: And in the earth, there are signs for those who (seek truth to) believe,

51:21.t: and in your own selves! So, do you not perceive?

51:22.t: ] And in the heavens, there is your sustenance and all that you have been promised.

51:23.t: So, by the Lord of the heavens and the earth, it (the Day of Recompense) is a reality, as sure as that you speak.

51:24.t: Has there come to you the story of the honoured guests of Ibrahim?

51:25.t: When they entered unto him and said, "We greet you with salam." He said, "salam on you." (And he said to himself,) " (They are) unknown people."

51:26.t: Then he slipped off to his home, and fetched a fattened calf.

51:27.t: So he brought it close to them (to eat, but being angels, they refrained.) He said, "Would you not eat?"

51:28.t: So he felt some fear in his heart. They said, "Be not scared." And they gave him the good news of (the birth of) a knowledgeable boy.

51:29.t: So his wife came forward with a clamour and slapped her own face and said, " (How can I have a child when I am) a barren old woman?"

51:30.t: They said, "This is how your Lord has said. Surely, He is All-Wise, All-Knowing."

51:31.t: He (Ibrahim) said (to the angels), "Then, what is your mission 0 messengers?"

51:32.t: They said, "We are sent to a guilty people,

51:33.t: so that we may send down upon them stones of clay,

51:34.t: marked, with your Lord, for the transgressors."

51:35.t: So, We let the believers who were there to come out (from danger),

51:36.t: but We did not find in it any Muslims, except one house.

51:37.t: And We left in this (event) a sign (of deterrence) for those who fear the painful punishment.

51:38.t: And (We left a similar sign) in (the story of) Musa, when We sent him to Fir'aun (the Pharoah) with a clear proof.

51:39.t: So he turned away along with his chiefs and said, " (Musa is) a magician or a madman!"

51:40.t: So We seized him and his army, and cast them into the sea, as he was the one who came up with culpable behaviour.

51:41.t: And (a similar sign was left) in (the story of) ` Ad, when We sent upon them the wind that was barren (from any benefit);

51:42.t: it spared nothing it came upon, but rendered it like a stuff smashed by decay.

51:43.t: And (a similar sign was left) in (the story of) Thamud, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a while."

51:44.t: Then they rebelled against the command of your Lord; so the thunderbolt (of divine punishment) seized them, while they were looking on.

51:45.t: Then they were neither able to stand upright, nor could they defend themselves.

51:46.t: And (We have destroyed) the people of Nu1h before; indeed they were a sinful people.

51:47.t: And the sky was built by Us with might, and indeed, We are the One who expands.

51:48.t: And the earth was spread by Us as a floor; so excellent Spreader are We.

51:49.t: And from everything We have created (a pair of) two kinds, so that you may receive advice.

51:50.t: So flee to Allah. Indeed I am a plain warner sent by Him for you.

51:51.t: And do not make up any other god along with Allah. Indeed I am a plain warner sent by Him for you.

51:52.t: In similar way, no messenger came to those before them, but they said, " (He is) a magician or a madman."

51:53.t: Have they handed down (this saying) to each other as a legacy? No, but they are a rebellious people.

51:54.t: So, turn away from them, for you are not blamed.

51:55.t: And keep reminding, because reminding benefits the believers.

51:56.t: And I did not create the Jinns and the human beings except that they should worship Me.

51:57.t: I do not want any sustenance from them, nor do I want them to feed Me.

51:58.t: In fact, Allah is the All-Sustainer, Possessor of power, the Strong.

51:59.t: So, those who did wrong deserve a share (in the punishment) like the share of their companions. So, they should not ask Me to hasten on.

51:60.t: Woe, then, to those who disbelieve because of the Day of theirs that they are promised (for punishment).

52:4.t: and by the Populated House (Al-Bait-ul-Ma` mur),

52:5.t: and by the roof, raised high,

52:6.t: and by the sea, filled up with fire,

52:7.t: the punishment of your Lord is sure to fall.

52:8.t: There is nothing to push it back,

52:9.t: the Day when the sky will tremble, a horrible trembling,

52:10.t: and the mountains will move about, a terrible movement.

52:11.t: So, woe to those who reject (the true faith),

52:12.t: who are indulged in vain talk, playing (with truth),

52:13.t: the Day they will be pushed to the Fire forcefully,

52:14.t: (and it will be said to them,) "This is the Fire you used to deny.

52:15.t: Is it then magic, or do you not see?

52:16.t: Enter it. Now, whether you act patient or impatient, it is all the same for you; you are merely rewarded for what you used to do."

52:17.t: Of course, the God-fearing will be in gardens and bliss,

52:18.t: enjoying what their Lord will give to them, and their Lord will save them from the punishment of Hell.

52:19.t: (It will be said to them,) "Eat and drink pleasantly because of what you used to do,

52:20.t: relaxing on lined up couches". And We will marry them with big-eyed houris.

52:21.t: And those who believed and their children followed them in belief, We will join their children with them, and will not curtail (the reward of) any of their deeds at all. Every person will be pledged for what he earned.

52:22.t: And We will give them a lot of what they desire from fruits and meat.

52:23.t: They will snatch, from one another (in a friendly manner) a glass (of wine) in which there is neither an absurd talk, nor something leading to sin.

52:24.t: And they will be frequented by the serving boys of their own, (neat and clean) as if they were hidden pearls.

52:25.t: And they will advance to one another, asking (about each other).

52:26.t: They will say, "Indeed we were afraid (of Allah's punishment) when we were amidst of our family,

52:27.t: but Allah did favour to us and saved us from the torment of Fire's scorching breath.

52:28.t: We used to pray to Him before. He is surely the Most-Kind, the Very-Merciful.

52:29.t: So keep reminding (them), because by the grace of your Lord, you are neither a soothsayer, nor a madman.

52:30.t: Do they rather say, "He is a poet for whom we are awaiting the accident of death."?

52:31.t: Say, "Wait! I am waiting with you, too."

52:32.t: Do their intellects direct them to (say) this, or are they a rebellious people?

52:33.t: Do they rather say, "He has forged it (the Qur’ an.) "? No, but they do not believe.

52:34.t: So, let them bring a discourse like this, if they are truthful.

52:35.t: Is it that they are created by none, or are they themselves the creators?

52:36.t: Or have they created the heavens and the earth? No, but they are sure of nothing.

52:37.t: Or do they have the treasures of your Lord, or have they acquired control (over them)?1

52:38.t: Or have they a stairway (to the heavens) by means of which they listen (to the divine decrees)? If so, their listener must bring a clear proof.2

52:39.t: Is it that He has daughters and you have sons?

52:40.t: Or is it that you (0 prophet) ask them for a fee, and therefore they are burdened with a debt?

52:41.t: Or have they the knowledge of the Unseen, and they are recording it?

52:42.t: Or do they intend to conspire (against the prophet)? Then the disbelievers themselves shall be the victim of the conspiracy.

52:43.t: Or do they have a god other than Allah? Pure is Allah from what they associate with Him.

52:44.t: And even if they see a piece falling down from the sky, they would say, "It is a cumulated cloud."3

52:45.t: So, leave them until they face their Day in which they will be struck by a thunderbolt,

52:46.t: the Day their planning will not avail them in the least, nor will they be helped.

52:47.t: And for those who did wrong there is another punishment before that, 4 but most of them do not know.

52:48.t: And (0 prophet) be patient about the decision of your Lord, because you are before Our Eyes. And proclaim the purity of your Lord along with His praise when you stand (in Prayer),

52:49.t: ] And, in parts of night too, proclaim His purity, and at setting of the stars.

53:1.t: By the star when it goes down to set,

53:2.t: your companion (the Holy Prophet t) has neither missed the way, nor did he deviate.

53:3.t: And he does not speak out of (his own) desire.

53:4.t: It is not but revelation revealed (to him).

53:5.t: It is taught to him by one (angel) of strong faculties,

53:6.t: one of vigour. So he stood poised,

53:7.t: while he was on the upper horizon.

53:8.t: Then he drew near, and came down,

53:9.t: so as he was at a distance between two bows (joined together), rather even nearer.

53:10.t: Thus He (Allah) revealed to His slave what He revealed.

53:11.t: The heart did not err in what he saw.

53:12.t: Do you quarrel with him in what he sees?

53:13.t: And indeed he saw him another time

53:14.t: by sidrat-ul-muntaha (the lote-tree in the upper realm),

53:15.t: near which there is Jannat-ul-ma'wa (the Paradise of Abode),

53:16.t: when the lots-tree was covered by that which covered it.

53:17.t: The eye neither went wrong, nor did exceed the limit.

53:18.t: He has indeed seen a part of the biggest signs of your Lord.

53:19.t: Have you ever considered about the (idols of) Lat and ` Uzza,

53:20.t: and about the other, the third, the Manat?

53:21.t: Is it that you have males and He (Allah) has females?

53:22.t: ] If so, it is a totally unjust division.

53:23.t: These are nothing but names you and your fathers have invented; Allah has sent down no authority attached to them. They are following nothing but conjecture and what their own souls desire, while guidance from their Lord has surely reached them.

53:24.t: Is it that man gets whatever he wishes?

53:25.t: (No,) because to Allah alone belongs the (good of) the Hereafter and the former life (of this world).

53:26.t: And how many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession cannot benefit (any one) at all, but after Allah allows (it) for whomsoever He wills and pleases.

53:27.t: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter name the angels after the names of the females.

53:28.t: And they do not have knowledge about it. They follow nothing but conjecture, and conjecture is of no use in (the matter of) Truth.

53:29.t: So, turn away from him who turns away from Our advice, and seeks nothing but (pleasure of) the worldly life.

53:30.t: That is the limit of their excess in knowledge. Indeed only your Lord knows well about the one who has gone astray from his way, and He knows well about the one who has adopted the right path.

53:31.t: And to Allah belongs whatever there is in the heavens and whatever there is in the earth, so that He gives punishment to evil-doers for what they did and rewards those who did good for their good deed,

53:32.t: those who abstain from the major sins and from shameful acts, except minor involvements. Indeed your Lord is One of extensive forgiveness. He knows you more than anyone else (from a time) when He created you from the earth and when you were embryos in the wombs of your mothers. So, do not claim purity (from faults) for your selves. He knows best who is God-fearing.

53:33.t: Did you see the one who turned away,

53:34.t: ] and gave a little, and stopped?

53:35.t: Does he have knowledge of the Unseen whereby he sees (what he believes)?

53:36.t: Has he not been told of what was (revealed) in the scriptures of Musa

53:37.t: and of Ibrahim who fulfilled (his covenant)?

53:38.t: (It was) that no bearer of burden shall bear the burden of the other,

53:39.t: ] and that a man does not deserve but (the reward of) his own effort,

53:40.t: and that his effort will soon be seen,

53:41.t: then he will be recompensed for it in full,

53:42.t: and that to your Lord is the end (of every one),

53:43.t: and that He is the One who makes (one) laugh and makes (him) weep,

53:44.t: and that He is the One who gives death and gives life,

53:45.t: and that He creates the pairs, male and female,

53:46.t: ] from a sperm-drop when it is poured (into a womb),

53:47.t: and that the second creation is undertaken by Him,

53:48.t: and that He is the One who gives wealth and preserves (it),

53:49.t: and that He is the One who is the Lord of Sirius (the star worshipped by pagans),

53:50.t: and that He has destroyed the earlier ` Ad,

53:52.t: and (destroyed) the people of Nuh even before. Surely they were more unjust and more rebellious.

53:53.t: And He destroyed the overturned towns (of the people of Lut) also,

53:54.t: so covered they were by that which covered.

53:55.t: Then, concerning which of your Lord's bounties would you remain in doubt?

53:56.t: This (Holy Prophet) is a warner from the (genus of the) previous warners.

53:58.t: There is no one, beside Allah, to remove it.

53:59.t: Do you then wonder at this discourse,

53:60.t: and laugh (at it), and not weep,

53:61.t: while you are engaged in vain play?

53:62.t: Now, fall down in prostration and worship (Allah).

54:1.t: The Hour (of doom) has drawn near, and the moon has been split asunder.

54:2.t: And when these people see a sign, they turn away and say, " (This is) a transient magic."

54:3.t: And they have rejected (the Truth) and followed their desires, while every matter has to be settled (at some time).

54:4.t: And there has come to them as much news (of the earlier communities) as contains enough to warn,

54:5.t: a perfect wisdom, but the warnings are of no avail (to them).

54:6.t: Therefore, turn aside (0 Prophet,) from them. (They will see the reality) on the Day when the caller will call to a terrible thing.

54:7.t: With their eyes humbled, they will come out of the graves like locusts spread all over,

54:8.t: rushing quickly towards the caller. (On that Day) the disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult day."

54:9.t: The people of Nuh denied (the truth) before them. So they rejected Our slave, and said, " (He is) a madman", and he was (also) threatened (by them).

54:10.t: So he prayed to his Lord saying, "I am overpowered, so defend (me)."

54:11.t: So We opened the gates of the sky with water pouring forth profusely,

54:12.t: and We caused the earth to gush forth as springs; so the water (of both kinds) met together for a destined event.

54:13.t: And We caused him (Nuh) to board that (ship) which had planks and nails,

54:14.t: which sailed under Our Eyes, as a reward for the one who was rejected (by the infidels).

54:15.t: And We left it (the ship) as a sign. So, is there one to take lesson?

54:16.t: How then was My torment and My warnings?

54:17.t: And indeed We have made the Qur'an easy for seeking advice. So, is there one to seek advice?

54:18.t: (The people of) ` Ad rejected (their prophet). How then was My torment and My warnings?

54:19.t: We did send to them a furious wind in a day of lasting bad luck,

54:20.t: plucking people away, as if they were trunks of uprooted palm-trees.

54:21.t: How then was My torment and My warnings?

54:22.t: And indeed We have made the Qur'an easy for seeking advice. So, is there one to seek advice?

54:23.t: (The people of) Thamud rejected the warners.

54:24.t: So they said, "Shall we follow a single human being from among us? Then we will be in error and insanity.

54:25.t: Is it that the advice has been cast upon him alone out of all of us? No, but he is a bragging liar."

54:26.t: Tomorrow they will know who is the bragging liar!

54:27.t: We are going to send the She-camel as a trial for them; so watch them (0 Salih,) and keep patience,

54:28.t: and tell them that water (of the well) is to be shared between them (and the She-camel), so as the right of having water shall be attended by each (alternatively).

54:29.t: Then they called their man (to kill the She-camel,) so he undertook (the task) and killed (the She-camel).

54:30.t: How then was My torment and My warnings?

54:31.t: We sent upon them a single Cry, and they were like crushed leafs of a hedge-builder.

54:32.t: And indeed We have made the Qur'an easy for seeking advice. So, is there one to seek advice?

54:33.t: The people of Lilt rejected the warners.

54:34.t: We sent upon them a rain of stones, except the family of Lut whom We saved in the last hours of night, as a grace from Us.

54:35.t: This is how We reward the one who offers gratitude.

54:36.t: And he (Lut) had certainly warned them of Our grasp, but they disputed the warnings.

54:37.t: And they had even tried to tempt him against his guests (so that they may snatch them away for bad purpose,) but We blinded their eyes: "Now taste My torment and My warnings!"

54:38.t: And on the next morning, a lasting torment overtook them:

54:39.t: "Now taste My torment and My warnings."

54:40.t: And indeed We have made the Qur'an easy for seeking advice. So, is there one to seek advice?

54:41.t: And the warners came to the family of Fir'aun (Pharaoh).

54:42.t: (But) they rejected all Our signs; so We seized them - a seizure by a Mighty, a Powerful Being.

54:43.t: (Now) are the disbelievers among you in a better position than all of them (the aforesaid punished people), or do you have immunity (recorded) in the sacred books?

54:44.t: Or do they say, "We are a large group, well-defended."?

54:45.t: Soon shall this 'large group' be defeated, and all will turn their backs.

54:46.t: Rather the Hour (of judgment) is their appointed time (for their full recompense), and the Hour is more calamitous and more bitter.

54:47.t: Surely the guilty ones are in error and madness.

54:48.t: On the Day when they will be dragged into the Fire on their faces, (it will be said to them,) "Taste the touch of Hell."

54:49.t: Verily, We have created everything according to (Our) predestination.

54:50.t: And (implementation of) Our command is no more than a single act like the twinkling of an eye.

54:51.t: And We have destroyed people like you; so, is there one to take lesson?

54:52.t: And everything they have done is recorded in the books (of deeds).

54:53.t: And everything, small and big, is written down.

54:54.t: Of course, the God-fearing will be in gardens and rivers,

54:55.t: in a seat of Truth, near to the Omnipotent Sovereign

55:4.t: He has taught him (how) to express himself.

55:5.t: The sun and the moon are (bound) by a (fixed) calculation.

55:6.t: And the vine and the tree both prostrate (to Allah).

55:7.t: And He raised the sky high, and has placed the scale,

55:8.t: so that you should not be wrongful in weighing.

55:9.t: And observe the correct weight with fairness, and do not make weighing deficient.

55:10.t: ] And the earth is placed by Him for creatures,

55:11.t: ] in which there are fruits and the date-palms having sheaths,

55:12.t: and the grain having chaff, and fragrant flowers.

55:13.t: So, (0 mankind and Jinn,) which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:14.t: He has created man from dry clay, ringing like pottery,

55:15.t: ] and created Jann (father of the Jinn) from a smokeless flame of fire.

55:16.t: So, (0 mankind and Jinn,) which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:17.t: ] He is the Lord of both points of sunrise and both points of sunset.

55:18.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:19.t: He has set forth the two seas that meet together,

55:20.t: while between them there is a barrier they do not transgress.

55:21.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:22.t: From both of them come forth the pearl and the coral.

55:23.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:24.t: And His are the sailing ships raised up in the sea like mountains.

55:25.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:26.t: Everyone who lives on it (the earth) has to perish.

55:27.t: And your Lord's Countenance will remain, full of majesty, full of honour.

55:28.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:29.t: All those in the heavens and the earth beseech Him (for their needs.) Every day He is at some task.

55:30.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:31.t: ] Soon We are going to spare Ourselves for you (to reckon your deeds), 0 two heavy species (of Jinns and mankind) !

55:32.t: ] So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:33.t: 0 genera of Jinns and mankind, If you are able to penetrate beyond the realms of the heavens and the earth, then penetrate. You cannot penetrate except with an authority.

55:34.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:35.t: ] A flame of fire and a smoke will be loosed against you, and you will not (be able) to defend.

55:36.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:37.t: So, (it will be a terrible event) when the sky will be split apart and will become rosy, like (red) hides.

55:38.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:39.t: On that day, neither a man will be questioned about his sin, nor a Jinn, (because everything is known to Allah).

55:40.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:41.t: The guilty ones will be recognized (by the angels) by their marks and will be seized by foreheads and feet.

55:42.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:43.t: This is the Jahannam (Hell) that the guilty people deny.

55:44.t: They will circle around between it and between hot, boiling water.

55:45.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:46.t: And for the one who is fearful of having to stand before his Lord, there are two gardens

55:47.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:49.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:50.t: ] In both there are two flowing springs.

55:51.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:52.t: In both there are two kinds of every fruit.

55:53.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:54.t: (The people of these gardens will be) reclining on floorings whose (even) linings are of thick silk, and the fruits plucked from the two gardens will be at hand.

55:55.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:56.t: In them there are maidens restraining their glances, whom neither a man will have touched before them, nor a Jinn.

55:57.t: ] So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:58.t: They look like rubies and corals.

55:59.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:60.t: Is there any reward for goodness other than goodness?

55:61.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:62.t: And lesser than these two, there are two other gardens (for the second category of the God-fearing),

55:63.t: ] So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:65.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:66.t: In both there are two springs gushing forth profusely.

55:67.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:68.t: In both there are fruits and date-palms and pomegranates.

55:69.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:70.t: In them there are women, good and gorgeous,

55:71.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:72.t: ] the houris, kept guarded in pavilions

55:73.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:74.t: whom neither a man will have touched before them, nor a Jinn.

55:75.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:76.t: (The people of these gardens will be) reclining on green cushions and marvelously beautiful mattresses.

55:77.t: So, which of the bounties of your Lord will you deny?

55:78.t: Glorious is the name of your Lord, the Lord of Majesty, the Lord of Honour.

56:1.t: When the Imminent Event (of Doom) will occur,

56:2.t: there will be no one to deny its occurrence.

56:4.t: when the earth will be jolted with a quake,

56:5.t: and the mountains will be crumbled with a thorough crumbling,

56:6.t: until they will become dust, scattered in the air,

56:7.t: and you will be (divided into) three categories.

56:8.t: ] As for the People of the Right, how (lucky) are the people of the Right!

56:9.t: And the People of the Left? How (wretched) are the People of the Left!

56:10.t: And the Foremost are the foremost.

56:11.t: Those are the ones blessed with nearness (to Allah)

56:14.t: and of a small number from the later ones.

56:15.t: (They will be sitting) on thrones woven with gold,

56:16.t: reclining on them, facing each other.

56:17.t: They will be served in rounds by Immortal boys

56:18.t: with bowls and jugs and a goblet of pure wine,

56:19.t: from which they will neither suffer headache, nor will they be intoxicated,

56:20.t: and with fruits of their choice,

56:21.t: and the meat of birds that they desire.

56:22.t: And (for them there will be) houris, having lovely big eyes,

56:23.t: all (neat and clean) like a hidden pearl,

56:24.t: as a reward for what they used to do.

56:25.t: They will hear neither an absurd talk therein, nor something leading to sin,

56:26.t: but the words of salam, salam (as greetings).

56:27.t: As for the People of the Right, how (lucky) are the People of the Right!

56:28.t: (They will be) amid lote-trees with no horns,

56:29.t: and the trees of tall, (banana, or a fragrant tree) having layers one upon the other,

56:30.t: and a shade, spread all over,

56:33.t: neither interrupted (in any season), nor prohibited,

56:35.t: Surely We have created those (females) a fresh creation,

56:37.t: amorous to their husbands, matching them in age,

56:38.t: for the People of the Right,

56:40.t: and many from the later ones.

56:41.t: As for the People of the Left, How (wretched) are the People of the Left!

56:42.t: (They will be) in burning wind and boiling water,

56:43.t: and in a shade of black smoke,

56:45.t: They were before that indulged in luxuries,

56:46.t: and used to persist in major sins,

56:47.t: and used to say, "Is it that when we die and become dust-is it that we will be raised again,

56:48.t: and our ancient fathers as well?"

56:49.t: Say, "All the earlier and the later ones

56:50.t: will be gathered together for a fixed time of a specified Day.

56:51.t: Then 0 you, the erring, the denying people,

56:52.t: you will have to eat from the tree of Zaqqum

56:53.t: and to fill with it the bellies,

56:54.t: then you will have to drink boiling water on top of it,

56:55.t: and to drink like camels suffering from the disease of over-thirst.

56:56.t: This will be their entertainment on the Day of Requital.

56:57.t: We have created you; then why do you not appreciate it as true?

56:58.t: So, tell Me about the semen you drop (in the wombs):

56:59.t: Is it you who create it, or are We the Creator?

56:60.t: We have appointed (the times of) death among you, and We cannot be frustrated

56:61.t: from replacing you with others like you, and creating you (afresh) in that (form) which you do not know.

56:62.t: And you certainly know the first creation; then why do you not take lesson?

56:63.t: Well, tell Me about that (seed) which you sow:

56:64.t: Is it you who grow it, or are We the One who grows?

56:65.t: If We so will, We can certainly make it crumbled, and you will remain wondering,

56:68.t: Again, tell Me about the water you drink:

56:69.t: Is it you who have brought it down from the clouds, or are We the One who sends (it) down?

56:70.t: If We so will, We can make it bitter in taste. So why do you not offer gratitude?

56:71.t: Now tell Me about the fire you kindle:

56:72.t: Is it you who have originated its tree, or are We the Originator?

56:73.t: We have made it a reminder (of Our infinite power, and of the fire of hell) and a benefit for travelers in deserts.

56:74.t: So, proclaim the purity of the name of your Lord, the Magnificent.

56:75.t: So, I swear by the setting places of the stars,

56:76.t: - and indeed it is a great oath, if you are to appreciate -

56:77.t: it is surely the Noble Qur an,

56:78.t: (recorded already) in a protected book (i.e. the Preserved Tablet)

56:79.t: that is not touched except by the purified ones (the angels).

56:80.t: - a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

56:81.t: Is it this discourse that you take lightly,

56:82.t: and take your denial as your livelihood?

56:83.t: So why (do you) not (interfere) when the soul (of a dying person) reaches the throat,

56:85.t: And We are closer to him than you, but you do not perceive.

56:86.t: So, if you are not going to be recompensed (in the Hereafter for your deeds), then why do you not

56:87.t: bring the soul back, if you are truthful?

56:88.t: So, in case he (the dying person) is from among those blessed with nearness,

56:89.t: then (for him) there is comfort and fragrance and garden of bliss.

56:90.t: And in case he is from among the People of the Right,

56:91.t: then, (it will be said to him,) " Peace is for you, being one of the People of the Right."

56:92.t: But if he is one of the deniers, the astray,

56:93.t: then (for him) there is entertainment from boiling water,

56:95.t: Indeed this is certainty in its true sense.

56:96.t: So, proclaim the purity of the name of your Lord, the Magnificent.

57:1.t: Allah's purity has been proclaimed by all that is in the heavens and the earth, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

57:2.t: To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He gives life and brings death, and He is Powerful to do everything.

57:3.t: He is the First and the Last, and the Manifest and the Hidden, and He is All-Knowing about everything.

57:4.t: He is the One who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then He positioned Himself on the Throne. He knows whatever goes into the earth and whatever comes out there from, and whatever descends from the sky, and whatever ascends thereto. And He is with you wherever you are, and Allah is watchful of whatever you do.

57:5.t: To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah all matters are returned.

57:6.t: He makes the night enter into the day, and makes the day enter into the night, and He is All-Knowing about whatever lies in the hearts.

57:7.t: Believe in Allah and His Messenger, and spend out of that (wealth) in which He has appointed you as deputies.1 So, for those of you who have believed and spent (in Allah's way), there is a big reward.

57:8.t: ] And what is wrong with you that you do not believe in Allah, while the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord, and He has taken your covenant, if you are believers?

57:9.t: He is the One who reveals clear verses to His slave, so that He brings you out from layers of darkness towards the light. And to you, indeed, Allah is Very-Kind, Very-Merciful.

57:10.t: And what is wrong with you that you should not spend in the way of Allah, while to Allah belongs the inheritance of the heavens and the earth? Those who spent before the Conquest (of Makkah), and fought (in Allah's way), are not at par (with others). Those are much greater in rank than those who spent later and fought, though Allah has promised the good (reward) for each. And Allah is well aware of what you do.

57:11.t: Who is the one who advances a loan, a good loan, to Allah so that He multiplies it for him, and he may have a noble reward?

57:12.t: On the Day when you wild see the believing men and the believing women, their light proceeding in front of them and to their right hands, (it will be said to them,) "Good news for you today! Gardens beneath which rivers flow, to live therein forever! That is the great achievement,

57:13.t: the Day when the hypocrite men and hypocrite women will say to those who believe, "Wait for us, so that we may have a share from your light", it will be said (to them), "Go back to your rear, and search for light." Then a wall will be placed between them, which will have a gate. In its inner side, there will be the divine mercy, while towards its outer side, there will be the divine punishment.

57:14.t: They (the hypocrites) will call out to them (the believers), "Were we not with you?" They will say, "Yes, (you were,) but you led your souls to a wrong way, and kept waiting (for an evil end to the Muslims), and remained in doubt, and were deluded by fancies, until Allah's command came to pass, and you were deceived about Allah by the Big Deceiver (Iblis).

57:15.t: So, no ransom will be accepted from you today, nor from those who disbelieved (openly). Your abode is the Fire, and it is an evil end."

57:16.t: Has the time not yet come for those who believe that their hearts should be humble for the remembrance of Allah and for the truth that has descended (through revelation)? And they must not be like those to whom the Book was given before, but a long period passed on them (in which they did not repent), therefore their hearts became hard, while many of them were sinners.

57:17.t: Know well that Allah revives the land after its death. We have made the signs clear for you, so that you may understand.

57:18.t: Surely those men who give sadaqah (charity) and those women who give sadaqah and have advanced a good loan to Allah, for them it will be multiplied, and for them there is a noble reward.

57:19.t: And those who believed in Allah and His Messengers, it is they who are the siddiqs (the most righteous after prophets) and the shuhada' (martyrs) in the sight of your Lord. For them shall be their reward and their light. And those who disbelieved and rejected Our verses - those are the people of the Hell.

57:20.t: Know well that the worldly life is but a play and an amusement, and a show of beauty, and exchange of boastful claims between you, and a competition of increase in riches and children. (All this is) like a rain, the vegetation of which attracts the farmers, then it withers, and you see it turning yellow, then it becomes straw. And in the Hereafter there is a severe punishment (for the disbelievers), and forgiveness from Allah and (Allah's) pleasure (for the believers and the righteous). And the worldly life is nothing but a material of delusion.

57:21.t: Compete each other in proceeding towards forgiveness from your Lord, and to Paradise the width of which is like the width of the sky and the earth. It has been prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers. That is the bounty of Allah that He gives to whomever He wills, and Allah is the Lord of the great bounty.

57:22.t: No calamity befalls the earth or your own selves, but it is (pre-destined) in a Book before We bring it into being, Indeed it is easy for Allah.

57:23.t: so that you may neither grieve on what has escaped you, nor over-exult on what He has given you. And Allah does not love any self-admirer, over-proud,

57:24.t: those who are miserly and bid others to be miserly. And whoever turns away, then Allah is the All-Independent, the Ever-Praised.

57:25.t: We have indeed sent Our messengers with clear proofs, and sent down with them the Book and the Balance, so that people may uphold justice. And We sent down iron in which there is strong power, and benefits for the people; and (We did it) so that Allah knows the one who helps Him and His messengers without seeing (Him). Surely Allah is Strong, Mighty.

57:26.t: And we have indeed sent Nuh and Ibrahim, and kept the Book and prophet-hood (continuing) in their progeny. So, some of those (to whom they were sent) were on the right path, and many of them were sinners.

57:27.t: Then We made Our messengers follow them one after the other, then We sent after them ` Is, the son of Maryam (Jesus, son of Mary), and gave him the Injil, and placed tenderness and mercy in the hearts of his followers. As for monasticism, it was invented by them; We did not ordain it for them, but (they adopted it) to seek Allah's pleasure, then could not observe it as was due. So We gave those of them who believed their reward. And many of them are sinners.

57:28.t: 0 those who believe, fear Allah, and believe in His Messenger, and He will give you two shares (of reward) out of His mercy, and will make for you a light whereby you will walk, and will forgive you,-And Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

57:29.t: so that the People of the Book may know that they have no power over anything from Allah's bounty, and that bounty is in Allah's hand; He gives it to whom He wills, and Allah is the Lord of the great bounty.

58:1.t: Allah has heard the talk of the woman who was debating with you about her husband, and was complaining to Allah. And Allah was hearing the conversation between both of you. Indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

58:2.t: Those of you who declare zihar1 against their wives, they are not their mothers. Their mothers are but only those who have given birth to them. And undoubtedly they utter an evil word and a lie. And Allah is surely Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

58:3.t: And those who declare zihar against their wives, then retract what they said, obligated on them is to free the neck (of a slave) before the two (spouses) touch one another. This is what you are advised with, and Allah is Well-Aware of what you do.

58:4.t: But whoever does not find (a slave) has to fast for two consecutive months before the two (spouses) touch one another. Then the one who is not able to do so has to feed sixty indigent persons. This is (laid down) so that you believe in Allah and His Messenger. And these are the limits set by Allah. And for the disbelievers there is a painful punishment.

58:5.t: Surely those who oppose Allah and His Messenger shall be disgraced, just as those before them were disgraced. And We have sent down clear verses, and for the disbelievers there is a humiliating punishment

58:6.t: on the Day when Allah will raise all of them, and will tell them what they did; Allah has its full account, while they have forgotten it. And Allah is witness to everything.

58:7.t: Have you not seen that Allah knows all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth? No secret consultation takes place between three, but He is fourth of them, nor between five, but He is sixth of them, nor between fewer than that or more, but He is with them wherever they may be. Then He will tell them on the Day of Judgment what they did. Surely Allah is All-Knowing about everything.

58:8.t: Did you not see those who were forbidden from holding secret counsels, then they do again what they were forbidden to do? And they whisper for sinful act and wrongdoing and disobedience of the prophet, and when they come to you, they greet you the way Allah does not greet you, and say to themselves, "Why does Allah not punish us for what we say?" Enough for them is Jahannam (Hell); they will enter it, and it is an evil end.

58:9.t: O those who believe, when you hold secret counsel, do not whisper for sinful act and wrongdoing and disobedience of the prophet, and do whisper for righteousness and taqwa (God-fearing). And fear Allah, before whom you will be gathered together.

58:10.t: Whispering (for sinful acts) comes from the Shaitan (Satan), so that he may grieve those who believe, while it is not harmful to them in the least, except with Allah's permission. And in Allah the believers must place their trust.

58:11.t: 0 those who believe, when it is said to you, "Make room (for others) in the sittings", then make room, and Allah will make room for you (in the Hereafter). And when it is said, "Rise up", then rise up, and Allah will raise those, in ranks, who have believed and are given knowledge. And Allah is well-aware of what you do.

58:12.t: 0 those who believe, when you consult the Messenger in private, then offer something in charity before your consultation. That is better for you and purer. But if you find nothing (to offer), then Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

58:13.t: Have you become afraid of offering charities before your consultation? So when you did not do so, and Allah has forgiven you, then establish salah, and pay zakah, and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is well-aware of what you do.

58:14.t: Have you not seen who have friendship with a people with whom Allah is angry. They are neither of you nor of them. And they swear false oaths while they know.

58:15.t: Allah has prepared a severe punishment for them. Indeed, evil is what they used to do.

58:16.t: They have taken their oaths as a shield, then have prevented (people) from the way of Allah. Therefore, for them there is a humiliating punishment.

58:17.t: Their riches and their children will never benefit them against Allah. They are the people of the Fire. They will live there forever

58:18.t: (It will be) on the Day when Allah will raise all of them, and they will swear before Him as they swear before you, and will think that they have some standing. Beware that they are sheer liars.

58:19.t: The shaitan (Satan) has prevailed upon them, so he has made them forget the remembrance of Allah. They are the party of shaitan. Be sure that it is (the members of the) party of Shaitan that are the losers.

58:20.t: Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messengers, they are among the lowest.

58:21.t: Allah has written (in His pre-destined decree), "I will certainly prevail, both I and My messengers." Surely Allah is All-Strong, All-Mighty.

58:22.t: You will not find those who believe in Allah and in the Hereafter having friendship with those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even though they were their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their clan. They are such that Allah has inscribed faith on their hearts, and has helped them with a spirit from Him. And He will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will live forever. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Allah. Those are the party of Allah. Be sure that it is (the members of) the party of Allah that are the successful.

59:1.t: Allah's purity has been proclaimed by all that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth. And He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

59:2.t: He is the One who expelled the disbelievers of the People of the Book from their homes at the time of the first gathering.1 You did not expect that they would leave, and they deemed that their fortresses would protect them from Allah. But Allah came to them from where they did not expect, and cast fear in their hearts when they were spoiling their homes with their own hands and with the hands of the believers. So, learn a lesson, 0 those who have eyes.

59:3.t: And if Allah had not destined exile for them, He would have punished them in the world. And for them in the Hereafter is the torment of the Fire.

59:4.t: That is because they were hostile to Allah and His Messenger. And whoever has hostility with Allah, then Allah is severe in punishment.

59:5.t: Whatever palm-trees you have cut down, or have left them standing on their roots, it was with Allah's permission, and so that He might disgrace the transgressors.

59:6.t: And whatever fai'1 (left over property) Allah has passed on to His Messenger from them, you had not urged on your horses or camels for it, but Allah gives predominance to His messengers over whomsoever He wills, and Allah is Powerful over everything.

59:7.t: Whatever fai' Allah has passed on to His Messenger from the people of the towns is for Allah and for the Messenger, and for the kinsmen and the orphans and the needy and the wayfarer, so that it may not circulate only between the rich among you. And whatever the Messengers gives you, take it, and whatever thing he forbids you, abstain (from it). And fear Allah. Indeed Allah is severe in punishment.

59:8.t: (And fai' is especially) for the poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and properties, while they were seeking the grace of Allah and (His) pleasure, and were helping Allah and His Messenger. They are the truthful.

59:9.t: And (fai' is also for) those who established themselves in the homeland (of Madinah) and in faith before the former ones (arrived in Madinah), who have love for those who emigrated to them, and do not feel in their hearts any need for what is given to the former ones (from fai' ), and give preference to them over themselves, even though they are in poverty. And whoever is saved from the greed of his soul, then such people are the successful.

59:10.t: And (fai' is also) for those who came after them saying, "Our Lord, forgive us and those of our brothers who preceded us in faith, and do not place in our hearts any rancor against those who believe; Surely, Our Lord, you are Very-Kind, Very-Merciful."

59:11.t: Did you not see the hypocrites saying to their brothers who disbelieve from the people of the Book, "If you are expelled, we will certainly go out with you, and we will not obey any one about you. And if you are fought against, we will definitely help you." And Allah bears witness that they are pure liars.

59:12.t: If they are expelled, they will not go out with them, and if they are fought against, they will not help them. And even if they help them, they will surely turn their backs; then they will not be helped.

59:13.t: In fact, your fear in their hearts is greater than (that of) Allah. That is because they are a people who do not understand.

59:14.t: They do not fight you, even assembled together, but in fortified towns, or from behind the walls. Their battle between themselves is severe. You think that they are united, while their hearts are divided. That is because they are a people who have no sense.

59:15.t: The example (of Banu Nadir) is like those who were before them in near past, (i.e. the Jews of Banu Qainuqa' ) who tasted the evil consequence of their conduct, and for them (in the Hereafter) there is a painful punishment.

59:16.t: The example (of the hypocrites) is like the Shaitan when he says to a human being, 'Become a disbeliever" then once he disbelieves, he says, "I disown you; I fear Allah, the Lord of the worlds."

59:17.t: So the end of both of them is that they will be in the Fire, living there forever. And that is the punishment of the wrongdoers.

59:18.t: O those who believe, fear Allah, and everybody must consider what he (or she) has sent ahead for tomorrow. And fear Allah. Surely Allah is fully aware of what you do.

59:19.t: And do not be like those who forgot Allah, so He made them forget their own selves. Those are the sinners.

59:20.t: The people of the Fire and the people of the Paradise are not equal. The people of the Paradise are the successful.

59:21.t: Had We sent down this Qur'an to a mountain, you would have seen it humbled, burst apart out of awe for Allah. And such examples are cited by Us for the people, so that they may ponder.

59:22.t: He is Allah, besides whom there is no god, the Knower of the unseen and the seen. He is the All-Merciful, the Very-Merciful.

59:23.t: He is Allah, besides whom there is no god, the Sovereign, the Most Pure [ from all defects ], the Most Safe [ from all defects ], the Peace-Giver, the Guardian, the All-Mighty, the Restorer [ of the losses ], the Lord of Greatness. Pure is Allah from what they associate with Him.

59:24.t: He is Allah, the Creator, the Inventor, the Originator-Of-Shapes. His are the Most Beautiful Names. His purity is proclaimed by all that is in the heavens and the earth, and He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

60:1.t: 0 you who believe, do not take My enemies and your enemies for friends, expressing love with them, while they have rejected the Truth that has come to you, expelling the Messenger and your selves (from Makkah), merely because you have faith in Allah, your Lord, if you have set out to do jihad (struggle) in My way, and to seek My pleasure. You express love with them secretly, while I know what you have concealed and what you have revealed. And any of you who does this has missed the straight path.

60:2.t: Should they have access to you, they will become your enemies, and will stretch their hands and tongues towards you with evil; and they desire that you should reject the (True) faith.

60:3.t: Neither your womb-relations nor your children will avail you on the Day of Judgment. He will decide between you, and Allah is watchful of what you do.

60:4.t: Indeed, there is an excellent example for you in Ibrahim and those with him, when they said to their people, "We disown you and what you worship instead of Allah. We disbelieve in you. Enmity and hatred has arisen between us and you forever, unless you believe in Allah alone", - but (his example is) not (to be followed) in what Ibrahim said to his father, "I will pray to my Lord for your forgiveness, and I have no power from Allah (to do anything) for you." - "0 our Lord, in you alone we trust, and to you alone we turn for help, and to you is the final return.

60:5.t: Our Lord, do not make us persecuted by those who disbelieve, and forgive us, our Lord! You, only You, are the All-Mighty, the All-Wise."

60:6.t: Indeed, for you there is an excellent example in them, for anyone who hopes (to meet) Allah and the Last Day. And whoever turns away, then Allah is Free of all needs, Worthy of all Praise.

60:7.t: Hopefully Allah will bring about love between you and those of them with whom you have enmity. And Allah is Powerful, and Allah is Most-forgiving, Very-Merciful.

60:8.t: Allah does not forbid you from doing good and justice to those who did not fight you because of faith, and did not expel you from your homes. Surely Allah loves those who maintain justice.

60:9.t: Allah forbids you only from having friendship with those who fought you on account of faith, and expelled you from your homes, and helped (others) in expelling you. And those who develop friendship with them, it is they who are the wrongdoers.

60:10.t: O you who believe, when the believing women come to you as emigrants, put them to a test. Allah knows best about their faith. So, if you find them faithful, do not send them back to the disbelievers. Neither these (women) are lawful for them, nor are those (disbelievers) lawful for these (women). And give them (the disbelievers) that (dower) which they had paid (to these women). And there is no sin for you if you marry them, when you give them their dowers. And do not hold on to the ties of marriage with the disbelieving women, and ask (their new non-Muslim husbands to pay to you) that (dower) which you had paid (to such women), and they (the previous non-Muslim husbands of the Muslim women) should ask (their new Muslim husbands) to pay that (dower) which they had paid (to their previous wives). That is the decision of Allah. He decides between you. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

60:11.t: And if some of your (non-Muslim) wives have slipped from you, (and their present non-Muslim husbands do not pay to you the dower as aforesaid,) and you have your turn (of paying dower to the previous non-Muslim husbands of your present wives), then (instead of paying dower to them,) give those whose wives have slipped the like amount of what they had paid (to them). And fear Allah, the One in whom you believe.

60:12.t: O Prophet, when the believing women come to you, seeking bai'ah (a pledge of allegiance) with you that they will not ascribe anything as a partner to Allah, and will not commit theft, and will not commit fornication, and will not kill their children, and will not come up with a calumny that they falsely attribute between their hands and their feet, and will not disobey you in what is recognized (in Shari'ah), then effect bai'ah with them (i.e. accept their pledge) and pray Allah for their forgiveness. Surely Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

60:13.t: 0 you who believe, do not have friendship with a people with whom Allah is angry. They have despaired from the Hereafter as the infidels have despaired from those (buried) in the graves.

61:1.t: Allah's purity has been proclaimed by all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, and He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

61:2.t: 0 those who believe, why do you say what you do not do?

61:3.t: It is severely hateful in Allah's sight that you say what you do not do.

61:4.t: Surely Allah loves those who fight in His way in firm rows, as if they were a solid edifice.

61:5.t: And (remember) when Musa said to his people, "0 my people, why do you hurt me, while you know that I am a Messenger of Allah ﷺ towards you." So, when they adopted crookedness, Allah let their hearts become crooked. And Allah does not guide the sinful people.

61:6.t: And (remember) when ` Isa, son of Maryam, said, "0 children of Isra'il, I am a Messenger of Allah ﷺ towards you, confirming the Taurah that is (sent down) before me, and giving you the good news of a messenger who will come after me, whose name is Ahmad." But when he came to them with manifest signs, they said, "This is a clear magic."

61:7.t: And who is more unjust than the one who forges a lie against Allah, while he is invited to Islam? And Allah does not guide the unjust people.

61:8.t: They wish to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah is to perfect His light, even though the disbelievers dislike (it).

61:9.t: He is the One who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth, so that He makes it prevail over all religions, even though the mushriks (those who ascribe partners to Allah) dislike (it).

61:10.t: O those who believe, shall I tell you about a trade that saves you from a painful punishment?

61:11.t: (It is that) you believe in Allah and His Messenger, and carry out jihad in His way with your riches and your lives. That is much better for you, if you but know.

61:12.t: (If you do this,) He will forgive for you your sins, and will admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow, and to pleasant dwellings in gardens of eternity. That is the great achievement.

61:13.t: And (He will give you) another thing that you love: Help from Allah, and a victory, near at hand.

61:14.t: 0 those who believe, be supporters of (the religion of) Allah, just as ` Isa, son of Maryam, said to the Disciples, "Who are my supporters towards Allah?" The Disciples said, "We are the supporters of (the religion of) Allah." So a group from the children of Isra it believed, and another group disbelieved. Then We supported those who believed against their enemy, and they became victorious.

62:1.t: proclaim the purity of Allah, the Sovereign, the Supreme in Holiness, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

62:2.t: He is the One who raised amidst the unlettered people a messenger from among themselves who recites to them His verses, and purifies them, and teaches them the Book and the wisdom, although they were in an open error before.

62:3.t: And (this Messenger is sent also) to others of them who did not join them so far, and He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

62:4.t: That is Allah's bounty that He gives to whomsoever He wills, and Allah is the Lord of the great bounty.

62:5.t: The example of those who were ordered to bear (the responsibility of acting upon) the Torah, then they did not bear it, is like a donkey that carries a load of books. Evil is the example of those who have rejected the verses of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

62:6.t: Say, "0 those who are Jews, if you claim that you are the friends of Allah to the exclusion of all other people, then express your desire for death, if you are true.

62:7.t: And they will never express this desire, because of what their hands have sent ahead. And Allah is fully aware of the wrongdoers.

62:8.t: Say, "Indeed, the death from which you (try to) run away has to visit you, then you will be sent back to the Knower of the unseen and the seen, and He will tell you what you used to do.

62:9.t: O you who believe, when the call for salah (prayer) is proclaimed on Friday, hasten for the remembrance of Allah, and leave off business. That is much better for you, if you but know.

62:10.t: Then once the salah is finished, disperse in the land, and seek the grace of Allah. And remember Allah much, so that you may be successful.

62:11.t: And when they see some merchandise or amusement, they break away to it, and leave you standing. Say, “ What is with Allah is much better than the amusement and the merchandise, and Allah is the best giver of sustenance.”

63:1.t: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, “ We bear witness that you are indeed the Messenger of Allah.” And Allah knows that you are really His Messenger. And Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are actually liars.

63:2.t: They have made their oaths a shield, and thus they have prevented (others) from the way of Allah. Surely evil is what they have been doing.

63:3.t: That is because they declared their faith (apparently), then disbelieved (secretly). Therefore, a seal has been set on their hearts, and thus they do not understand.

63:4.t: And if you see them, their bodies would attract you, and if they speak, you would listen to their speech. (Yet, being devoid of substance,) it is as if they were propped up pieces of wood. They deem every shout (they hear) to be against them (out of cowardice). They are the enemy; so beware of them. May Allah destroy them. How perverted are they!

63:5.t: And when it is said to them, “ Come on, Allah’ s Messenger will pray for your forgiveness” they twist their heads, and you see them turning away in arrogance.

63:6.t: It is equal in their case, whether you pray for their forgiveness or do not pray, Allah will not forgive them. Indeed Allah does not guide the sinning people.

63:7.t: They are the ones who say, “ Do not spend on those who are with Allah’ s Messenger so that they disperse.” And to Allah belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.

63:8.t: They say, “ If we return to Madinah, the more honourable ones will drive out the meaner ones from there.” And to Allah belongs the honour, and to His Messenger, and to the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.

63:9.t: O those who believe, your riches and your children must not divert you from the remembrance of Allah. And those who do that are the losers.

63:10.t: And spend out of what We have given to you before death overtakes one of you and he says, “ My Lord, would you not respite me to a near term, and I will pay sadaqah (alms) and will become one of the righteous.”

63:11.t: And Allah will never respite anyone, once his appointed time will come. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do

64:1.t: Allah’ s purity is pronounced by all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. To Him belongs the kingdom, and for Him is all praise, and He is powerful over everything.

64:2.t: ] He is the One who created you, then some of you are disbelievers, and some of you are believers. And Allah is Watchful of what you do.

64:3.t: He has created the heavens and the earth with truth, and shaped your figures, and made your figures good, and to Him is the final return.

64:4.t: He knows all that is in the heavens and the earth, and He knows whatever you conceal and whatever you reveal. And Allah is All-Aware of what lies in the hearts.

64:5.t: Did the news of those people not come to you who disbelieved earlier, and tasted (in this world) the evil consequence of their conduct, and for them (in the Hereafter) there is a painful punishment?

64:6.t: ]. That is because their messengers used to bring them clear proofs, but they said, “ Shall some mortals give us guidance?” Thus they disbelieved and turned away, and Allah did not care. And Allah is All-Independent, Ever-Praised.

64:7.t: The disbelievers claim that they will never be raised again (after death). Say, “ Why not? By my Lord, you will be raised again, then you will be told about what you did. And that is easy for Allah.”

64:8.t: So, believe in Allah and His Messenger, and in the light We have sent down. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

64:9.t: (Be mindful of) the day He will gather you for the Day of Gathering. That will be the Day of loss and gain. And whoever believes in Allah, and does righteously. He will write off his evil deeds, and will admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, where they will live forever. That is the great achievement.

64:10.t: And those who disbelieve and reject Our signs – they are the people of the Fire. And it is an evil place to return.

64:11.t: And no calamity befalls (one), but with the leave of Allah. And whoever believes in Allah, He guides his heart. And Allah is All-Knowing about everything.

64:12.t: And obey Allah, and obey the Messenger. But if you turn away, then Our Messenger has only to convey the message clearly.

64:13.t: Allah is such that there is no god but He. And in Allah alone the believers must place their trust.

64:14.t: O those who believe, among your wives and your children there are some enemies for you, so beware of them. And if you forgive and overlook and pardon, then Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

64:15.t: Your riches and your children are but a trial. As for Allah, with Him is a great reward.

64:16.t: So, observe taqwa (total obedience to Allah in awe of Him) as far as you can, and listen and obey, and spend (in Allah’ s way), it being good for you. And those who are saved from the greed of their souls are the successful.

64:17.t: If you advance a good loan to Allah, He will multiply it for you, and will forgive you. And Allah is Appreciative, forbearing,

64:18.t: the Knower of the unseen and the seen, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

65:1.t: O prophet, when you people divorce women, divorce them at a time when the period of ‘’ iddah may start.1 And count the period of ‘iddah, and fear Allah, your Lord. Do not expel them from their houses, nor should they go out, unless they come up with a clearly shameless act. And these are the limits prescribed by Allah wrongs his own self. You do not know 9what will happen in future); it may be that Allah brings about a new situation thereafter.

65:2.t: So, when they (the divorced women) have (almost) reached their term, then either retain them with fairness, or part with them with fairness. And make two just men from among you witnesses (of your either decision). And ( O witnesses,) keep your testimony upright for the sake of Allah. That is what anyone who believes in Allah and the Last Day is exhorted to do. And whoever fears Allah, for him Allah brings forth a way out,

65:3.t: and gives him provision (of his needs) from where he does not even imagine. And whoever places his trust in Allah, He is sufficient for him. Surely Allah is to accomplish His purpose. Allah has set a measure for everything.

65:4.t: And those women from among you who have despaired of (further) menstruation, if you are in doubt, their ‘iddah is three months, as well as of those who have not yet menstruated. As for those having pregnancy, their term (of ‘iddah) is that they give birth to their child. And whoever fears Allah, He brings about ease for him in his affair.

65:5.t: This is the command of Allah that He has send down to you. And whoever fears Allah, He will write off his evil deeds, and will give him a huge reward.

65:6.t: Provide them (the divorced women) residence from where you reside according to your means, and do not hurt them to straighten (life) for them. And if they are pregnant, spend on them till they give birth to their child. Then if they suckle the child for you, give them their fees, and consult each other (for determining the fee) with fairness, and if you have a deadlock between you, then another woman will suckle him.

65:7.t: A man of vast means should spend according to his vast means. And anyone whose sustenance is limited should spend from whatever Allah has given to him. Allah makes no one liable beyond what He has given to him. Allah will soon bring ease after a difficulty.

65:8.t: And how many a township rebelled against the command of their Lord, and against His messengers, so We called them to a severe account, and punished them with an evil punishment.

65:9.t: Thus they tasted the evil consequence of their acts, and the end of their conduct was loss.

65:10.t: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment; so fear Allah 0 men of understanding who have believed! Allah has sent down to you a Reminder,

65:11.t: a messenger who recites to you the verses of Allah, making (the truth) clear, so that He may bring forth those who believe and do righteous deeds from the layers of darkness into the light. And whoever believes in Allah, and acts righteously, He will admit him to the gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein such people will live forever. Allah has made for him a good provision.

65:12.t: Allah is the One who has created seven skies, and their like from earth. The Command descends among them, so that you may know that Allah is powerful over everything, and that Allah has encompassed everything in knowledge.

66:1.t: O Holy Prophet, why do you ban (on yourself) something that Allah has made lawful for you, seeking the pleasure of your wives? And Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very Merciful.

66:2.t: Allah has prescribed (the way of) absolution from your oaths. And Allah is your protector, and He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.

66:3.t: And (remember) when the Holy Prophet told one of his wives something in secret. So, when she disclosed it (to another wife), and Allah made it known to him, he told (the disclosing wife) part of it, and bypassed another part. So when he informed her about it, she said, "Who told you about this?" He said, "It is told to me by the All-Knowing, the All-Aware.

66:4.t: ( O two wives of the Holy Prophet,) If both of you repent to Allah, then (your conduct calls for it, because) your hearts have diverted. And if you back each other against him (the Holy Prophet), then Allah is his supporter, and Jibril and righteous believers and, after all that, angels are his helpers.

66:5.t: It is hoped that, if he divorces you, Allah will give him in your place wives better than you, submissive to Allah, believing, devout, penitent, steadfast in worship, fasting, previously married and virgins.

66:6.t: O those who believe, save yourselves and your families from a fire, the fuel of which is human beings and stones, appointed on which are angels, stern and severe, who do not disobey Allah in what He orders them, and do whatever they are ordered to do.

66:7.t: 0 those who disbelieve, do not make excuses today. You will only be recompensed for what you have been doing.

66:8.t: O those who believe, turn to Allah with a faithful repentance. It is hoped from your Lord that he will write off your faults, and will admit you to the gardens beneath which rivers flow, on the Day when Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will run before them and to their right hands. They will say, "Our Lord, perfect for us our light, and forgive us. Indeed you are powerful over everything."

66:9.t: 0 Prophet, carry out jihad (struggle) against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be harsh with them. And their final abode is Jahannam (Hell), and it is an evil end.

66:10.t: Allah has cited for the disbelievers the example of the wife of Nah and the wife of Lat. Both were married with two of Our righteous slaves, but betrayed them. So they could not avail them at all, and it was said, "Enter the Fire along with those who enter."

66:11.t: And Allah has cited for the believers the example of the wife of Fir'aun (the Pharaoh), when she said, "My Lord, build for me, near You, a house in the Paradize, and deliver me from Fir'aun and his deeds, and deliver me from the unjust people.",

66:12.t: and (also the example of) Maryam, daughter of ` Imran who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her Our spirit, and she testified to the truth of the words of her Lord and His books, and she was one of the devout.

67:1.t: Glorious is the One in whose hand is the Kingdom (0f the whole universe), and He is powerful over everything,

67:2.t: the One who created death and life, so that He may test you as to which of you is better in deeds. And He is the All-Mighty, the Most-Forgiving,

67:3.t: Who has created seven skies, one over the other. You will see nothing out of proportion in the creation of the Rahman (the All-Merciful). So, cast your eye again. Do you see any rifts?

67:4.t: Then cast your eye again and again, and the eye will come back to you abased, in a state of weariness.

67:5.t: And We have decorated the nearest sky with lamps, and have made them devices to stone the devils, and We have prepared for them the punishment of Hell.

67:6.t: And for those who disbelieve, there is the punishment of Jahannam, and it is an evil end.

67:7.t: When they will be thrown in it, they will hear a terrible sound from it, and it will be boiling,

67:8.t: seeming as if it will burst out of fury. Whenever a group is thrown into it, its keepers will say to them, Had no warner come to you?"

67:9.t: They said, 'Yes, a warner had come to us, but We had rejected, and said, 'Allah has not revealed anything. You are only in great error'."

67:10.t: And they will say, "Had we been listening or understanding, we would not have been among the people of Hell."

67:11.t: Thus they will confess their sin. So, be the people of Hell away (from Allah's mercy).

67:12.t: Surely, for those who have awe of their Lord without seeing (Him), there is forgiveness and a big reward.

67:13.t: And whether you keep your talk secret or make it aloud, He knows well what lies in the hearts.

67:14.t: Is it (imaginable) that He who has created (them) will not have (such a) knowledge, while He is the Knower of the finest things, the A11-Aware?

67:15.t: He is the One who has made the earth submissive for you, so walk on its shoulders, and eat out of His provision, and to Him will be the Resurrection.

67:16.t: Have you become fearless of Him who is in the sky if He makes you sink into the earth, and it starts trembling at once?

67:17.t: Or, have you become fearless of Him who is in the sky if He looses a violent wind with stones against you? So, you will soon come to know how was My warning!

67:18.t: And of course, those before them (also) rejected (the truth). So, how was My censure?

67:19.t: Have they not looked to the birds above them spreading their wings, and (at times) they fold (them) in? No one holds them up except the Rahman (the All-Merciful). Surely He is watchful of everything.

67:20.t: Now, who is there to become a force for you to help you, except the Rahman? The disbelievers are in nothing but delusion.

67:21.t: Or, who is there to give you sustenance, if He withholds His sustenance? Still, they persist in rebellion and aversion.

67:22.t: Then, tell me whether the one who walks falling down (frequently) on his face is better guided or the one who walks on a straight path?

67:23.t: Say, "He is the One who has originated you, and made for you the ears and the eyes and the hearts. How little you pay gratitude"

67:24.t: Say, "He is the One who has scattered you on the earth, and to Him you will be assembled."

67:25.t: And they say, "When will this promise (of the Day of Judgment) be fulfilled, if you are true?"

67:26.t: Say, "The knowledge (of that day) is only with Allah, and I am only a plain warner.

67:27.t: Then, once they will see it approaching, the faces of the disbelievers will be turned awkward, and it will be said, "This is what you were calling for!"

67:28.t: Say, "Tell me, if Allah destroys me and those who are with me (as you wish), or has mercy on us (as we wish), who can (in either case) save the disbelievers from a painful punishment?"

67:29.t: Say, "He is the Rahman; we have believed in Him, and in Him we placed our trust. So, you will soon come to know who is in an open error."

67:30.t: Say, "Tell me if your water were to vanish into the earth, who will bring you a flowing (stream) water?

68:1.t: Nun, by the pen and what they write,

68:2.t: with the grace of your Lord, you are not insane.

68:3.t: And you will definitely have a reward that will never end.

68:4.t: And you are surely on exalted quality of character.

68:5.t: So, you will see, and they will see

68:7.t: Surely your Lord knows best who has strayed from his way, and He is well-aware of those who are on the right path.

68:8.t: So, do not obey those who reject (the true faith.)

68:9.t: They wish that you become flexible (in your faith), and they will become flexible (in their hostile attitude.)

68:10.t: And do not obey any contemptible one who swears much,

68:11.t: a slanderer who goes about with calumnies,

68:12.t: one who prevents good, (and who is) transgressor, sinful,

68:14.t: (do not obey such a person merely) because he is a man of wealth and sons.

68:15.t: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, " (These are) the tales of the ancient."

68:16.t: We will soon brand him on the snout.

68:17.t: We have tested them as We had tested the Owners of the Garden, when they had sworn an oath that they would pluck its fruits on the next morning,

68:18.t: and did not make any exception (by saying 'insha'Allah' ).

68:19.t: Then, there whirled around it a whirl (of calamity) from your Lord, while they were asleep.

68:20.t: Thus, on the next morning, it was like a harvested field.

68:21.t: So, they called out each other as the morning broke,

68:22.t: saying, "Set out early, if you are going to pluck (the fruits)."

68:23.t: So they set out while they were whispering to each other,

68:24.t: saying, "Let no poor man enter into it upon you today."

68:25.t: And in early hours they rushed quickly, while they were (assuming themselves) powerful (to pluck the fruits and prevent the poor.)

68:26.t: But when they saw it (the place of the ruined garden), they said, "We have missed the way."

68:27.t: (Then, once they realized that the garden is the same, but it has been destroyed, they said,) "No, but we are deprived (of the fruits)."

68:28.t: Said he who was the best among them, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not pronounce tasbih (Allah's purity)?"

68:29.t: They said, "We pronounce the purity of our Lord. No doubt, we were wrongdoers."

68:30.t: Then, (at the beginning,) they started reproaching one another;

68:31.t: (and at last,) they said, "Woe to us! In fact, we (all) were outrageous.

68:32.t: We hope that our Lord will give us in exchange something better than this. Truly we turn to Allah."

68:33.t: In this way the punishment comes. And, of course, the punishment of the Hereafter is even greater, if they but realize!

68:34.t: Surely, for the God-fearing are the gardens of bliss.

68:35.t: Otherwise, shall We make the obedient like the sinners?

68:36.t: What has happened to you? How do you judge?

68:37.t: Do you have a book in which you read

68:38.t: that for you there is what you choose?

68:39.t: Or do you have oaths sworn by Us, remaining effective up to the Day of Judgment, that you will get what you decide?

68:40.t: Ask them which of them stands surety for that.

68:41.t: Or do they have associate-gods (who have guaranteed safety for them? Then, let them bring their associate-gods, if they are true,

68:42.t: on the Day when the Shin will be exposed, l and they will be called upon to prostrate themselves, but they will not be able to.

68:43.t: With their eyes downcast, they will be enveloped by ignominy. And they used to be called upon to prostrate when they were healthy (but they did not.)

68:44.t: So, leave Me alone with those who reject this discourse. We will draw them on little by little (towards Hell) from a way they do not know.

68:45.t: And I give them respite. Indeed, My plan is firm.

68:46.t: Is it that you ask them for a fee, due to which they are burdened with debt?

68:47.t: Or do they have the (knowledge of the) Unseen, and they write it down?

68:48.t: So, remain patient with your Lord's judgment, and be not like the Man of the Fish, 2 he cried out while he was in anguish.

68:49.t: Had not a favour from His Lord come to his help, he would have been cast in the wilderness in a reproachable state.3
