68:50.t: Then his Lord chose him, and made him one of the righteous.

68:51.t: And indeed the disbelievers seem to trip you up with their glances4 when they hear the Reminder, and say, "He is a madman indeed."

68:52.t: And it is nothing else but a Reminder for all the worlds.

69:3.t: And what can let you know what the Imminent happening is?

69:4.t: Thamud and ` Ad had denied (the happening of) the Shocking Event (the Day of Judgment).

69:5.t: As for Thamud, they were destroyed by that (dreadful cry) which exceeded all limits.

69:6.t: And as for ` Ad, they were destroyed by a violent windstorm

69:7.t: that He imposed on them for seven nights and eight consecutive days, so you could see them thrown on the ground, as if they were trunks of hollow palm-trees.

69:8.t: So, do you see any remnant of them?

69:9.t: And Fir'aun (the Pharaoh) and those before him and the overthrown towns came up with evil.

69:10.t: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with an extremely severe seizure.

69:11.t: When the water overflowed (in the Deluge of Nuh), We let you (0 mankind,) board the floating ship,

69:12.t: ] so that We make it for you a reminder, and so that a preserving ear may preserve it.

69:13.t: Then, when the Trumpet will be blown for the first time,

69:14.t: ] and the earth and the mountains will be lifted and crushed into pieces with a single blow,

69:15.t: then on that Day the Happening will happen,

69:16.t: and the sky will burst apart, while it will have become frail on that day.

69:17.t: And the angels will be on its borders. And on that Day, the Throne of your Lord will be carried above them by eight (angels).

69:18.t: On that day, you will be brought forward in a way that no secret of yours will remain secret.

69:19.t: Now, as for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say (to his colleagues), "Come here, read my book.

69:20.t: I was sure that I would encounter my reckoning."

69:21.t: So he will be in a well-pleasing life

69:23.t: the fruits of which will be close at hand.

69:24.t: (It will be said to such people,) "Eat and drink with pleasure, as a reward for what you did in advance during past days."

69:25.t: As for him who will be given his book in his left hand, he will say, " Oh, would that I had not been given my book,

69:26.t: and I had never known what my account is!

69:27.t: Oh, would that it (death) had been the end of the matter!

69:28.t: My wealth has not been of any use to me.

69:29.t: My power has gone from me for good."

69:30.t: (Then it will be said to angels,) "Seize him, then put a collar around his neck,

69:31.t: then, in the blazing fire let him burn.

69:32.t: Thereafter, fasten him with a chain the measure of which is seventy hands."

69:33.t: Indeed, he did not believe in Almighty Allah,

69:34.t: and did not persuade (others) to feed the needy.

69:35.t: So, he has no friend here today,

69:36.t: nor any food except from that which flows from wounds when washing,

69:37.t: which is eaten by none but the sinners.

69:38.t: I swear by what you see,

69:39.t: and what you do not see,

69:40.t: it is surely the speech of a noble Messenger, (that he conveys from Allah).

69:41.t: and it is not the speech of a poet, (but) little you believe,

69:42.t: nor is it the speech of a soothsayer, (but) little you heed to the advice.

69:43.t: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

69:44.t: And had he forged some statements in Our name,

69:45.t: We would have certainly seized him by the right hand,

69:47.t: so no one from you would have been an impediment against it.

69:48.t: And it is a Reminder for the God-fearing.

69:49.t: And, of course, We know that among you there are deniers.

69:50.t: And surely, it is an anguish for the disbelievers.

69:51.t: And it is surely an absolute truth.

69:52.t: So, pronounce the purity of the name of your magnificent Lord.

70:1.t: A demanding person has asked for the punishment that is going to befall

70:2.t: the disbelievers, for which there is no one to avert

70:3.t: from Allah, the Lord of the stairways

70:4.t: to whom ascend the angels and the Spirit, in a day the length of which is fifty thousand years.

70:5.t: So, observe patience, a good patience.

70:8.t: (This punishment will befall) on the Day when the sky will be like dregs of oil,

70:9.t: and the mountains will be like dyed wool,

70:10.t: and no friend will ask about any friend,

70:11.t: (though) they will be made to see each other. A guilty person will desire that he may ransom himself from the torment of that day even by his sons,

70:12.t: and his wife and his brother,

70:13.t: and his kindred that sheltered him,

70:14.t: ] and all those on earth, then he may redeem himself.

70:15.t: By no means! It is the flaming fire

70:16.t: that will pull out the skin of the scalp.

70:17.t: It will call him who had turned his back and fled away (from the Truth,)

70:19.t: Indeed man is created weak in courage,

70:20.t: very upset when touched by evil,

70:21.t: and very niggard when visited by good (fortune),

70:23.t: who are regular in their salah,

70:24.t: and those in whose riches there is a specified right

70:25.t: for the one who asks and the one who is deprived,

70:26.t: and those who believe in the Day of Judgment as true,

70:27.t: and those who are fearful of the torment of their Lord -

70:28.t: - Indeed the torment of their Lord is not something to be fearless from.

70:29.t: and those who guard their private parts,

70:30.t: except from their wives and those (slave-girls) owned by their hands, because they are not to be blamed,

70:31.t: but the one who seeks (sexual gratification) beyond that, then such people are the transgressors,

70:32.t: and those who are careful about their trusts and covenants,

70:33.t: and those who are upright in their testimonies,

70:34.t: and those who take due care of their salah.

70:35.t: Those will be honored in gardens (of Jannah).

70:36.t: So what has happened to those who disbelieve that they are rushing towards you

70:37.t: from the right and from the left, in groups?

70:38.t: Does every one of them aspire to be admitted to the garden of bliss?

70:39.t: By no means! We have created them from what they know.

70:40.t: ] So, I swear by the Lord of the points of sunrise and those of sunset, We are powerful

70:41.t: to bring those better than them in their place, and We are not to be frustrated.

70:42.t: So, leave them involved in pastime and play until they encounter their Day which they are promised,

70:43.t: the Day they will come out of the graves quickly, as if they were rushing toward idols,

70:44.t: with their eyes downcast, enveloped by ignominy. That is the Day which they were being promised.

71:1.t: We sent Nulh to his people saying (to him), "Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them."

71:2.t: He said, "0 my people, I am a plain warner for you

71:3.t: to say that you must worship Allah, and fear Him, and obey me,

71:4.t: and Allah will forgive you your sins, and will defer you to an appointed term. Indeed when Allah's term comes, it is not deferred, if you only know!"

71:5.t: He said, "My Lord, I have called my people night and day,

71:6.t: but my call added only to their flight (from the truth) .

71:7.t: Whenever I called them, so that You might forgive them, they put their fingers into their ears, and wrapped their clothes around themselves, and grew obstinate, and waxed proud in extreme arrogance.

71:9.t: and then I spoke to them in public and spoke to them in private.

71:10.t: So I said, _Pray to your Lord for your forgiveness,__ Indeed He is Very-Forgiving, __

71:11.t: and He will cause the heavens to rain upon you in abundance,

71:12.t: and will help you with riches and sons, and will cause gardens to grow for you, and cause rivers to flow for you.

71:13.t: What has happened to you that you do not appreciate the Majesty of Allah,

71:14.t: while He has created you in different phases?

71:15.t: Allah has created seven heavens one upon another,

71:16.t: and has made the moon a light therein, and made the sun a lamp?

71:17.t: And Allah has caused you to grow out of the earth a perfect growth,

71:18.t: then He will send you back into it, and will bring you forth once again.

71:19.t: And Allah has made the earth a spread for you,

71:20.t: so that you may go about its broad ways."

71:21.t: And said Nuh, "My Lord, they disobeyed me, and followed him whose wealth and children added nothing to him but loss,

71:22.t: ] and they devised an enormous plan,

71:23.t: and said, "Never forsake your gods, and never forsake Wadd, nor Sawa', nor yaghuth and Ya'uq and Nasr.

71:24.t: And they have led many astray. And (0 my Lord,) let not the wrongdoers progress in anything but deviation from the right path."

71:25.t: Because of their sins, they were drowned, and then admitted into the Fire. So they found no helpers for them besides Allah.

71:26.t: And said Nuh, "My Lord, do not leave on earth even a single inhabitant from the disbelievers (surviving).

71:27.t: If You leave them (surviving), they will lead Your slaves astray, and will beget none but a sinful disbeliever.

71:28.t: My Lord, grant pardon to me, and to my parents, and to everyone who enters my home as a believer, and to all the believing men and believing women, and do not increase the wrongdoers but in ruin.

72:1.t: Say, "It has been revealed to me that a group from Jinn has listened (to the Qur’ an), and said (to their people), 'Indeed we have heard an amazing Recital (Qur'an)

72:2.t: that guides to the right way, so we have believed in it, and we will never associate a partner with our Lord.'

72:3.t: and (then the Jinns started talking to each other) that exalted is the Glory of our Lord; He has taken neither a wife, nor a son,

72:4.t: and that the fools among us used to attribute to Allah extremely wrong things,

72:5.t: and that we thought that the humans and the Jinn would never tell a lie about Allah, (therefore, we had followed them in shirk under this impression),

72:6.t: and that some people from human beings used to seek refuge with some people of the Jinn, and thus they increased them (the Jinns) in arrogance,

72:7.t: and that they (humans) thought as you (0 Jinns) thought that Allah would never resurrect anyone,

72:8.t: ] and that we sought (to reach) the sky, but we found it filled with stern guards and flames,

72:9.t: and that we used to sit at places therein to listen; but if one will (try to) listen now, he will find a flame in ambush for him,

72:10.t: and that we do not know whether it is a bad end that is intended for those on earth, or their Lord has intended for them a right thing,

72:11.t: and that some of us are (already) righteous, and some of us are otherwise, and we were on different ways.

72:12.t: And that we have now believed that we can never frustrate Allah on the earth, nor can we baffle Him by escape,

72:13.t: and that when we heard the Guiding Discourse, we believed in it; so if one believes in his Lord, he will have no fear of either any curtailment (in his reward) or any excess (in his punishment),

72:14.t: and that some of us are Muslims, and some of us are unjust; so those who submitted to Islam have found out the right path,

72:15.t: As for the unjust, they have become firewood for Hell."

72:16.t: " (And it is also revealed to me) that if they (the people of Makkah) had stood firm on the (right) way, We would have supplied water to them in abundance,

72:17.t: so that We test them thereby; and if one turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will thrust him into a severe torment,

72:18.t: and that masajids (mosques) belong to Allah; so, do not invoke anyone along with Allah,

72:19.t: and that when Allah's slave stood invoking Him, they almost rushed on him in crowds."

72:20.t: ] Say, "I invoke my Lord, and do not associate with Him anyone."

72:21.t: ] Say, "I possess no power to cause you any harm or bring you to a right way."

72:22.t: Say, "No one can ever save me from Allah, and I can never find a refuge save with Him.

72:23.t: However, (I have been given mandate) to convey (commands) from Allah, and His messages. And the one who disobeys Allah and His Messenger, for him there is the fire of Hell, wherein they will live forever.

72:24.t: (And the disbelievers will continue to deny the truth and mock at it) until when they will see what they are promised, they will know whose supporters are weaker, and whose numbers are less.

72:25.t: Say, "I do not know whether that which you are promised is near, or my Lord has appointed for it a distant term.

72:26.t: (He is the) Knower of the Unseen. So He does not let anyone know His Unseen, [ 26] except a messenger whom He chooses (to inform through revelation), and then He appoints (an

72:27.t: He appoints [angels as] watching guards before him and behind him, [so that devils may not tamper with the divine revelation,]

72:28.t: so that He knows that they (angels) have conveyed the messages of their Lord. And He has encompassed all that is with them, and has comprehensive knowledge of everything by numbers.

73:2.t: stand at night (for prayer) except a little

73:3.t: half of it, or make it a little less,

73:4.t: or make it a little more; and recite the Qur'an clearly with tartil (in a distinct and measured tone).

73:5.t: Me are going to send down to you a weighty discourse.

73:6.t: Truly, rising by night (for prayer of tahajjud) is the most effective way to subdue (one's self) and to make speech more upright.

73:7.t: Surely, in daytime, you have a lengthy work to do.

73:8.t: And remember the name of your Lord, and devote yourself to Him with exclusive devotion.

73:9.t: He is the Lord of the East and the West; there is no god but He; so take Him for (your) Guardian.

73:10.t: And bear patiently what they say, and part with them in a beautiful manner.

73:11.t: And leave Me (to deal) with the deniers, the people of luxury, and give them respite for a while.

73:12.t: Surely with Us are fetters and flaming fire,

73:13.t: and food that chokes, and a painful punishment,

73:14.t: on the Day when the earth and the mountains will quake, and the mountains will turn into a slipping heap of sand.

73:15.t: We have sent to you a messenger, as a witness over you, just as We sent a messenger to Fir'aun (the Pharaoh).

73:16.t: Then, Fir'aun disobeyed the messenger; so We seized him with a severe seizure.

73:17.t: So, if you disbelieve, how will you save yourself from a day that will turn the small boys into grey-headed old men,

73:18.t: whereby the sky will burst apart. His promise has to be fulfilled.

73:19.t: Indeed, this is a reminder; so let anyone who so wishes, adopt a way to his Lord.

73:20.t: Your Lord knows that you stand (in prayer) for nearly two thirds of the night, and (at times) for half of it, and (at times) for one third of it, and (so do) a group of those who are with you. And Allah measures the night and the day. He knows that you cannot do it regularly, therefore He turned to you in mercy. Now, recite as much of the Qur'an as is easy (for you). He knows that some of you may be sick, and others travelling in the land, seeking the grace of Allah, and yet others fighting in Allah's way. Therefore, recite as much of it as is easy. And establish salah, and pay zakah, and advance to Allah a goodly loan. And whatever good you will send ahead for your own selves, you will find it with Allah much better in condition, and much greater in reward. And seek forgiveness from Allah. Indeed Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

74:1.t: O you, enveloped in a mantle,

74:3.t: and pronounce the greatness of your Lord,

74:6.t: and do no favour (to anyone merely) to ask more (in exchange),

74:7.t: and for the sake of your Lord, observe patience.

74:8.t: For when the trumpet is blown,

74:9.t: that day will be a difficult day,

74:11.t: Leave me (to deal) with the one whom I have created lonely,

74:12.t: and I gave him extensive wealth,

74:14.t: and extended (power and honour) to him fairly well.

74:15.t: Still, he aspires that I should give him more.

74:16.t: Never! He is inimical towards Our verses.

74:17.t: I will force him to climb (the mountain) sa'ud.

74:19.t: Death onto him! How (bad) is the suggestion he has put forward!

74:20.t: Again, death unto him! How (bad) is the suggestion he has put forward!

74:21.t: Then he looked (to those around him,)

74:23.t: then turned his back, and waxed proud,

74:24.t: then said, "This is nothing but traditional magic;

74:25.t: this is nothing but saying of a mortal."

74:27.t: And what can let you know what Saqar is?

74:28.t: It neither spares (anything inside it from burning) nor leaves (any disbeliever outside).

74:31.t: And We did not make wardens of the Fire but (from among) angels, and did not fix their number but as a test for those who disbelieve, so that those who are given the Book may come to believe, and those who believe may increase in belief, and so that those who are given the Book and those who believe may not doubt (its correctness), and so that those having malady in their hearts and the disbelievers say, "What has Allah meant by this (sentence that is as strange as a) proverb?" Thus Allah lets go astray whomever He wills, and leads to the right path whomever He wills. And no one knows the hosts of your Lord but He. And this is nothing else but a reminder for mankind.

74:32.t: Truly, I swear by the moon,

74:33.t: and by the night when it goes back,

74:34.t: and by the morning when it becomes bright,

74:35.t: it (saqar: Hell) is one of the greatest things

74:36.t: as a warning to the mankind

74:37.t: ] to the one who wishes to come forward (towards good deeds) or to go back (from them).

74:38.t: Everyone will be detained (in the Hell) because of what he did,

74:39.t: except the People of the Right, (i.e. those who will be given their Book of Deeds in their right hands)

74:40.t: who will be in gardens, asking

74:43.t: They will say, "We were not among those who offered salah, (obligatory prayer)

74:44.t: and we used not to give food to the needy,

74:45.t: and we used to indulge (in mocking at the truth) along with those who indulged,

74:46.t: and used to deny the Day of Requital,

74:47.t: until when we were overtaken by that which is certain."

74:48.t: Then intercession of intercessors will not avail them.

74:49.t: So what has happened to them that they are turning away from the Reminder,

74:50.t: as if they were wild donkeys,

74:52.t: Rather, every one of them wishes that he should be given unrolled (divine) scriptures.

74:53.t: Never! But they do not fear the Hereafter.

74:54.t: Never! Indeed, this is a Reminder.

74:55.t: So, whoever so wishes may take advice from it.

74:56.t: And they will not take advice unless Allah so wills. He is worthy to be feared, and worthy to forgive.

75:1.t: I swear by the Day of Resurrection,

75:2.t: and I swear by the self-reproaching conscience, (that Resurrection is a reality.)

75:3.t: Does man think that We will never reassemble his bones?

75:4.t: Yes, We are able to reset (even) his fingertips perfectly.

75:5.t: But man wishes to go on violating Allah's injunctions (even in future) ahead of him.

75:6.t: He asks, "When will be this Day of Resurrection?"

75:7.t: So, when the eyes will be dazzled,

75:8.t: and the moon will lose its light,

75:9.t: and the sun and the moon will be joined together,

75:10.t: on that day man will say, "Where to escape?"

75:11.t: Never! There will be no refuge at all.

75:12.t: On that day, towards your Lord will be the destination (of everyone.)

75:13.t: Man will be informed of what he sent ahead and what he left behind.

75:14.t: Rather, man will be a witness against himself,

75:15.t: even though he may offer his excuses.

75:16.t: ( O Prophet,) do not move your tongue (during revelation) for (reciting) it (the Qur'an) so as you receive it in hurry.

75:17.t: It is surely undertaken by Us to store it (in your heart), and to let it be recited (by you after revelation is completed).

75:18.t: Therefore, when it is recited by Us (through the angel), follow its recitation (by concentration of your heart).

75:19.t: Then, it is undertaken by Us to explain it.

75:20.t: Never! (think that your denial of Resurrection is correct) But you like that which is immediate,

75:22.t: Many faces, that day, will be glowing,

75:24.t: ] and many faces, that day, will be gloomy,

75:25.t: realizing that a back-breaking calamity is going to be inflicted on them.

75:26.t: Never! (think that you will remain in this world forever) When the soul (of a patient) reaches the clavicles,

75:27.t: and it is said, "Who is an enchanter (that can save him?) "

75:28.t: and he realizes that it is (the time of) departure (from the world,)

75:29.t: and one shank is intertwined with the other shank,

75:30.t: then on that day, it is to your Lord that one has to be driven.

75:31.t: So (the denier of the Hereafter) neither believed, nor prayed,

75:32.t: but rejected the truth and turned away (from it),

75:33.t: then he went to his home puffed up with pride.

75:34.t: (It will be said to such a man,) Woe to you, then woe to you!

75:35.t: Again, woe to you, then woe to you!

75:36.t: Does man presume that he will be left unchecked?

75:37.t: Was he not an ejaculated drop of semen?

75:38.t: Then he became a blood-clot, then He created (him) and made (him) perfect,

75:39.t: and made from him two kinds, male and female.

75:40.t: Has He no power to give life to the dead?

76:1.t: There has come upon man a period of time in which he was nothing worth mentioning.

76:2.t: We have created man from a mixed sperm-drop to put him to a test, so We made him able to hear, able to see.

76:3.t: We have shown him the way to (let him) become either grateful or ungrateful.

76:4.t: We have prepared for the disbelievers shackles and iron-collars and a blazing Fire.

76:5.t: ] Indeed, the righteous will have a drink from a goblet, blended with (a drink from) Camphor

76:6.t: that will be a spring from which Allah's slaves will drink, making it flow (wherever they wish) profusely.

76:7.t: They (are the ones who) fulfil the vows, and fear a day whose evil (events) will be widespread,

76:8.t: and they give food, despite their love for it, to the needy, and the orphan, and the captive,

76:9.t: (saying to them,) "We feed you only for the sake of Allah; we have no intention of (receiving) either a return from you or thanks.

76:10.t: In fact, we are fearful of a day, from our Lord, that will be frowning, extremely frowning."

76:11.t: So Allah will save them from the evil of that day, and will grant them bloom and delight,

76:12.t: and will give them, in return for their patience, garden and (garments of) silk,

76:13.t: wherein they will be reclining on couches, feeling neither heat of the sun, nor intense cold,

76:14.t: and shades of gardens will be hanging low on them, and its fruits will be put entirely into their service.

76:15.t: And circulated among them will be vessels of silver, and cups that will be (as transparent as) crystals,

76:16.t: _crystals (as shining as if made) of silver, measured by those (who filled them) with due measure.

76:17.t: And they will be served with a goblet of drink blended with ginger,

76:19.t: And circling around them will be serving boys, blessed with eternal youth; when you would see them, you would take them as scattered pearls.

76:20.t: And when you will look around there, you will see the Bliss, and a magnificent realm.

76:21.t: Upon them will be garments of green sundus (a kind of fine silk), and of istabraq (a kind of thick silk). And they will be adorned by bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a pure beverage to drink.

76:22.t: (It will be said to them,) "This is a reward for you, and your effort has been appreciated."

76:23.t: Indeed we have revealed to you the Qur'an through a gradual process.

76:24.t: So, submit patiently to your Lord's decision, and do not obey any one of them who is sinner or ungrateful.

76:25.t: And pronounce the name of Allah morning and evening.

76:26.t: And in some parts of night, prostrate before Him, and pronounce His purity for long times at night.

76:27.t: In fact these people love that which is immediate, and neglect a Heavy Day ahead of them.

76:28.t: We have created them, and have made their joints strong. And whenever We will, We would replace them with others like them, a total replacement.

76:29.t: Indeed, this is a reminder; so let anyone who so wishes, adopt a way to his Lord.

76:30.t: And you will not so wish, unless Allah so wills. Indeed Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

76:31.t: He admits whomsoever He wills to His mercy. As for the wrongdoers, for them He has prepared a painful punishment.

77:1.t: (I swear) by those (winds) that are sent one after the other,

77:2.t: and by those that blow violently,

77:3.t: ] and by those that spread (clouds) all over,

77:4.t: and by those (angels) who differentiate (between right and wrong) distinctly,

77:6.t: providing excuses (for the believers) or giving warnings (to the disbelievers),

77:7.t: that which you are promised is sure to happen.

77:8.t: So, when the stars will be extinguished,

77:9.t: and when the sky will be split,

77:10.t: and when the mountains will be blown away as dust,

77:11.t: and when the messengers will be assembled at the appointed time, (then all matters will be decided.)

77:12.t: (Do you know) for which day has all this been delayed?

77:14.t: And what may let you know what the Day of Decision is?

77:15.t: Woe, that Day, to the deniers!

77:16.t: Did We not destroy the earlier people?

77:17.t: Then We will cause the later ones to follow them.

77:18.t: Thus We deal with the guilty ones.

77:19.t: Woe, that Day, to the deniers!

77:20.t: Did We not create you from a worthless fluid?

77:21.t: Then We put it in a firm place of rest

77:23.t: Thus, We did (all this with perfect) measure; so We are the best to measure.

77:24.t: Woe, that Day, to the deniers!

77:27.t: And We placed towering mountains therein, and provided you with sweet water to drink.

77:28.t: Woe, that Day, to the deniers!

77:29.t: (It will be said to them that day,) "Push on to what you used to deny.

77:30.t: Push on to a canopy (of Hell's smoke) having three branches,

77:31.t: that neither has a comfortable shade, nor is it of any use against the scorching heat.

77:32.t: It emits sparks (as huge) as castles,

77:33.t: as if they were yellowish camels.

77:34.t: Woe, that Day, to the deniers!

77:36.t: nor will they be allowed to offer excuses.

77:37.t: Woe, that Day, to the deniers!

77:38.t: (It will be said to them,) "This is the Day of Decision. We have assembled you and the earlier ones together.

77:39.t: Now, if you have a trick, use the trick against Me."

77:40.t: Woe, that Day, to the deniers!

77:41.t: Of course, the God-fearing will be amid shades and streams,

77:43.t: It will be said to them, "Eat and drink with pleasure because of what you used to do."

77:44.t: It will be said to them, "Eat and drink with pleasure because of what you used to do."

77:45.t: Woe, that Day, to the deniers!

77:46.t: " (0 disbelievers,) eat and drink for a while! You are guilty ones."

77:47.t: Woe, that Day, to the deniers!

77:48.t: And when it is said to them, "Bow down (i.e. submit to Allah's commands' ) ", they do not bow down.

77:49.t: Woe, that Day, to the deniers!

77:50.t: Now, in which discourse, after this, will they believe?

78:1.t: About what are they asking each other?

78:5.t: Again, truly, they will soon know.

78:6.t: Did We not make the earth as a floor,

78:8.t: And We have created you in pairs,

78:9.t: and made your sleep a source of rest,

78:10.t: and made the night a covering,

78:11.t: and made the day a source of livelihood.

78:12.t: And We have built seven strong (skies),

78:13.t: and created a luminous lamp (the sun).

78:14.t: ] And We have sent down from the rain-laden clouds abundant water,

78:15.t: so that We bring out there with grain and vegetation,

78:17.t: Surely the Day of Decision is an appointed time,

78:18.t: a day when the trumpet will be blown, so you will come in multitudes,

78:19.t: and the sky will be opened, so it will become as gates,

78:20.t: and the mountains will be set in motion, so they will be as mirage.

78:21.t: Surely Jahannam (the Hell) is set in ambush.

78:22.t: (It is) an abode for the rebellious people

78:23.t: who will be abiding in it for ages.

78:24.t: They will taste nothing cool in it, nor a drink,

78:26.t: ] this being a recompense in full accord (with their deeds).

78:27.t: They did not expect (to face) accounting (of their deeds),

78:28.t: and they rejected Our signs totally.

78:29.t: And everything (from their deeds) is thoroughly recorded by Us in writing.

78:30.t: "So now taste! We will never add to you anything except torment."

78:31.t: For the God-fearing there is sure achievement,

78:33.t: and buxom maidens of matching age,

78:34.t: and goblets filled up to the brim.

78:35.t: They will not hear therein any vain talk, nor lies,

78:36.t: this being a reward from their Lord, a sufficing grant,

78:37.t: (from) the Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, the All-Merciful. No one will have power to address Him,

78:38.t: on the Day when the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows. They will not speak, except the one who is permitted by the Ralhman (the All-Merciful) and speaks aright.

78:39.t: That is the Day which is sure to come. So whoever so wishes may take refuge with his Lord.

78:40.t: We have warned you of an approaching torment (that will be inflicted) on a day when one will see what his hands have sent ahead, and the disbeliever will say, "0 would that I had become dust!"

79:1.t: I swear by those (angels) who pull out (the souls of the infidels) vigorously

79:2.t: ] and by those (angels) who untie the knot (of the souls of the believers) smoothly,

79:3.t: and by those who float (in the atmosphere) swiftly,

79:5.t: then manage (to do) everything (they are ordered to do,)

79:6.t: (you will be resurrected) on the Day when the shocking event (i.e. the first blowing of the trumpet) will shock (everything),

79:7.t: followed by the next one (i.e. the second blowing of the trumpet.)

79:8.t: Hearts, on that Day, will be throbbing,

79:10.t: They say, "Are we going to be brought back to our former state (of Life)?

79:11.t: Is it when we will have turned into decayed bones?"

79:12.t: They say, "If so, that will be a harmful return."

79:13.t: So, it will be only a single harsh voice,

79:14.t: and in no time they will be (brought) in the plain (of hashr).

79:15.t: Has there come to you the narrative of Musa?

79:16.t: (Recall) when his Lord called to him in the blessed valley of Tuwa:

79:17.t: "Go to Fir'aun (the Pharaoh). Indeed, he has crossed all bounds (in making mischief).

79:18.t: And say (to him,) "Would you like to purify yourself,

79:19.t: and that I guide you to your Lord, so that you fear (Him)?"

79:20.t: So he showed him the biggest sign.

79:22.t: then he turned back, and tried hard (to refute the Messenger),

79:23.t: then he gathered (his people) and shouted

79:24.t: and said, "I am the supreme lord of yours."

79:25.t: So, Allah seized him for the deterrent punishment in the Hereafter and the present world.

79:26.t: Indeed, there is a lesson for him who fears (Allah).

79:27.t: Are you more difficult to be created or the sky? He has built it,

79:28.t: He has raised its height, then made it proper,

79:29.t: ] and darkened its night, and brought forth its daylight,

79:30.t: and, after that, He spread out the earth.

79:31.t: From it, He brought out its water and its meadows,

79:33.t: (all this) as a benefit to you and your cattle.

79:34.t: So when the Biggest Havoc will come

79:35.t: on the day when man will recall what he did,

79:36.t: and the Hell will be exposed for all who see,

79:37.t: then for the one who had rebelled,

79:38.t: and preferred the worldly life (to the Hereafter),

79:39.t: the Hell will be the abode,

79:40.t: whereas for the one who feared to stand before his Lord, and restrained his self from the (evil) desire,

79:41.t: ] the Paradise will be the abode.

79:42.t: They ask you about the Hour (the Day of Judgment) as to when it will take place.

79:43.t: In which capacity are you to tell this?

79:44.t: With your Lord is the final word about it.

79:45.t: You are only a warner for anyone who fears it.

79:46.t: The day they will see it, it will seem to them as if they did not live (in the world), but only for one afternoon or for the morning thereof.

80:1.t: He (the Holy Prophet %) frowned and turned his face,

80:2.t: because the blind man came to him!

80:3.t: And what could tell you (0 Holy Prophet about the prospects of the blind man?) May be, (if you had attended him properly,) he would have attained purity,

80:4.t: or have taken to the advice, and the advice would have benefited him.

80:5.t: As for the one who does not care (about faith),

80:6.t: ] you are anxious to pursue him,

80:7.t: while there is no blame on you, if he does not attain purity.

80:8.t: as regards the one who has come to you rushing eagerly,

80:10.t: to him you pay no heed!

80:11.t: Never! (you should never act in this way,) Indeed this (Qur’ an) is an advice.

80:12.t: So, whoever so wills, let him remember it.

80:13.t: It is (recorded) in those scripts (of the Preserved Tablet) that are honoured,

80:15.t: in the hands of those scribes

80:17.t: Death be unto the man! How ungrateful he is!

80:18.t: ] From which stuff did He (Allah) create him?

80:19.t: From a drop of semen! He created him, and designed him in due proportion,

80:20.t: ] then He made the way easy for him,

80:21.t: Later, he made him die, and put him into the grave,

80:22.t: thereafter, when He will intend, He will raise him up.

80:23.t: No! He has not yet fulfilled what He (Allah) had commanded him.

80:24.t: So, let the man look to his food,

80:26.t: then how nicely We split the earth,

80:27.t: then We grew in it grain,

80:30.t: ] and gardens, full of thick trees,

80:32.t: as a benefit for you and your cattle.

80:33.t: So when there will come the Deafening Noise,

80:34.t: the Day when one will flee from his brother,

80:35.t: and from his mother and father,

80:36.t: and from his wife and sons,

80:37.t: every one of them will have enough concern to make him careless of others.

80:38.t: Many faces, on that day, will be bright,

80:40.t: and many faces, on that day, will be stained with dust,

80:42.t: Those are the disbelievers, the nefarious.

81:1.t: When the sun will be folded up,

81:2.t: and when the stars will swoop down,

81:3.t: and when the mountains will be set in motion,

81:4.t: and when the ten-months pregnant she-camels will be abandoned,

81:5.t: and when the wild beasts will be gathered together,

81:6.t: and when the seas will be flared up,

81:7.t: and when the people will be arranged in categories,

81:8.t: and when the girl-child that was buried alive will be asked,

81:9.t: for what sin she was killed,

81:10.t: ] and when the scrolls (of deeds) will be unrolled,

81:11.t: and when the sky will be stripped off,

81:12.t: ] and when the Hell will be set ablaze,

81:13.t: and when the Paradise will be brought close,

81:14.t: then everyone will know what he (or she) has put forward,

81:15.t: So, I swear by those (stars) that recede,

81:16.t: that proceed, that withdraw from the scene,

81:17.t: ] and by the night when it departs,

81:18.t: and the morning when it starts breathing,

81:19.t: it (the Qur'an)is surely the word of a noble messenger (Jibra'il

81:20.t: the one possessing power, and a high status with the Lord of the Throne,

81:22.t: And your companion (Muhammad) is not a madman.

81:23.t: And he did see him (Jibra'il) on the clear horizon.

81:24.t: And he (the Prophet) is not stingy about (the news of) the unseen.

81:25.t: Nor is it the word of an outcast shaitan (devil).

81:27.t: It is nothing else but a message of advice for all the worlds,

81:28.t: for the benefit of any one from among you who intends to go straight.

81:29.t: And you cannot intend (to do anything) unless it is so intended by Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.

82:1.t: When the sky will be cleft asunder,

82:2.t: and when the stars will disperse,

82:3.t: and when the seas will be burst forth,

82:4.t: and when the graves will be overturned,

82:5.t: then one will know what he sent ahead and what he left behind.

82:6.t: 0 man! What has deceived you about your Gracious Lord,

82:7.t: who created you, then perfected you, then brought you in due proportion?

82:8.t: He composed you in whichever form He willed.

82:9.t: Never! (i.e. one should never be heedless towards him.) But you deny the Requital,

82:10.t: while (appointed) over you there are watchers,

82:11.t: who are noble, writers (of the deeds),

82:13.t: Surely the righteous will be in bliss,

82:14.t: and surely the sinners will be in Hell,

82:15.t: in which they will enter on the Day of Requital,

82:16.t: and they will not (be able to) keep away from it.

82:17.t: And what may let you know what the Day of Requital is?

82:18.t: Again, what may let you know what the Day of Requital is?

82:19.t: A Day when no one will have power to do anything for another! And all matters, on that Day, will belong to Allah (alone).

83:2.t: who, when they measure something to receive from people, take it in full,

83:3.t: ] and when they measure or weigh something to give it to them, give less than due.

83:4.t: Do they not think that they have to be raised up

83:6.t: the Day when all the people will stand before the Lord of the worlds?

83:7.t: Never! (i.e. they should never forget that Day.) Indeed the Record of Deeds of the sinners is in sijjin.

83:8.t: And what may let you know what sijjin is?

83:10.t: Woe that day to the deniers,

83:11.t: who deny the Day of Requital!

83:12.t: And none denies it but every sinful transgressor.

83:13.t: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, " (These are) tales of the ancients."

83:14.t: No! But that which they used to commit has covered their hearts with rust.

83:15.t: No! Indeed they will be screened off from their Lord on that Day.

83:16.t: Then they will have to enter the Hell.

83:17.t: Then it will be said, "This is what you used to deny."

83:18.t: No! The record of deeds of the righteous is in ` illiyyun.

83:19.t: And what may let you know what ` illiyyun is?

83:21.t: attended by those (angels) who are blessed with nearness to Allah!

83:22.t: Indeed the righteous will be in absolute bliss.

83:23.t: While (sitting) on thrones, they will be watching (the scenes of Paradise).

83:24.t: You will recognize on their faces the glamour of bliss.

83:25.t: They will be served with a pure sealed wine to drink,

83:26.t: the seal of which will be of musk. And in aspiring for this, the competitors should compete.

83:27.t: and it will be blended with (a drink from) Tasnim,

83:28.t: ] a spring from which will drink those who are blessed with nearness.

83:29.t: Indeed those who were guilty used to laugh at those who believed,

83:30.t: and when they passed by them, they used to wink at one another,

83:31.t: ] and when they went back to their family, they went enjoying their mockery,

83:32.t: ] and when they saw them, they said, "Surely these are the ones who have gone astray"

83:33.t: while they were not sent as watchmen over them.

83:34.t: So, today those who believed will laugh at the disbelievers.

83:35.t: While (sitting) on thrones, they will be seeing

83:36.t: whether the disbelievers have been paid back for what they used to do.

84:1.t: When the sky will split apart,

84:2.t: and will listen to (the command of) its Lord, and it ought to,

84:3.t: and when the earth will be stretched (to give room to more people),

84:4.t: and it will throw up whatever it contains, and will become empty,

84:5.t: and will listen to (the command of) its Lord, and it ought to, (then man will see the consequences of his deeds.)

84:6.t: 0 man, you have to work hard constantly to reach your Lord, then you have to meet Him.

84:7.t: So, as for him whose book (of deeds) will be given to him in his right hand,

84:8.t: he will be called to account in an easy manner,

84:9.t: and he will go back to his people joyfully.

84:10.t: As for the one whose book (of deeds) will be given to him from his back side,

84:12.t: and will enter the blazing fire.

84:13.t: He had been joyful among his people.

84:14.t: He thought he would never revert (to Allah).

84:15.t: Why not? Indeed his Lord was watchful over him.

84:16.t: So, I swear by the twilight (after sunset),

84:17.t: and by the night and what it envelops,

84:18.t: and by the moon when it develops at the full,

84:19.t: you shall certainly ascend from stage to stage.

84:20.t: So, what has happened to them that they do not believe

84:21.t: and when the Qur'an is recited to them, they do not offer sajdah (prostration)?

84:22.t: Rather, those who disbelieve deny (the truth).

84:23.t: And Allah is most aware of what they store.

84:24.t: So give him the 'good news' of a painful punishment,

84:25.t: but those who believed and did righteous deeds, for them there is a reward that will never be interrupted.

85:1.t: I swear by the sky, the one having stellar formations,

85:3.t: and by that which attends, and that which is attended,

85:4.t: cursed were the People of the Trench,

85:5.t: the (people of the) fire that was rich with fuel,

85:6.t: when they were sitting by it,

85:7.t: and were watching what they were doing with the believers.

85:8.t: And they had blamed them for nothing but that they believed in Allah, the All-Mighty, the Worthy of All Praise,

85:9.t: the One to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is witness over every thing.

85:10.t: Surely, those who persecuted the believing men and the believing women, then did not repent, for them there is the torment of Jahannam (Hell), and for them there is the torment of burning.

85:11.t: As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, for them there are gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the big achievement.

85:12.t: The seizure of your Lord is severe indeed!

85:13.t: Surely He originates (creation) and repeats (it after death).

85:14.t: And He is the Most-Forgiving, the Most-Loving,

85:15.t: the Master of the Throne, the Glorious.

85:16.t: He is ever doer of what He intends.

85:17.t: Has the come to you the story of the forces,

85:19.t: But those who disbelieve are (engaged) in denying (the truth).

85:20.t: And Allah has encircled them from all sides.

85:21.t: The reality is that it is the glorious Qur'an,

86:1.t: I swear by the sky and the Night-Comer,

86:2.t: and what may let you know what the Night-Comer is?

86:4.t: there is no human being, but there is a watcher over him.

86:5.t: So, let man consider of which stuff he is created.

86:6.t: He is created of a spouting water

86:7.t: that comes out from between the loins and the chest-bones.

86:8.t: Surely He is Powerful to bring him back

86:9.t: on a day when all the secrets will be searched out,

86:10.t: and he will have no strength (to defend), nor a supporter.

86:11.t: I swear by the sky that rains,

86:12.t: and the earth that cracks open (for plants),

86:14.t: and it is not a joke.

86:17.t: So leave the disbelievers at the moment; give them respite for a while.

87:1.t: Pronounce the purity of the name of your Most Exalted Lord,

87:3.t: and who determined a measure (for everything), then guided (it),

87:5.t: then turned it into blackening stubble.

87:6.t: We will make you recite, then you will not forget

87:7.t: except that which Allah wills. Indeed He knows what is manifest and what is hidden.

87:8.t: And We will facilitate for you (to reach) the easiest way.

87:9.t: So, extend advice (to people) if advice is useful.

87:10.t: The one who fears (Allah) will take to the advice,

87:11.t: and it will be avoided by the most wretched

87:12.t: who will enter the Biggest Fire,

87:13.t: then he will neither die therein, nor live (a life worth mentioning).

87:14.t: Success is surely achieved by him who purifies himself,

87:15.t: and pronounces the name of his Lord, then offers prayer.

87:16.t: But you prefer the worldly life,

87:17.t: while the Hereafter is much better and much more durable.

87:18.t: Indeed this is (written) in the earlier divine scripts,

87:19.t: the scripts of Ibrahim and Musa.

88:1.t: Has there come to you the description of the Overwhelming Event?

88:2.t: Many faces on that day will be humbled,

88:4.t: They will enter into the scorching fire.

88:5.t: They will be made to drink water from a boiling spring.

88:6.t: There will be no food for them except from a thorny plant

88:7.t: that will neither nourish, nor satisfy hunger.

88:8.t: Many faces on that day will be full of glamour,

88:11.t: in which they will not hear any absurd talk.

88:12.t: In it there is a running spring.

88:13.t: In it there are couches, elevated,

88:17.t: So, do they not look at the camels how they are created,

88:18.t: and at the sky, how it is raised high,

88:19.t: and at the mountains, how they are installed,

88:20.t: and at the earth, how it is spread out?

88:21.t: So, keep on preaching; you are only a preacher.

88:22.t: You are not a taskmaster set up over them,

88:23.t: but whoever turns away and disbelieves,

88:24.t: Allah will punish him with the greatest torment.

88:25.t: Surely towards Us they have to return,

88:26.t: then it is Our job to call them to account.

89:3.t: and by the even and the odd,

89:4.t: and by the night when it moves away,

89:5.t: Is there (not) in that an oath (enough) for a man of sense?

89:6.t: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with (the people) of ` Ad

89:7.t: of Iram, the men of tall pillars,

89:8.t: the like of whom were never created in the lands,

89:9.t: and (how He dealt) with (the people of) Thamud who had carved out the rocks in the Valley (of Qura),

89:10.t: and with Fir'aun (the Pharaoh), the man of the stakes,

89:11.t: all those who had rebelled in the cities,

89:12.t: and spread a lot of mischief therein.

89:13.t: So, your Lord unloosed on them the whip of torment.

89:14.t: Surely your Lord is ever on the watch.

89:15.t: As for man, when his Lord tests him, and thus gives him honour and bounties, he says, "My Lord has honoured me."

89:16.t: But when he tests him, and thus straitens his provision for him, he says, "My Lord has disgraced me."

89:17.t: No! But you do not honour the orphan,

89:18.t: and do not encourage one another to feed the needy.

89:19.t: And you devour the inheritance with a sweeping gulp,

89:20.t: and love wealth, with an excessive love.

89:21.t: No! When the earth will be crushed thoroughly to be turned into bits,

89:22.t: and your Lord will come, and the angels as well, lined up in rows,

89:23.t: and Jahannam (Hell), on that day, will be brought forward, it will be the day when man will realise the truth, but from where will he take advantage of such realisation?

89:24.t: He will say, "0 Would that I had sent ahead (some good deeds) for (this) my life!"

89:25.t: So, that day, no one can punish as He will punish,

89:26.t: nor can anyone shackle like He will shackle.

89:27.t: (As for an obedient man, it will be said to him,) "0 content soul,

89:28.t: come back to your Lord, well-pleased, well-pleasing.

90:2.t: and (0 Holy Prophet,) you are going to be allowed to fight in this city

90:3.t: and by the father and that which he begot,

90:4.t: Indeed We have created man (to live) in hard struggle.

90:5.t: Does he think that no one has power over him?

90:6.t: He says, "I have spent a lot of wealth."

90:7.t: Does he think that no one has seen him?

90:8.t: ] Did We not make for him two eyes,

90:9.t: and a tongue and two lips,

90:10.t: and showed him the two ways?

90:11.t: Yet he did not make his way through the steep course,

90:12.t: And what may let you know what the steep course is?

90:13.t: (It is) freeing of the neck of a slave,

90:14.t: or giving food in a day of hunger

90:15.t: to an orphan near of kin,

90:16.t: or to a needy person lying in dust

90:17.t: then he did not join those who believe and advise each other to be patient and advise each other to be merciful.

90:18.t: Those are the People of the Right Hand. (i.e. their books of deeds will be given in their right hands)

90:19.t: As for those who reject Our verses, they are the People of the Left Hand. (i.e. their books of deeds will be given in their left hand.)

90:20.t: Upon them will be the Fire, enveloping them with closed exits.

91:1.t: I swear by the sun and his broad light,

91:2.t: ] and by the moon when she follows him,

91:3.t: and by the day when it shows its brightness,

91:4.t: and by the night when it envelops him,

91:5.t: ] and by the sky, and the One who built it,

91:6.t: and by the earth, and the One who spread it,

91:7.t: and by the soul, and the One who made it well,

91:8.t: ] then inspired it with its (instincts of) evil and piety,

91:9.t: success is really attained by him who purifies it,

91:10.t: and failure is really suffered by him who pollutes it.

91:11.t: (The People of) Thamud denied the truth because of their transgression,

91:12.t: when rose up the one who was most wretched of them.

91:13.t: So, the Messenger of Allah said to them, "Be careful of Allah's she-camel and her right to drink."

91:14.t: But they rejected him and killed her, so their Lord sent eradicating torment upon them, and made it equal for all.

91:15.t: And He has no fear of its consequence.

92:1.t: I swear by the night when it covers (the sun),

92:2.t: and by the day when it is unveiled,

92:3.t: and by the One who created the male and the female,

92:5.t: As for the one who gives (in charity) and fears Allah,

92:7.t: We will facilitate for him the way to extreme ease (i.e. the comforts of Paradise).

92:8.t: But the one who is miser and deems himself self-sufficient,

92:10.t: for him We will facilitate the way to extreme distress.

92:11.t: And his wealth will not help him when he will fall down (into Hell).

92:12.t: Of course, it is undertaken by Us to guide,

92:13.t: ] and in Our control is the Hereafter and the worldly life.

92:14.t: So I have warned you of a blazing fire.

92:15.t: None will enter it but the wretched one

92:16.t: who rejected (the truth) and turned away (from it).

92:17.t: And saved from it will be the most God-fearing one,

92:18.t: who gives his wealth (in charity) to become purified,

92:19.t: while no one has conferred any favour on him for which he would give a return,

92:20.t: but (he gave his wealth in charity) only to seek the Countenance of his Lord, the Most High.

92:21.t: And surely he will soon be happy.

93:2.t: and by the night when it becomes peaceful,

93:3.t: your Lord (0 Holy Prophet,) has neither forsaken you, nor has become displeased.

93:4.t: And the Hereafter is much better for you than the present life.

93:5.t: And of course, your Lord will give you so much that you will be pleased.

93:6.t: ] Did He not find you an orphan, and give you shelter?

93:7.t: And He found you unaware of the way (the Shari'ah), then He guided you.

93:8.t: and He found you in need, then made you need-free.

93:9.t: Therefore, as for orphan, do not oppress him,

93:10.t: and as for the beggar, do not scold him.

93:11.t: And about the bounty of your Lord, do talk.

94:1.t: Did We not cause your bosom to be wide open for your benefit?

94:2.t: And We removed from you your burden

94:4.t: and We raised high for you your name.

94:5.t: So undoubtedly, along with hardship there is ease.

94:6.t: Undoubtedly, along with hardship there is ease.

94:7.t: So when you are free (from collective services), exert yourself (in worship),

94:8.t: and towards your Lord turn with eagerness.

95:1.t: I swear by the Fig and the Olive,

95:4.t: We have created man in the best composition,

95:5.t: then We turned him into the lowest of the low,

95:6.t: except those who believed and did righteous deeds, because for them there is a reward never ending.

95:7.t: So, what can make you, after all this, to deny the Requital?

95:8.t: Is Allah not the Greatest Ruler of all the rulers?

96:1.t: Read with the name of your Lord who created (everything),

96:2.t: He created man from a clot of blood.

96:3.t: Read, and your Lord is the most gracious,

96:4.t: who imparted knowledge by means of the pen.

96:5.t: He taught man what he did not know.

96:6.t: The fact is that man crosses the limits,

96:7.t: because he deems himself to be free of need.

96:8.t: Surely to your Lord is to return.

96:9.t: Have you seen him who forbids

96:10.t: a slave of Allah when he prays?

96:11.t: Tell me, if he is on the right path,

96:12.t: or bids to piety, (would the former still forbid him?)

96:13.t: Tell me, if he rejects (the true faith) and turns away,

96:14.t: does he not know that Allah is watching (him)?

96:15.t: No! If he does not desist, We will certainly drag (him) by forelock,

96:17.t: So let him call the men of his council,

96:18.t: We will call the soldiers of the Hell.

96:19.t: No! Never obey him, and bow down in sajdah, and come closer.

97:1.t: We have sent it (the Qur'an) down in the Night of Qadr.

97:2.t: [ 1] And what may let you know what the Night of Qadr is?

97:3.t: The Night of Qadr is much better than one thousand months.

97:4.t: The angels and the Spirit descend in it, with the leave of your Lord, along with every command.

97:5.t: Peace it is till the rising of dawn.

98:1.t: Those who disbelieved from among the People of the Book, and the polytheists, were not (expected) to desist (from their wrong beliefs) unless there came to them a clear proof,

98:2.t: a messenger from Allah who recites the purified scrolls

98:4.t: And those who were given the Book did not disagree but after the clear proof came to them,

98:5.t: while they were not ordered but to worship Allah, making their submission exclusive for him with integrity, and to establish salah and pay zakah. And that is the way of the straight religion.

98:6.t: Surely those who disbelieved from among the People of the Book and the polytheists will be in the fire of Jahannam, in which they will be living forever. Those are the worst of all human beings.

98:7.t: As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, they are the best of all human beings.

98:8.t: Their reward, with their Lord, is gardens of eternity beneath which rivers flow in which they will be abiding forever. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. That is for him who has awe of his Lord.

99:1.t: When the earth will be trembled with its quake,

99:2.t: and the earth will bring forth its burdens,

99:3.t: ] and man will say, "What has happened to it?"

99:4.t: That day it will describe all its happenings,

99:5.t: because its Lord will have so commanded it.

99:6.t: That day the people will come back (from the place of reckoning) in different groups, so that they may be shown (the fruits of) their deeds.

99:7.t: So, whoever does good (even) to the weight of a particle shall see it.

99:8.t: And whoever does evil (even) to the weight of a particle shall see it.

100:1.t: I swear by those (horses) that run snorting,

100:2.t: then those that create sparks by striking (their hoofs) on the stones,

100:3.t: then those that invade at morning,

100:4.t: and raise a trail of dust therein,

100:5.t: then enter, at the same time, into the centre of the (opposing) host,

100:6.t: man is, indeed, very ungrateful to his Lord,

100:7.t: and he himself is a witness to that fact.

100:8.t: And in his love for wealth, he is very intense.

100:9.t: Does he not then know (what will happen) when all that is contained in the graves will be overturned,

100:10.t: and all that is contained in the hearts will be exposed.

100:11.t: Surely your Lord, that day, will be fully aware of them.

101:3.t: And what may let you know what the Striking Event is?

101:4.t: (It will happen) on a day when people will be like scattered moths,

101:5.t: and the mountains will be like carded wool.

101:6.t: Then, the one whose scales (of good deeds) are heavy

101:7.t: will be in a happy life.

101:8.t: But he whose scales are light,

101:10.t: And what may let you know what that (Abyss) is?

102:1.t: You are distracted by mutual competition in amassing (worldly benefits),

102:3.t: No! (This is not a correct attitude.) You will soon know (the reality).

102:5.t: No! if you have had sure knowledge (of the Hereafter, you would not have been so distracted)

102:6.t: You will certainly see the Hell,

102:7.t: then you will see it with an eye of certainty.

102:8.t: Then you will be asked about all the pleasures (you enjoyed in the world).

103:2.t: man is in a state of loss indeed,

103:3.t: except those who believed and did righteous deeds, and advised each other for truth, and advised each other for patience.

104:2.t: who accumulates wealth and counts it.

104:3.t: He thinks that his wealth has made him eternal.

104:4.t: Never! He will certainly be thrown into the Crusher.

104:5.t: And what may let you know what the Crusher is?

104:7.t: that will peep into the hearts.

104:8.t: It will be closed on them,

105:1.t: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the People of the Elephant?

105:2.t: Has He not turned their plan into nullity?

105:3.t: And He sent upon them flying birds in flocks,

105:4.t: throwing upon them stones of baked clay,

105:5.t: and thus He turned them into an eaten-up chaff.

106:1.t: Because of the familiarity of the Quraish,

106:2.t: that is, their familiarity with the trips of winter and summer,

106:3.t: they must worship the Lord of this House,

106:4.t: who gave them food against hunger, and gave them security against fear.

107:1.t: Have you seen him who denies the Requital?

107:2.t: So he is the same one who pushes away the orphan.

107:3.t: and does not persuade (others) to feed the needy.

107:4.t: So, woe to those performers of salah

107:5.t: who are neglectful of their salah,

107:6.t: who (do good only to) show off,

107:7.t: and refuse (to give even) small gifts.

108:1.t: (0 Prophet,) surely We have given to you Al-Kauthar (a river in Paradize).

108:2.t: So, offer salah (prayer) to your Lord, and sacrifice.

108:3.t: Surely it is your enemy whose traces are cut off.

109:2.t: I do not worship that which you worship,

109:3.t: nor do you worship the One whom I worship.

109:4.t: And neither I am going to worship that which you have worshipped,

109:5.t: nor will you worship the One whom I worship.

109:6.t: For you is your faith, and for me, my faith."

110:1.t: When there comes Allah's help and the Victory,

110:2.t: and you see people entering Allah's (approved) religion in multitudes,

110:3.t: then pronounce the purity and praise of your Lord, and seek forgiveness from Him. Surely He is Ever-Relenting.

111:1.t: Perish the two hands of Abu Lahab, and perish he!

111:2.t: Neither his wealth availed him, nor what he earned.

111:3.t: He will soon enter a fire, full of flames,

111:4.t: and his wife as well, the wicked1 carrier of firewood.

111:5.t: In her neck there is a rope of twisted palm-fibre.

112:1.t: Say, "The truth is: Allah is One.

112:2.t: Allah is Besought of all, needing none.

112:3.t: He neither begot anyone, nor was begotten.

112:4.t: And equal to Him has never been any one."

113:1.t: Say, "I seek refuge with the Lord of the daybreak

113:2.t: from the evil of everything He has created,

113:3.t: and from the evil of the dark night when it penetrates,

113:4.t: and from the evil of the women who blow on the knots,

113:5.t: and from the evil of an envier when he envies.

114:1.t: Say, "I seek refuge with the Lord of mankind,

114:4.t: from the evil of the whisperer who withdraws (when Allah's name is pronounced),

114:5.t: the one who whispers in the hearts of people,

114:6.t: whether from among the Jinn or Mankind.
